headline: Faulkner hits 16 off last over's 1st 3 balls to win BBL game
body: Hobart Hurricanes' Australian cricketer James Faulkner hit Perth Scorchers' Andrew Tye for two sixes and a four on the first three balls of the final over to claim a win for his side on Friday. Faulkner ended up scoring 28 runs in 20 balls. Earlier in the match, Faulkner had picked three wickets with his first seven balls.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Court grants divorce via WhatsApp as husband in Nagpur, wife in US
body: A Nagpur family court granted divorce to a couple after recording the wife's consent via a WhatsApp video call on Monday. The 35-year-old woman is living in the US on a student visa while her 37-year-old husband, who also worked in Michigan, was visiting his hometown Nagpur. The court asked the man to pay lump-sum one-time alimony of ₹10 lakh.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Indians are very good trade negotiators: Trump at Diwali function
body: During Diwali celebrations at the White House on Tuesday, US President Donald Trump said Indians are "very good negotiators," while adding US-India trade talks are "moving along". Trump also said these were the "best times we\'ve ever had for the India-US relationship" and that he was grateful for his friendship with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
author: Animesh Choudhary

headline: Steam-propelled spacecraft prototype can mine water, run 'forever'
body: NASA-backed researchers have designed a spacecraft prototype that can propel between several celestial objects using steam. The World Is Not Enough (WINE) spacecraft can theoretically explore "forever", as long as water and sufficiently low gravity is present, researchers said, adding, "We could use this technology to hop on the Moon, Ceres, Europa, Titan, Pluto, the poles of Mercury, asteroids."
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: UGC stopping scholarship grants to researchers: Mamata
body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday accused the University Grants Commission (UGC) of stopping scholarship grants to researchers for PhD projects under National Eligibility Test (NET) in the state. The CM added, "Many representatives of universities and colleges have also informed that they (the UGC) are regularly issuing \'fatwa\' on different issues." She said, "This is not proper".
author: Shashank Verma

headline: British store sells packets of 'nothing' for Valentine's Day at £1
body: A British retail chain named Poundland is selling packets of 'nothing' for Valentine's Day as a gifting option for £1 (nearly ₹100) per unit. The product consists of an empty plastic heart in a packaging with the taglines, 'exactly what you asked for' and 'less is more'. Poundland has called the product 'just a bit of fun'.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Congress govt in MP is running at our ‘mercy’: BJP leader
body: BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya on Wednesday said that the Congress government in Madhya Pradesh "is being run because of our mercy". "The day, a sneeze comes to Delhi people (a reference to central leadership), our government will be formed in the state,” he added. Reacting to Vijayvargiya’s statements, Congress said the BJP is insulting the mandate given by voters.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Mumbai Police tweets road safety meme from Ranveer's 'Gully Boy'
body: Mumbai Police has tweeted a meme which uses a scene from Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt starrer \'Gully Boy\'. The meme incorporates the dialogue \'Mar jayega tu (You\'ll die)\' said by Alia as a response to \u200bthe caption \'When he argues to ride a motorcycle without wearing helmet #SillyBoy\'. "This twitter handle deserves applauds for creativity," a user commented.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: India Today anchor accused of sexual misconduct, denies claims
body: Vidya Krishnan, a former health editor at The Hindu, has accused India Today\'s Executive Editor Gaurav Sawant of sexual misconduct during an assignment in 2003. Krishnan claimed Sawant "unzipped" his pants and tried "to force her hand towards his penis" during the trip. However, Sawant called the allegations "irresponsible, baseless, and completely false" and said he would take legal action.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Man kills father for not giving share from retirement funds
body: A 22-year-old man and his two sisters have been arrested in Telangana after the man allegedly killed his father by attacking him with a rod for refusing to share his retirement funds. The deceased, who had a total of ₹16 lakh, had kept ₹2 lakh and distributed the rest among the siblings. However, his son kept demanding more money.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Video: Scientists create simulation of Milky Way black hole
body: Scientists have created a 360-degree virtual reality (VR) simulation of the black hole in the centre of the Milky Way known as Sagittarius A*. They used cutting-edge astrophysical models of the black hole to create the simulation, which can be viewed on all VR devices. "These new visualisations are just the start, more to come in the future," researchers said.
author: Shifa Naseer

headline: Filmmakers promised me amount like ₹5,000 but I never got it: Shah
body: Naseeruddin Shah has revealed he has worked for free in many projects while adding, "A lot of times I was promised chicken feed amount like ₹5,000, ₹10,000." However, he said these "so-called filmmakers" never paid him that amount. Naseeruddin further added, "Some cynical friends used to say they want me in their films because I\'m ready to work for free."
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Diver swims with 20-foot white shark off Hawaii; picture goes viral
body: A 20-foot-long shark, believed to be the largest recorded great white shark, was spotted off Hawaii coast near a dead sperm whale on Tuesday. "We saw a few (tiger sharks)...she came up and all the other sharks split...she started brushing up against the boat," said diver Ocean Ramsey on her viral photo, adding the "shockingly wide" shark may be pregnant.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Festering boil on leg worsening Lalu's health: RIMS doctor
body: The doctor at Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences (RIMS), who\'s taking care of RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav, on Sunday said that Lalu\'s health has deteriorated due to a festering boil on his right leg. "It will take some time for the infectious boil to heal," the doctor said. Lalu is currently lodged in a paying ward of the RIMS.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Indigenous groups in Sikkim demand national citizen register
body: Several indigenous groups in Sikkim have demanded the implementation of the National Register of Citizens and the introduction of Inner Line Permits to curb the "influx of illegal migrants". "The need of the hour is to check the ever-growing and uncontrolled influx," Sikkim Indigenous Lepcha Tribal Association said, alleging that there are "thousands of people with dubious citizenship on record".
author: Ayushi Ahluwalia

headline: Corrupt political families ganged up against PM: Ram Madhav
body: BJP General Secretary Ram Madhav on Sunday said that all corrupt political families have ganged up against Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He added, "In the rally of Kolkata, they accepted that they have come together but do not have any plan." He further said that the BJP will launch campaign for the upcoming Lok Sabha and Assembly polls in Jammu.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Kangana's 'Manikarnika' to be screened for President Kovind
body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday will attend a special screening of Kangana Ranaut starrer \'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi\' at Rashtrapati Bhavan. "Our...team is...looking forward to present \'Manikarnika\'...to the most important entity of the Republic of India, our Hon\'ble President," Kangana said. The film, which is co-directed by Kangana, also features Ankita Lokhande and Danny Denzongpa.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Juventus defeat AC Milan as Ronaldo scores 6th goal in 7 matches
body: Five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo netted his sixth goal in seven matches as Juventus defeated AC Milan 2-0 in the Serie A on Sunday. Mario Mandžukić opened the scoring for Juventus in the eighth minute before Ronaldo netted the second goal in the 81st minute. Juventus are on top of Serie A with 34 points in 12 matches.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: WhatsApp Co-founder to sell 10 Porsches, doesn't have time to drive
body: WhatsApp Co-founder Jan Koum is selling his 10 Porsche cars at a US auction on March 8 this year. "If I had unlimited time and unlimited garage space, I would never sell any of them," said Koum. The cars include a trio of yellow Carrera RS models and a 2015 Porsche 918 Spyder Weissach which has covered only 32 kilometres.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: 68-yr-old man sexually assaults 3-yr-old girl in Tamil Nadu, arrested
body: A 68-year-old man, identified as Rethinam, was arrested for sexually assaulting a three-year-old girl after taking her to his house in Tamil Nadu. On complaint by the girl's parents, police registered a case against the man under POCSO Act and the recently amended section of 376(AB) of IPC. The section recommends rigorous imprisonment for minimum 20 years to the accused.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Ex-Pak Prez calls Imran Khan 'accidental, selected Prime Minister'
body: Former Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari has called PM Imran Khan an "accidental, selected Prime Minister" and told him \'to learn how to govern a country\'. Zardari added no one accepts the results of last year\'s general elections and claimed that Khan will not be able to complete his full five-year term.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: David Warner, banned from IPL 2018, retained by SRH for 2019 season
body: Banned Australian cricketer David Warner, who is currently serving one-year ban from domestic Australian cricket and international cricket over ball-tampering scandal, has been retained by SunRisers Hyderabad for IPL 2019. Notably, Warner and Steve Smith were barred from playing in the Indian Premier League last season despite being eligible to participate. SRH have retained 17 players from last year's squad.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: 3 killed, 10 injured in blast at Nirankari Bhawan in Amritsar
body: At least three people have been killed and 10 others have been injured in a blast at a Nirankari Bhawan in Amritsar's Rajasansi. The explosive was reportedly thrown by two bike-borne men, who witnesses said had their faces covered. One of the witnesses said the two attackers also had an assault rifle.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Sri Lankan MPs pass no-confidence motion against Rajapaksa
body: The Sri Lankan Parliament on Wednesday passed a no-confidence motion against the government headed by Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, effectively removing the leader and his cabinet from their posts. The Parliament was meeting for the first time since October 26, when President Maithripala Sirisena sacked Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and appointed former President Rajapaksa in his place.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Former Gwalior mayor Sameeksha Gupta quits BJP
body: Former Gwalior mayor and BJP leader Sameeksha Gupta on Tuesday announced that she has quit the party and will be contesting the Assembly elections in Madhya Pradesh independently. "Dedicated party workers are being ignored. So I have resigned from the party," she said. Gupta has already filed the nomination from Gwalior (South) as an independent candidate.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Talks to buy Jet Airways preliminary, no proposal yet: Tata Sons
body: Tata Sons on Friday said that it is in preliminary talks with Jet Airways but has not made a proposal to acquire a stake. Reports have said that the government sought Tata Sons' help to rescue the cash-strapped airline. Shares of Jet Airways rose 8% to close at a near 5-month high on Friday, ahead of Tata's statement.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Digital payments platform Instamojo raises ₹50-crore funding
body: Bengaluru-based digital payments and e-commerce platform Instamojo has raised about ₹50 crore ($7 million) in a Series B funding round. Investors including Japanese payments firm AnyPay, Kalaari Capital, BEENEXT and Japan's Gunosy Capital participated in the round. Founded in 2012, Instamojo provides payments solutions, business tools, and connections to micro, small and medium enterprises.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Krunal hands blank cheque to family of hospitalised ex-cricketer
body: All-rounder Krunal Pandya has handed a blank cheque to the family of hospitalised ex-India cricketer Jacob Martin. "Sir, please fill up whatever is needed, but nothing less than ₹1 lakh," Krunal told ex-Baroda Cricket Association secretary Sanjay Patel, who is facilitating all the help for Martin\'s family. Martin is currently on ventilator after injuring his lungs in a road accident.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: BPL team players wear jerseys with their mothers' names in match
body: Bangladesh Premier League side Rajshahi Kings\' players and officials wore jerseys with their mothers\' names during their match against Dhaka Dynamites on Wednesday. In a press release, the franchise said that it was done to remember the everlasting presence of the "heart of kings". "Bearing mothers\' names on jerseys does not need any special occasion or day," it added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: We're with you: Trump to kin of murdered Indian-origin policeman
body: Talking to the brother of Indian-origin police officer Corporal Ronil Singh who was allegedly killed by an illegal immigrant last month, US President Donald Trump said, "We\'re with you." "He was so beloved by the people of the department and beyond", Trump added. Trump\'s remarks came as he demanded funds to build the US-Mexico border wall to stop illegal migration.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: headline
body: body
author: author

headline: Govt asks RBI to transfer excess reserves for FY17, FY18
body: The government has asked the RBI to transfer its entire surplus for the last two years as it seeks to meet revised budget goals for FY19 and FY20. It has asked RBI to pay ₹13,190 crore for FY17 and ₹14,190 crore for FY18. This comes before the RBI reserves surplus committee, headed by former Governor Bimal Jalan, submits its report.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Underworld don Ravi Pujari arrested in West Africa: Report
body: Underworld don Ravi Pujari, who allegedly made extortion demands to Bollywood personalities between 2009 and 2013, has reportedly been arrested from West African country of Sénégal. The gangster, who has been on the run for over a decade, is wanted in India in a number of cases including extortion, kidnapping and murder.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Cong wins Ramgarh bypoll in Rajasthan, takes total to 100 seats
body: Congress candidate Shafia Zubair won the Ramgarh Assembly seat in Rajasthan, by defeating BJP's Sukhwant Singh with a margin of 12,228 votes in the bypoll. With this victory, Congress has taken its total to 100 seats in the 200-member assembly. The election to the Ramgarh seat was delayed due to the death of sitting MLA and BSP candidate Laxman Singh.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Passenger finds cockroach in Air India meal; airline apologises
body: A passenger of Air India\'s Bhopal-Mumbai flight on Saturday complained that he found a cockroach in idli-vada-sambar he was served during the flight. Following the complaint, the airline on Monday apologised to the passenger and said it has initiated "corrective action internally". "Our senior officials are in touch with the aggrieved passenger," Air India tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Gratuity limit increased from ₹10 lakh to ₹20 lakh
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday announced that the gratuity limit has been increased from ₹10 lakh to ₹20 lakh. "High growth and formalisation of economy has resulted in increased EPFO membership by 2 crore in last two years," Goyal said. He added that the government contribution to the New Pension Scheme has been increased by 4% to 14%.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Apple to cut some iPhones' prices outside US over strong dollar
body: Apple CEO Tim Cook said the company plans to lower some iPhones\' prices in markets with currencies that weakened against the US dollar in the past year. "We’ve decided to go back to (iPhone prices) more commensurate with...local prices...a year ago," Cook added. The price cuts, in hopes of increasing sales, are reportedly occurring for second time in 12 years.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Out of love we call Siddaramaiah our leader: K'taka Cong Prez
body: Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee chief Eshwar Khandre on Monday said that it is "out of love" that the party considers former CM Siddaramaiah as their leader. "We\'ve already clarified that HD Kumaraswamy is the CM," he added. This comes after Kumaraswamy recently threatened to step down when asked about Congress MLAs\' comments that Siddaramaiah was their CM.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Philippines tops daily internet use in world at 10 hrs: Report
body: The Philippines has topped the global internet usage index with an average of ten hours and two minutes spent on the internet across devices per day, according to a report by HootSuite and We Are Social. India reportedly recorded an average daily internet use of nearly eight hours. The worldwide average usage was over six hours, the report added.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: No human interference in tax verification and scrutiny in 2 yrs: FM
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal while presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 said that almost all assessment and verification of income tax returns will be done without any human interference within nearly two years. The returns will be assessed electronically by an anonymised tax system, Goyal said. The move will end any intervention by tax officials in filed returns, he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: India's unemployment rate hit 45-year high in 2017-18: Report
body: India's unemployment rate rose to a 45-year high of 6.1% during 2017-2018, the Business Standard reported quoting an unreleased government survey. It reportedly showed that joblessness stood at 7.8% in urban areas compared with 5.3% in rural areas. Notably, two remaining independent members of the National Statistical Commission quit Wednesday allegedly due to the non-publication of jobs data.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: No regrets: Statistician who quit over delay in job statistics report
body: PC Mohanan, 63-year-old former acting Chairman of National Statistical Commission (NSC), who quit from his post on January 28 in protest over a delay in releasing a new set of jobs statistics, said he has "no regrets". Three days after he quit, reports claimed India\'s unemployment rate during 2017-2018 rose to 6.1%, the highest in at least 45 years.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: I will initiate appeal process: Mallya after UK clears extradition
body: After the UK Home Secretary cleared his extradition to India, beleaguered liquor baron Vijay Mallya tweeted, "After the decision was handed down on December 10, 2018, by the Westminster Magistrates\' Court, I stated my intention to appeal." "I could not initiate the appeal process before a decision by the Home Secretary. Now I\'ll initiate the appeal process," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Hindu Mahasabha's site hacked for firing at Gandhi ji's effigy
body: The website of Akhil Bharatiya Hindu Mahasabha has purportedly been hacked by \'Kerala Cyber Warriors\' after the outfit\'s members fired at Mahatma Gandhi\'s effigy. The hackers wrote "Hindu Mahasabha Murdabad" on the site. While the text below the image of the incident on the site read, "Arrest this hippopotamus and her goons under sedition charge as soon as possible."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Iran unveils long-range cruise missile on revolution anniversary
body: Iran has unveiled a surface-to-surface missile with a range of more than 1,350 kilometres during celebrations marking the 40th anniversary of the 1979 Islamic revolution. The missile named Hoveizeh is from the Soumar family of cruise missiles, which were unveiled in 2015, Iran's Defence Minister Amir Hatami said during the unveiling ceremony.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: It's absolutely huge: Murray on 'get well soon' teddy bear gift
body: Three-time Grand Slam champion Andy Murray took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with a \'get well soon\' teddy bear, which was gifted to him by fellow tennis players Stanislas Wawrinka and Donna Vekic. "It\'s absolutely huge...my kids will be fighting over this when I get home!" wrote Murray, who is recovering from a hip resurfacing surgery.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Drug lord El Chapo drugged and raped 13-yr-old girls, claims witness
body: Drug lord Joaquín Guzmán Loera, known as El Chapo, routinely raped girls aged as young as 13, sometimes drugging them by placing "a powdery substance" into their drinks, a witness claimed. He once ordered his henchmen to destroy the bodies of two of his enemies in a bonfire, prosecutors alleged. Guzmán\'s lawyer issued a statement saying, "Joaquín denies the allegations."
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Spectator gets hit on face by six, returns with ice pack and beer
body: Brisbane Heat wicketkeeper Jimmy Peirson slammed a six off Hobart Hurricanes' James Faulkner which ended up hitting a spectator on his face. The spectator was hit on the face while attempting to catch the six in the 17th over, however, he escaped injury. The fan was seen in the last over, applying ice pack to his forehead and drinking beer.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Next time, elect CM who can speak Odia: Amit Shah in Odisha
body: Addressing a rally in Odisha, BJP President Amit Shah urged the people to elect a CM who can speak Odia language. "It\'s a matter of respect for Odia language," he added. Further, taking a dig at CM Naveen Patnaik, Shah said, "If the CM doesn\'t even know the language, does he have the right to govern the state?"
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Shami was ranked 56th before Aus, NZ series, now ranked 30th
body: Indian pacer Mohammad Shami, who was ranked 56th after the last ODI he played before the ODI series in Australia and New Zealand, is now ranked 30th following his performances in Australia and New Zealand. Shami was named the Player of the Tournament in the recently-concluded ODI series against New Zealand after he picked up nine wickets in the series.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Bihar man held for obscene tweet against Priyanka Gandhi
body: A man was arrested for posting an obscene tweet against Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra in Bihar's Katihar, police said. The Bihar Police cyber cell had received an emailed complaint from a social activist about a tweet that carried a morphed image of Vadra, police added. The cyber cell traced the man and arrested him later, police said.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Govt moves SC against Delhi HC order over Oxytocin ban
body: The government has approached the Supreme Court contesting Delhi High Court\'s decision which set aside government\'s notification imposing a ban on manufacture and sale of Oxytocin by private companies. The Delhi High Court had in December 2018 quashed the Centre\'s decision calling it "arbitrary and unreasonable". Oxytocin is a drug which induces labour and controls bleeding during childbirth.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Opposition need not project PM face: Sharad Pawar
body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief Sharad Pawar on Tuesday said there\'s no need to think about the prime ministerial candidate of the proposed grand alliance of opposition parties before 2019 polls. "We (UPA) hadn\'t declared a candidate before...2004 election. But we managed to give...successful government for 10 years," he added. He further said BJP had failed to keep its promises.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Bihar Board bans students from wearing shoes, socks in exam centre
body: Bihar Board has banned the students appearing for Class 10 and Class 12 examinations from wearing socks and shoes when they sit for examinations being held in February. "For every 25 candidates, one invigilator has been assigned to prevent cheating in the examinations," Bihar Board PRO Rajeev Dwivedi said. This year, the board has prepared 10 sets of question papers.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: CBI should do its job in a non-political manner: Patnaik
body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday said that CBI should “do a professional and non-political job”. Further, he added, “No one from TMC has been in contact with us for...a year.” This comes after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said she will consult Patnaik and other leaders before calling off her dharna opposing CBI’s action against Kolkata Police chief.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Bengal situation like Emergency days: Former PM Deve Gowda
body: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda has said the situation in West Bengal is similar to that of the Emergency days. He added, "I am shocked learning about the CBI rushing to arrest the Police Commissioner and subsequent developments in West Bengal." He further said that the country has faced similar kind of "unconstitutional methods" during the Emergency.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Kuldeep is our frontline number one overseas spinner: Ravi Shastri
body: India head coach Ravi Shastri has said Chinaman Kuldeep Yadav is now India\'s frontline number one overseas spinner. "Going ahead, if we have to play one spinner [in Tests], he is the one we will pick. There is a time for everyone," he added. Shastri revealed that he was "very impressed" with the way Kuldeep bowled in the Sydney Test.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Nothing more shameful for democracy than CM on dharna: Yogi
body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said nothing can be more shameful for a democracy than a Chief Minister (Mamata Banerjee) sitting on a dharna. Addressing a rally in West Bengal\'s Purulia, he accused the state of indulging in "undemocratic activities". He said he had to take the road to reach Purulia as his chopper wasn\'t allowed to land.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Most difficult thing is to play your own self on screen: SRK
body: Shah Rukh Khan has said that the most difficult thing is to play "your own self" on the silver screen. "Characters are quite different from roles. I feel nice when people make me do what I can\'t," he added. "People ask [me], \'Did you ever think you would reach this level of stardom\' and I say, \'never\'," he further said.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: UP CM to travel to WB by road after not allowed to land chopper
body: Two days after he was denied permission to land his chopper in West Bengal\'s South Dinajpur district for addressing political rallies, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has decided to travel by road to the state. "How is the \'khauf\' (fear)?" BJP leader Mohsin Raza said in an apparent dig at West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on CM Yogi\'s visit.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Insulin-producing cells to help cure type 1 diabetes grown
body: University of California, San Francisco researchers have claimed to be the first to turn human stem cells into mature, insulin-producing cells that could help develop cure for type 1 diabetes.  The lab-grown cells act like pancreatic beta cells that produce insulin in humans, a researcher said. Type 1 diabetes destroys insulin-producing pancreas cells thus potentially causing severe organ damage.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: I felt like worst captain on planet: SA's Miller on 2nd T20I vs Pak
body: South Africa stand-in captain David Miller has said that he felt like "the worst captain on the planet" during Pakistan\'s chase in the second T20I on Sunday. "I didn\'t know what to do, to be honest," he added. Chasing a target of 189, Pakistan were 147/1 at one stage and eventually lost by seven runs despite Babar Azam scoring 90(58).
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Won't have time to direct George Fernandes biopic: Shoojit
body: Filmmaker Shoojit Sircar said he will not have time to direct \'Thackeray\' writer Sanjay Raut\'s upcoming biopic based on former Defence Minister George Fernandes, who passed away on Tuesday. "I\'m currently very busy with...prep work on my next projects," Shoojit explained. While announcing his plans to make the biopic, Sanjay Raut had said he wanted Shoojit to direct the film.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Batting collapse in 4th Ind-NZ ODI was an aberration: Bangar
body: Batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that Team India\'s batting collapse in the fourth New Zealand-India ODI was an \'aberration\' and that India\'s middle-order has delivered in the past. "We know we played well below our potential and our expected levels, the boys realise it and we just need to put that game behind and look to...next game," Bangar added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Bernard Tomic deliberately damaging Australian tennis: TA head
body: Tennis Australia (TA) chief Craig Tiley has said that Australian tennis player Bernard Tomic is \'deliberately trying to damage [the] culture\' of Australian tennis. "We expect players to be respectful of the sport and each other... Bernard does not meet the standards of behaviour and commitment to himself, the team or the sport," Tiley added about Tomic.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: US boy calls 911 to ask 'what is 3/4 + 1/4', gets help
body: A US boy who was having trouble solving 3/4 + 1/4 called 911 to find the answer. Emergency dispatcher Antonia Bundy, who responded to the call, helped the boy with his math homework. The boy, who told Bundy that he was "bad at fractions", later said, "I\'m sorry for calling you, but I really needed help."
author: Ankush Verma

headline: 6 cr free LPG connections provided under Ujjwala Yojana: FM
body: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said that over 6 crore free LPG connections have been given out under the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY). The government will complete the target of 8 crore free LPG connections by next year, he added. PMUY was launched to safegaurd women's lives by providing them clean cooking fuel.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Comedian Seinfeld sued for selling fake $1.5-mn vintage car
body: A company sued comedian Jerry Seinfeld for allegedly selling them a 1958 Porsche 356 A 1500 GS/GT Carrera Speedster, a vintage car worth $1.54 million, which turned out to be fake. The lawsuit states Seinfeld intentionally misrepresented the authenticity of the car. It further claims that Seinfeld promised to pay the company back but never followed through with the refund.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Digital driving assistant startup Kruzr raises over ₹9 crore
body: Digital driving assistant startup Kruzr has raised $1.3 million (around ₹9.5 crore) in a recent round of seed funding, led by Indian VC firm Saama Capital. "Road accidents cause over 1.3 million deaths globally every year", said Co-founder and CEO Pallav Singh, adding Kruzr is "building technology to minimise these accidents and help make motor insurance truly preventive".
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Wanted to commit suicide after my morphed pics surfaced: Jaya Prada
body: Recalling the 2009 incident when her morphed pictures were circulated, actor-politician Jaya Prada said, "I was crying and saying I don\'t want to live anymore, I want to commit suicide. I was going through that trauma and no one supported me." Prada, who was part of Samajwadi Party then, had alleged fellow party leader Azam Khan was behind the incident.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Bigg Boss 11 winner Shilpa Shinde may join Congress: Reports
body: Television reality show Bigg Boss 11 winner Shilpa Shinde may join Congress, several reports citing sources from the party said on Tuesday. However, the 41-year-old actress refused to comment on the reports. Shilpa Shinde's father Satyadev Shinde was a High Court judge, who reportedly passed away in 2013.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Anil Ambani's RCom moves bankruptcy court to resolve debt burden
body: Reliance Communications on Friday said it will seek fast track resolution through National Company Law Tribunal in Mumbai for its debt crisis. The Anil Ambani-controlled company owed banks $7 billion as of March 2017, when it last made its debts public. Last September, Anil Ambani had announced that RCom would shut its telecom business to focus on real estate.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Demonetisation made homes affordable for youth: PM Modi
body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said his government\'s demonetisation decision made houses affordable for the aspiring youth. He added decisions like demonetisation and RERA have put a check on black money that used to be "parked in the real estate sector". He said \'UDAN\' (Ude Desh ka Aam Nagrik) scheme has boosted the development of the country\'s aviation sector.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Govt revises growth for demonetisation year from 7.1% to 8.2%
body: The government on Thursday revised the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate upwards from 7.1% to 8.2% for 2016-17, the year of demonetisation. The new data released by the Statistics Ministry also shows the GDP growth at 7.2% in 2017-18, up from 6.7% estimated earlier. Notably, the government had pegged the growth rate for the ongoing financial year at 7.2%.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Terrorists execute J&K woman, share video on social media
body: Terrorists shot dead a 25-year-old woman and circulated a video of the act, Jammu and Kashmir Police said. The body of the woman, who was reportedly closely related to Al-Badr commander Zeenat-ul-Islam, was found alongside a letter claiming she worked with security forces. The 10-second video, which showed her pleading for mercy with folded hands, was shared widely online.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: MHA asks WB govt to take disciplinary action against Rajeev Kumar
body: Home Ministry has asked West Bengal government to initiate disciplinary proceedings against Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar for sitting on dharna with political parties. This comes after Supreme Court said CBI cannot take any coercive action against Kumar in connection with chit fund scams. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee started the dharna to protest CBI's move to raid Kumar's residence.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Woman kills daughter with lover's help to hide affair; held
body: A woman and her lover have been arrested for allegedly killing her 11-year-old daughter in Haryana's Karnal. The woman, who had separated from her husband, feared that her daughter may tell the husband about her affair, police said. Following the alleged murder, the body of the deceased was put in a plastic bag and dumped near a canal, police added.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: SC verdict on police chief a moral victory for CBI: Prasad
body: Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday termed the Supreme Court verdict on Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar a "moral victory for CBI". "Lakhs of small investors were cheated [in the scams]. Is it not our moral obligation for an investigation?" he added. The apex court on Tuesday \ndirected Rajeev to appear before CBI and cooperate with it.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Thackeray writer to make biopic on ex-Defence Minister Fernandes
body: Sanjay Raut, Shiv Sena leader and writer of the film 'Thackeray', said he will make a biopic based on former Defence Minister George Fernandes, who passed away on Tuesday. The film will focus on the role Fernandes played in national politics in the period between the 1950s and 1970s, Raut revealed. The film will reportedly be directed by Shoojit Sircar.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Reliefs without risking economy's bankruptcy: Mahindra on Budget
body: Reacting to the Interim Budget 2019-20 presented on Friday, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said, "I\'m just grateful that the reliefs to the key middle class & farmer segments were delivered in a measured way without risking bankruptcy of the economy." "I was bracing for a populist, profligate budget driven by election panic," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Punjab govt to allot over 1.32 lakh plots to rural homeless
body: Punjab government on Thursday said that it will provide over 1.32 lakh plots of five-marla each to homeless people in rural areas. CM Amarinder Singh had on January 22 directed all Deputy Commissioners to launch the scheme after identifying requisite land for this purpose. Singh asked for the allotment of at least 10 plots to homeless families in every village.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: 11-year-old, bullied for last name 'Trump', invited to Prez's speech
body: Joshua Trump, an 11-year-old who has been bullied in school for his last name, will be one of US President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump\'s guests at the State of the Union Address, the White House announced. "He said he hates himself, and he hates his last name...as a parent that\'s scary," Joshua\'s mother Megan Trump Berto said.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Louis Vuitton owner to stockpile 4 months of wine, spirits in UK
body: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH, which makes high-end beverages like Moët & Chandon champagne and Hennessy cognac, said it\'s stockpiling four months\' worth of wine and spirits in UK in preparation for Brexit. "We\'re ready for worst case scenario if there are difficulties with deliveries," the French luxury giant said. The UK is scheduled to leave the EU on March 29.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Home Ministry trying to destroy process: SC on Assam citizen's list
body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said, "The Home Ministry is coming up with all sorts of excuses to delay the NRC (National Register of Citizens) process in Assam. The entire effort of the Home Ministry is to destroy the process". Talking about the elections, which are due by May, the bench said the polls and NRC can go on simultaneously.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: OnePlus named bestselling premium smartphone brand of 2018: Report
body: OnePlus has emerged as India's best-selling premium smartphone brand of 2018, as per a report by Counterpoint. It captured 36% of the market share in the premium segment, in Q4 2018. Further, its OnePlus 6 emerged as the highest selling premium smartphone of 2018 followed by OnePlus 6T.
author: Roshan Gupta

headline: Confessed to spot-fixing to escape police torture: Sreesanth to SC
body: Banned cricketer Sreesanth has told Supreme Court he initially confessed to Delhi Police about his alleged involvement in 2013 IPL spot-fixing scandal to escape continuous police torture. Sreesanth further said the bookie tried dragging him into spot-fixing but he didn\'t fall for it. Citing Sreesanth not informing BCCI about fixing approach, the apex court said Sreesanth\'s conduct "wasn\'t good".
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Snapchat considering making user posts permanent: Reuters
body: Disappearing photo and video-sharing platform Snapchat is considering making its users' posts longer or even permanent, a Reuters report claimed. It is further considering revealing identities of users who make public posts, the report added. The platform is carefully weighing the privacy, technical and legal considerations of revealing user identities on public posts, it further said.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: I starved myself a day before my Oscar win to look thin: AR Rahman
body: Singer-composer AR Rahman has revealed on the eve of his Oscars win in 2009, he was "starving to look thin for the ceremony". Rahman won two Oscar awards, one for Best Original Song and another for Best Original Score, for his work in \'Slumdog Millionaire\'. Rahman was the first Indian to win two Oscar awards in a single night.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Banks try to seize 2 superyachts, 27 cars from Vijay Mallya
body: Indian banks trying to recover money from Vijay Mallya have moved a London court seeking documents that would reveal "true ownership" of assets including 2 superyachts and 27 cars. Mallya said the items are held by trusts that he doesn\'t control. The banks said there are many "valuable assets" held through "complex ownership structure comprising offshore companies and discretionary trusts".
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Shahid Afridi once bit ball during ODI, claimed he was smelling it
body: During an ODI against Australia on January 31, 2010, Pakistan's stand-in captain Shahid Afridi was caught by cameras biting the ball which led to umpires changing the ball. Afridi, after the match, claimed that he was just trying to smell the ball. However, Afridi later pleaded guilty to ball tampering and was banned for two T20Is.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: IPL a gateway only for T20 format: Indian selector MSK Prasad
body: Indian cricket team selector MSK Prasad has said that the selection committee picks players from the Indian Premier League only for the T20 format. "After being picked from the IPL, it\'s up to the players on how keen they are in learning the tricks of the trade," Prasad said about selection into the Indian team from IPL.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Chanda Kochhar to lose ₹9.8 crore bonus, ₹221 crore in stock options
body: After ICICI Bank sacked former CEO Chanda Kochhar, she'll have to pay back ₹9.82 crore she earned as bonuses from April 2009. Further, 57 lakh unvested and unexercised shares (stock options), whose current value is ₹221 crore, granted to her in the last 9 years stand revoked. Kochhar exercised shares worth ₹134 crore (as of Wednesday's closing) since April 2009.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Railway police rescues woman with leg stuck in train toilet
body: Railway police has rescued a woman travelling on a train in Chennai who got her leg stuck inside the commode of a toilet. After being caught inside the commode hole, she struggled to remove her leg and following failed attempts, she shouted for help, reports said. Railway police used a cutter to pry open the commode and freed her leg.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Chinese Prez surprises people at eatery, says 'just passing through'
body: Chinese President Xi Jinping recently surprised diners at a small Beijing restaurant and chatted with deliverymen ahead of next week\'s Lunar New Year holiday. As diners stood up to take pictures, he told them not to stop eating on his account and said, "I\'m just passing through." He later visited policemen and made dumplings with residents in a courtyard dwelling.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Trump says use of military force in Venezuela 'an option'
body: Amid the political crisis in Venezuela, US President Donald Trump has said that military intervention in the country is "an option". Trump added he turned down a meeting with Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro several months ago due to the "really horrible things" that had been happening in the country. The US recognised Venezuela\'s opposition leader Juan Guaidó as interim President.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Jaitley likely to skip Budget debate in Parliament: Report
body: Union Minister Arun Jaitley has said his return to India in time for the Budget debate in Parliament will depend on when his doctors allow him to leave. He had missed presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 as he had to fly to the US for treatment. "As of present... Piyush Goyal will be replying [to the Budget debate]," he added.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Qatar defeat Japan to win their first-ever Asian Cup title
body: Qatar defeated four-time champions Japan 3-1 in the final on Friday to win their first ever Asian Cup. Qatar forward Almoez Ali broke the record of most goals in a single Asian Cup after netting his ninth goal with an overhead kick, breaking Ali Daei's 1996 record. This was the first time that Japan lost in an Asian Cup final.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: YouTube seeks creator feedback over 'dislike' button misuse
body: YouTube has asked for feedback from video creators to curb misuse of its \'dislike\' button by "dislike mobs". YouTube\'s Director of Product Management, Tom Leung, suggested removing the \'dislike\' button, making likes and dislikes invisible or adding checkbox for users to state the reason for disliking a video. "Dislike mobs" purposely \'dislike\' videos in organised attacks to harm video creators.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Rahul is now into hallucinating conversations: Smriti Irani
body: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi claimed Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar told him he had nothing to do with the new Rafale deal, Union Textiles Minister Smriti Irani posted on Facebook, "He is now into hallucinating conversations." Calling Rahul a "congenital liar," Irani added, "It is dangerous to even maintain social contact with him in terms of basic political courtesies."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Kareena Kapoor walks the ramp at Lakmé Fashion Week grand finale
body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan walked the ramp for designers Shantanu and Nikhil during the grand finale of Lakmé Fashion Week Summer/ Resort 2019 on Sunday. She wore a black off-shoulder gown with thigh-high slits for the event. This was the first time that the designer duo featured at the fashion week's grand finale.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: God wanted Trump to become President: White House
body: White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders has said God "wanted Donald Trump to become (US) President", adding that "God calls all of us to fill different roles at different times". "That\'s why he\'s there and I think he has done a tremendous job in supporting a lot of the things that people of faith really care about," she added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: I'll improve myself: Sarfaraz on 4-game suspension over 'Kaale' row
body: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed, who has been banned for four matches for his \'Abey Kaale\' remark to South Africa\'s Andile Phehlukwayo, said he\'ll improve himself and his performance in the future. Sarfaraz was called back from South Africa by Pakistan Cricket Board after being banned by the ICC. "I will rest and then play Pakistan Super League," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Bored of playing female characters as I've nothing new to offer: Ali
body: Actor-comedian Ali Asgar has said he\'s now bored of playing female characters because he has nothing new to offer to it. He added, "Now drag is taken for granted. That just because a man is doing a female character, it\'s funny. It\'s not! "You can\'t say \'sir you are experienced, you\'ll pull it off\'...It doesn\'t work like that," he said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Jet accepts Etihad bailout plan, Goyal may resign: Reports
body: Cash-strapped Jet Airways has agreed to most of the conditions set by its second-largest shareholder Etihad for its revival, as per reports. Both the airlines are set to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) within days, reports added. This would result in Jet Airways Founder and Chairman Naresh Goyal stepping down from the airline's board of directors, reports further said.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: IAF will fly ultra-modern Rafale jets soon: President Kovind
body: Addressing a joint session of Parliament a day before the Interim Budget will be presented, President Ram Nath Kovind said the Indian Air Force will soon fly "ultra-modern\u200b Rafale jets" to strengthen its capabilities. Claiming a "New India" was displayed during the 2016 surgical strikes, he added, "My government has communicated a new hope and confidence in the people."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: BJP trying to intimidate Opposition through CBI: Akhilesh
body: Former Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav on Monday accused the Modi government of trying to scare and intimidate the Opposition by using government agencies like the CBI. Referring to the confrontation between CBI and Kolkata Police in West Bengal, he added similar things were heard from other states as well. He also accused the Modi government of "politicising institutions".
author: Shashank Verma

headline: India handed over 1st US-built Chinook helicopter, to get 14 more
body: India has officially been handed over its first CH-47F Chinook transport helicopter at Boeing's facility in US' Philadelphia. India will receive the remaining 14 Chinook helicopters this year, order for which was placed in 2015. Chinook, which is an advanced multi-mission helicopter that can help in delivering heavy payloads to high altitudes, will boost Indian Air Force's helicopter fleet.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Pakistan lifts travel ban on Asia Bibi
body: Pakistan has said that Asia Bibi, the Christian woman acquitted of blasphemy, has the right to travel anywhere inside the country or abroad. This came after Pakistan's Supreme Court upheld her acquittal, rejecting a petition by hardline Islamists. Pakistan had barred Bibi from travelling abroad following a deal with the Islamists who had opposed her acquittal and demanded her execution.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Sensex rises up to 522 points during Interim Budget session
body: Indian equity benchmark Sensex on Friday surged as much as 522 points to 36,778 during Finance Minister Piyush Goyal's Interim Budget speech. Maruti Suzuki, Hero MotoCorp and Mahindra & Mahindra were among the top gainers. Among major announcements, the government has proposed full tax rebate for individual taxpayers having an annual taxable income of up to ₹5 lakh.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Indonesia's Go-Jek raises $1 bn from Google, Tencent: Report
body: Indonesian ride-hailing startup Go-Jek has reportedly raised around $1 billion in a funding round led by Google, Tencent Holdings and JD.com. The funding, which is part of the Jakarta-based startup's Series F round, reportedly values it at $9-10 billion. Founded in 2010, Go-Jek offers motorbikes and taxis on demand, along with services like grocery delivery and mobile payments.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Plan is to return to tennis by end of the year: Sania Mirza
body: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza has said that she is planning to return to competitive tennis by the end of the year. "[T]his last one year I realised that it is amazing what all a woman is capable of. Having a kid is experiencing selfless love," the 32-year-old said. Sania added that tennis is her priority.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: PM-led panel to meet on Friday to pick new CBI chief: Kharge
body: The high-powered committee led by PM Narendra Modi to select the next CBI Director will meet again on February 1, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said. The panel consisting of Kharge and Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi met on January 24, but the meeting ended "inconclusively" after Kharge cited lack of details in the list of 80 IPS officers.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Pandya a natural talent and a match winner: Ravi Shastri
body: Praising Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya, Indian cricket team coach Ravi Shastri said, "He\'s a natural talent, he is a match-winner. And he showed what he can do today with the bat." "Those 20-30 runs made all the difference today," Shastri added. Pandya scored a 22-ball 45 which included five sixes and also picked up two wickets during New Zealand\'s chase.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Spent last 10 yrs in a jail: IAS topper Shah Faesal on his tenure
body: In his first public meeting in Jammu and Kashmir after quitting the services, 2009 IAS topper Shah Faesal on Monday said, "To tell you honestly, I spent the last 10 years in a jail." He asserted that despite being a senior government officer, he used to feel helpless seeing "atrocities and injustices". Faesal resigned last month to protest Kashmir killings.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Won't settle for anything less than a grand Ram Temple: RSS
body: Speaking at the \'Dharam Sansad\' event on Friday, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said they won\'t settle for anything less than a grand temple at Ayodhya. "This is our demand. It is up to the government how it meets it," he added. "We should involve in public awakening so that construction of the Temple begins at the earliest," he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: You want Ganga clean & also wash sins in it: Tharoor on UP CM's pic
body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has shared an image of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath taking a holy dip at Kumbh Mela along with his Cabinet ministers. "You want to keep the Ganga clean and also wash your sins in it. Everyone is naked in this Sangam. Jai Ganga Maiya ki," Tharoor\'s caption on the picture read.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Whole exercise has turned out to be damp squib: Tharoor on Budget
body: Reacting to the Interim Budget 2019-20 presented by Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said, "The whole exercise has turned out to be a damp squib." "₹6,000 in income support for farmers boils down to ₹500 per month. Is that supposed to enable them to live with the honour and dignity?" questioned Tharoor.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: As an actor, I deserved a lot more than I got: Shekhar Suman
body: Speaking about his career in the film industry, actor and producer Shekhar Suman said, "As an actor, I think I deserved a lot more than what I got." "It\'s definitely surprised me why the...better roles didn\'t come my way," Shekhar added. He further said that while he accepted his destiny with "grace and dignity", he hopes things will change.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Sonam Kapoor confirms sister Rhea is dating Karan Boolani
body: Actress Sonam Kapoor has confirmed that her sister Rhea Kapoor is dating Karan Boolani, while also denying reports of the couple getting married this year. "They\'ve been dating for 10 years, they\'ve not gotten married yet. When the happy news is there, it\'ll all be announced," she added. Boolani is reportedly a director by profession.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: US intelligence naive and wrong, should go back to school: Trump
body: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday called his country\'s top intelligence chiefs "naive" and "wrong" on Iran and added that they should perhaps "go back to school". Trump claimed Iran is testing rockets, calling the country "a source of potential danger and conflict". Top US intelligence officials on Tuesday said that Iran isn\'t currently taking steps towards building nuclear weapons.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Come armed with sticks for PM Modi's rally in WB: BJP leader
body: BJP National Secretary Rahul Sinha on Wednesday asked the party workers in West Bengal to come armed with sticks to PM Narendra Modi's rally in the state on February 2. His statement came a day after clashes broke out following BJP chief Amit Shah's WB rally. Sinha added the TMC is indulged in violence as they're afraid of BJP's strength.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: RBI penalises Axis, UCO, Syndicate Bank over non-compliance
body: The RBI on Tuesday said it has imposed a total penalty of ₹2.2 crore on private lender Axis Bank in two separate cases. A penalty of ₹2 crore has also been imposed on UCO Bank and ₹1 crore on Syndicate Bank for violation of norms. The action won't have any material impact on the banks, the central bank added.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Tesla reports 1st back-to-back profitable quarters in 15 yrs
body: Elon Musk-led Tesla has reported back-to-back profitable quarters for the first time ever in the 15-year history of the electric carmaker. Tesla reported a profit of around $139.5 million, or $0.78 a share, for the fourth quarter. The carmaker had reported a profit of $312 million for its third quarter in 2018, after reporting losses for seven consecutive quarters.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Pune Police arrests activist accused in Bhima-Koregaon case
body: Pune Police on Saturday arrested activist Anand Teltumbde in the Bhima-Koregaon case for his alleged Maoist links. He was arrested despite a Supreme Court order which granted him interim protection from arrest for four weeks from January 14. This comes after a Pune sessions court on Friday rejected his anticipatory bail saying there is enough evidence to prove his involvement.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Minister praises rape-convict Asaram over Matru-Pitru Divas
body: Gujarat Education Minister Bhupendrasinh Chudasma has written a congratulatory message to a yoga ashram run by rape-convict Asaram\'s organisation for observing February 14 as "Matru-Pitru Pujan Divas" (Mother-Father worship day). After the Congress termed the letter as "unfortunate", saying it "shows the nexus between BJP and godman", Chudasma clarified, "All I have done is sent best wishes."
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Wife didn't talk to me for 3 days after I told her GoT ending: Kit
body: Actor Kit Harington, who portrays \'Jon Snow\' in \'Game of Thrones\', has said he revealed the show\'s ending to his wife Rose Leslie. "I told my wife last year how it ended, and she wouldn\'t talk to me for about three days. And she had asked that," he added. Rose Leslie earlier played his love interest \'Ygritte\' on the show.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Rishabh Pant is an asset for Team India: Shikhar Dhawan
body: Speaking about Rishabh Pant, Indian opener Shikhar Dhawan said, "He\'s an aggressive batsman and he can take away the game from the opposition in a jiffy. He\'s a great asset for our team." The 21-year-old is a part of the Indian T20I squad for the three-match series against New Zealand, which is set to start on February 6.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: No major communal riot in BJP-ruled states: Amit Shah
body: BJP President Amit Shah on Thursday said no major communal riot has occurred in states where his party is in power. Shah added the BJP is committed to the welfare of the people irrespective of their religion. Speaking at a convention, he said the school dropout rate of Muslim girls has fallen to 32% from 72% under the BJP rule.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: SL batsman 2nd in history to hit 2 double tons in a 1st class match
body: Sri Lankan side Nondescripts Cricket Club captain Angelo Perera has become the second player in history to smash two double hundreds in a single first-class match. The 28-year-old achieved the feat against Sinhalese Sports Club by slamming 201(203) in the first innings and 231(268) in the second. Late Kent batsman Arthur Fagg was the first player to achieve the feat.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Virat Kohli is an unbelievable sportsman: Sunil Chhetri
body: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri has said Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli is an unbelievable sportsman. "It is not easy to do what he is doing. What Virat is doing is unbelievable. He\'s also different from others in person," he added. "He actually puts a lot of energy and time on being a better player," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Marriage has been a lucky charm: Saina Nehwal
body: Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal, who won Indonesia Masters title last week, has said marriage has been a lucky charm for her. "Everything is falling in place. It\'s like a dream run. I never thought...after marriage, I would go on to win my first title after two years," added the 28-year-old, who married fellow shuttler Parupalli Kashyap in December last year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Goa CM Parrikar to be shifted to AIIMS for examination: CMO
body: Ailing Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar will be shifted to the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi for a medical check-up, his office said on Thursday. "He is expected to be admitted there for the next four days," a senior official said. His medical review/check-up was pending due to state Legislative Assembly session, the CMO added.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Naxals set ablaze six vehicles in Maharashtra
body: Naxals on Thursday allegedly torched six vehicles in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district, a police official said. A group of around 12 Maoists set four tractors and two JCB machines on fire which were brought for construction work in Korchi tehsil, the official added. They also blocked a road by cutting trees and placing branches on the way, the official further said.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Tesla buys energy storage company Maxwell Technologies for $218 mn
body: Elon Musk-led automaker Tesla has agreed to acquire American energy storage company Maxwell Technologies in an all-stock deal valued at about $218 million. The acquisition is reportedly aimed to help the electric automaker improve its batteries and lower its vehicle prices. The merger is expected to be completed in the second quarter of 2019, Maxwell Technologies aid. \n
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Ousted CBI chief may face action for defying transfer order
body: Ousted CBI Director Alok Verma may face departmental action including suspension of pensionary benefits for defying a government order to join the post of DG Fire Services, PTI reported. Verma had told the government to consider him retired, however, the Home Ministry asked him to join Fire Services on the last day of his fixed tenure as Director on Thursday.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Russian efforts for disarmament not supported by partners: Putin
body: Stating that Russia has "suggested frequently and regularly conducting substantial talks on almost all aspects of disarmament", President Vladimir Putin said, "We have seen that our initiatives are not supported by our partners." Putin said this after he announced that Russia would withdraw from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with the US within six months.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Sachin Bansal invests ₹50 cr in his new venture BAC Acquisitions
body: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal has invested ₹50 crore into his holding entity BAC Acquisitions by way of 50 lakh equity shares priced at ₹100 each, RoC filings of the company with Ministry of Corporate Affairs revealed. Bansal founded BAC Acquisitions with his IIT Delhi batchmate Ankit Agarwal. The new venture was earlier reported to invest in agritech and fintech spaces.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Ajai Kumar named Yes Bank interim CEO till Gill takes charge
body: Yes Bank on Thursday announced it has appointed director Ajai Kumar as interim MD and CEO of the lender. Kumar will take charge on February 1 for one month or till Ravneet Singh Gill assumes office as MD & CEO. The RBI had asked Rana Kapoor to step down as Yes Bank's MD and CEO by January 31.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Activist says 'Wait till Rahul also promises free sex', criticised
body: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi\'s recent poll promises like Minimum Income Guarantee and women\'s reservation, scholar and activist Madhu Kishwar tweeted, "Wait till Rahul Gandhi also promises free sex for every adult male for a certain number of days every year!" Several people criticised her for the remark, with one saying, "I can\'t believe you have written it. Stumped. Sad."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Longest interim budget speech in recent memory: P Chidambaram
body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram on Friday said that interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal tested patience by giving the "longest" Interim Budget speech in recent memory. "It was not an Interim Budget. It was a full-fledged Budget accompanied by an election campaign speech," the former Finance Minister added. Chidambaram further said "the government has trampled on time-honoured conventions".
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Modi government playing with fire in WB: Shatrughan Sinha
body: Rebel BJP leader Shatrughan Sinha on Monday took a dig at the PM Narendra Modi-led central government accusing it of playing with fire by targeting West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. He added that the BJP has almost lost the credibility and people are not accepting whatever the party is saying. He said, "Let\'s not get into knee jerk panic action-reaction".
author: Shashank Verma

headline: ICC's decision to ban Sarfaraz not common sense: PCB chairman Mani
body: Talking about ICC imposing a four-match ban on Sarfaraz Ahmed over his racist remarks against South Africa\'s Andile Phehlukwayo, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chairman Ehsan Mani said that common sense was overruled by bureaucratic process. "[Our apology] had been accepted by everyone...but...because ICC couldn’t get the two players in a room together, they said let\'s charge him," Mani added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: YouTuber Sahil Khattar to play Kirmani in World Cup film '83
body: YouTuber Sahil Khattar will play former Indian cricketer Syed Kirmani in the upcoming Ranveer Singh starrer '83. Directed by Kabir Khan, the film is based on India's 1983 Cricket World Cup victory. Ranveer Singh will play former Indian cricket team captain Kapil Dev in the film, which is slated to release in April 2020, as per reports.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Swine flu outbreak kills 76 in Rajasthan
body: Government officials on Wednesday said that a swine flu outbreak has killed 76 people this year in Rajasthan. Colder weather has worsened the seasonal outbreak of the H1N1 virus in the country, officials added. Rajasthan recorded more than a third of all swine flu deaths in India with Jodhpur being the worst affected area in the state, officials said.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: SL opener gets hit on neck by 142-kmph bouncer, rushed to hospital
body: Sri Lanka's left-handed opener Dimuth Karunaratne fell down after being hit in the back of the neck by a 142-kmph delivery from Australia's Pat Cummins during the second day of the second Test in Canberra on Saturday. The 30-year-old was attended to by both teams' medical staff and immediately stretchered off the ground and sent to a hospital.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Two pieces of world's smelliest fruit sold for ₹70,000 each
body: Two durian fruits have sold for over ₹70,000 each at a supermarket in Indonesia. "The buyer did not want to be named, but he was a durian lover," the supermarket manager said. Known as the world\'s smelliest fruit, a normal durian sells for a few dollars, but the \'J-Queen\' variety durians are extremely rare and possess a very pungent aroma.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Traffic violation informers win car, bike, ₹67.42 L in Goa
body: Goa CM Manohar Parrikar on Thursday informed the state legislative assembly that volunteers who informed about the traffic violations under 'Traffic Sentinel Scheme' have won a car, motorcycle and nearly ₹67.42 lakh in incentives. He said the scheme was notified by the state government to inculcate road discipline among road users. The scheme aimed to promote community policing, he added.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Don't politicise visit to Parrikar, BJP minister tells Rahul
body: After Congress chief Rahul Gandhi claimed Goa CM Manohar Parrikar told him he had "nothing to do with the new Rafale deal," BJP minister Mauvin Godinho asked Rahul "not to politicise a courtesy visit." Godinho added, "It wasn\'t the right thing for Rahul Gandhi to do...When you come to enquire about a person\'s health, it should be limited to that."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Govt cuts customs duty on electric vehicle parts to 10-15%
body: The government has cut down customs duty on import of parts and components for electric vehicles to 10-15%, down from the previous 15-30%. The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs said disassembled parts will attract 10% duty, whereas 15% will be levied on pre-assembled packs. However, fully built electric vehicles will continue to attract 25% import duty.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: US court orders Syria to pay $302 million over journo's death
body: A US court has found Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's government liable for the death of American war correspondent Marie Colvin and ordered the regime to pay $302.5 million in damages. Colvin and French photographer Rémi Ochlik were killed in Syria in 2012 when the building they were living and working in was targeted by rockets.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Man seeks permit for human sacrifice, says engineer son will be 1st
body: A tantrik in Bihar has sent an application to Begusarai authorities seeking permission for human sacrifice to appease his deity. In a circulated video, the occultist purportedly said human sacrifice is not a crime and he's first going to sacrifice his engineer son, who refused to give financial aid for his temple. A probe has been launched into the case.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: CBI team detained outside Kolkata Police chief Kumar's house
body: Kolkata Police on Sunday detained the CBI team that raided the Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar's residence over allegations of his involvement in chit fund scams in West Bengal. The CBI investigators were also not allowed to enter the residence of Kumar. TMC MP Derek O'Brien called the raid a 'constitutional coup' and 'unabated destruction of institutions' by the BJP.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Father of US man killed in Andaman blames 'extreme Christianity'
body: The father of John Chau, a missionary allegedly killed by Andaman\'s Sentinelese tribe last year, has blamed "extreme Christianity" for the death of his son. "John is gone because the Western ideology overpowered my [Confucian] influence," he said. Chau illegally travelled to the North Sentinel Island to convert the tribe to Christianity.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Opp'n is divided by regions, united by corruption: Javadekar
body: Talking about Opposition parties supporting West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee\'s dharna, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Monday said that the Opposition is "divided by regions and united by corruption". "Who are these people? They are out on bail...The corrupt are standing together," he added. Mamata on Sunday went on an indefinite dharna to protest CBI action in Kolkata.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Lord Ram doesn't belong to any party: Baba Ramdev
body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev on Saturday said that the Hindu God Ram doesn\'t belong to a single party but to the entire nation. "Hence, all saints must unite and show their devotion towards Lord Ram," he added. "I request all...revered saints that there should be no divide in the nation in the name of Ram," he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Ambati Rayudu will go to the 2019 World Cup: Ganguly
body: Former Indian captain Sourav Ganguly said that Ambati Rayudu will most definitely travel to the ICC  World Cup 2019 as part of the Indian squad. Rayudu finished the India-New Zealand ODI series as the highest run-getter, scoring 190 runs in five matches. "Rayudu played well. He fizzled out in the middle but has played well overall," Ganguly said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Bhima-Koregaon accused moves Bombay HC for anticipatory bail
body: Activist Anand Teltumbde, an accused in the Bhima-Koregaon case, on Monday moved the Bombay High Court seeking anticipatory bail. This comes after Teltumbde was arrested on Saturday after a Pune sessions court rejected his anticipatory bail plea. However, the sessions court later ordered his release, terming the arrest "illegal" since Teltumbde was given interim protection till February 11.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Apple loses $5 billion in revenue from China last quarter
body: Apple on Tuesday said its sales in China fell 27% in the December quarter, representing nearly $5 billion of lost revenue. Apple's overall revenue fell 4.5% to $84.3 billion during the quarter while profit fell slightly to $19.97 billion. Notably, the iPhone maker reported a decline in both revenue and profits for the first time in more than 10 years.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Gangster-turned-politician Shahabuddin's nephew shot dead
body: Gangster-turned-politician Mohammad Shahabuddin's nephew Mohammed Yusuf was shot dead in Bihar's Siwan on Friday night. Yusuf was shot on his chest reportedly from a close range and had been lying on roadside for close to an hour. The victim ran a cafe in Siwan and was said to be very close to Shahabuddin's son Osama.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Stop discussing my penis on TV: Murray to anchor showing X-ray pic
body: After journalist Piers Morgan discussed tennis player Andy Murray\'s X-ray showing his penis on television, Murray messaged him, "Can you stop discussing my genitals on national TV?" "I was heavily medicated at the time of posting," added Murray, who underwent hip surgery. The X-ray was posted by Murray on Tuesday, who captioned it, "I now have a metal hip."
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Indian media barred from event addressed by Pak minister in UK
body: Indian media was not allowed entry into the \'International Conference on Kashmir\' event addressed by Pakistani Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi at the UK House of Commons complex on Monday. India registered "strong" opposition over the matter, following which the UK government responded stating Qureshi was not an official guest as he was on a private visit to Britain.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Sala's sister shares picture of his dog waiting for him to return
body: Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala\'s sister Romina took to Facebook to share a picture of Sala\'s dog Nala staring into the distance and captioned it, "Nala\'s waiting for you too." The 28-year-old forward was travelling to Wales\' Cardiff from France\'s Nantes when his plane disappeared over English Channel on January 21. The plane\'s wreckage and a body were discovered on Sunday.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Refugee footballer pleads for Thailand to not send him to Bahrain
body: Refugee footballer Hakeem al-Araibi, who was arrested on November 27, 2018 in Bangkok when he arrived for a honeymoon with his wife, has urged Thailand to not send him to his home country Bahrain. Hakeem, who was granted a refugee status in Australia in 2017,  has been given 60 days to prepare a defence against Bahrain's attempt to extradite him.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Ronaldo had surgery for heart issue at 15 to save his career
body: Five-time Ballon d\'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo, who joined Juventus from Real Madrid, had to undergo laser surgery for heart problem when he was just 15. Ronaldo, who was playing for Sporting CP at that time, had an irregular heartbeat even when he was resting. Ronaldo\'s mother revealed she was worried as "there was the possibility of him giving up football".
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Gautam Gambhir urges Army to help war veteran begging in Delhi
body: Ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir urged Army and Defence Ministry to help Peethambaran, who claimed to have served in the Army during 1965 and 1971 wars and now begs on Delhi streets. Gambhir shared two pictures of Peethambaran and tweeted, "He claims due to technical reasons he can\'t get support from d Army. I\'d urge [Army and Defence Ministry] to intervene.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Goa Assembly passes ₹2,000-fine bill for drinking on beaches
body: The Goa Assembly on Thursday passed a bill amending a state tourism law which will make drinking alcohol, cooking and littering in public places a criminal offence. Under the new amendment, violators will be fined ₹2,000, however, a group would have to pay ₹10,000 for the same. The bill has been sent for Governor's approval to make it a law.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Indian-origin NZ player collapses to death on-field during match
body: New Zealand cricketer Hareesh Gangadharan passed away after he collapsed on the field during a match on Saturday. Gangadharan, a cricketer of Indian ethnicity, was a member of Green Island Cricket Club\'s Second Grade team. "Early indications are that the player has had a heart attack," New Zealand Cricket\'s manager of public affairs Richard Boock said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Neymar breaks down on 27th b'day, wishes for new metatarsal bones
body: World\'s most expensive footballer Neymar, who is currently recovering from a foot injury, broke down during a speech to his friends and family during his 27th birthday celebrations in Paris. "What I wanted...the most as a birthday present today is a new metatarsal so I could be on the field fighting and doing what I love the most," he said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: NASA's Curiosity rover clicks last selfie on Martian ridge
body: NASA's Curiosity rover has shared its last selfie clicked on Mars' Vera Rubin Ridge, which was its home for over a year. A series of 57 pictures were stitched together to create the selfie. Curiosity had drilled its 19th sample at 'Rock Hall' on the ridge on December 15, 2018, which is also visible in the photo, NASA added.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Crazy not to pick Smith, Warner: Australia coach Langer
body: Australian team\'s coach Justin Langer said that Australia would be "crazy" not to pick Steve Smith and David Warner for their World Cup defence. "We\'ve got to keep working on how they are with their elbows first," Langer said after both players underwent elbow surgeries last month. Smith and Warner will be available for international selection again on March 29.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: 1 lakh 'digital villages' to be created in 5 years: Govt
body: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced that the government aims to build over 1 lakh 'digital villages' in the coming 5 years. Common Services Centres, which is an initiative of the Electronics and Information Technology Ministry, will be tasked with the creation of digital infrastructure in the villages.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: 3 killed, 1 missing in state-owned coal mine collapse in WB
body: At least three villagers were killed and one other went missing after a coal mine collapsed in West Bengal’s Bankura district on Thursday. As many as six villagers had gone down the mine which belongs to West Bengal Power Development Corporation Limited. This incident comes days after 15 people went missing in a flooded coal mine in Meghalaya.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: BJP wants Ram Temple, other parties clarify your stand: Shah
body: Stating that BJP\'s stand on Ram Temple issue is clear, party President Amit Shah on Sunday asked other political parties to clarify their stand on it. "I request opposition...not to be an obstacle in the case," he added. "We\'ve decided to return the land belonging to Ram Janmabhoomi Nyas that was acquired in 1993...It\'s a historic step," he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Kolkata Police chief can't be arrested: SC to CBI in chit fund cases
body: Responding to a plea filed by the CBI, the Supreme Court has said the agency cannot take any coercive action, including arrest, against Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar in connection with the chit fund scams. However, the court directed Kumar to appear before CBI and cooperate with it. This comes amid West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's dharna against CBI action.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee ends dharna against CBI after 3 days
