body: After three days, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday called off the dharna (protest) in Kolkata against the CBI over action against Kolkata Police chief Rajeev Kumar regarding Saradha chit-fund scam. She called the dharna "a victory for the Constitution and democracy". Earlier, the Supreme Court ordered Kumar can\'t be arrested but he must cooperate in the investigation.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Won't extend Feb 1 deadline for new e-commerce norms: Govt
body: The government has said it will not extend the February 1 deadline for the implementation of revised Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) norms for the e-commerce sector. The decision to not delay the rules was taken after "due consideration", it added. The move comes amid lobbying by Walmart-owned Flipkart and Amazon to get an extension to the deadline.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: WB govt denies permission for Yogi's chopper to land
body: The West Bengal government on Sunday denied permission for Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath’s chopper to land at Balurghat, where Yogi is scheduled to address a rally. The permission has been declined without any prior notice, Uttar Pradesh CM's office said. Earlier, BJP chief Amit Shah’s chopper was not given permission to land at the Malda airport in West Bengal.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: People see stardom in dreams, I see my characters: Anil
body: Anil Kapoor said that he didn\'t realise when he had become a "star", adding, "I used to tell Rajinikanth ji also, \'Some people dream of becoming the biggest stars. In my dreams...I see [my] characters\'." Anil added that he dreams how differently he can play his characters. He further said, "[When] the characters became popular...Main star ban gaya!"
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Apple temporarily blocks Google's internal iOS apps: Report
body: Apple on Thursday briefly blocked Google's employee-only iOS apps after it was reportedly found to be in violation of Apple's app distribution policy. Early versions of Google Maps, Hangouts, Gmail, and other pre-release beta apps also stopped working. This comes after Apple revoked similar permissions for Facebook when it was found that a 'Facebook Research' app was downloading user data.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: US suspends Cold War-era nuclear arms treaty with Russia
body: The US has suspended its obligations under the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with Russia effective February 2, US State Secretary Mike Pompeo announced on Friday. The US has accused Russia of violating the Cold War-era pact by deploying a ground-based cruise missile. The INF treaty required the elimination of both US and Russia's land-based nuclear missiles from Europe.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Went for Aamir's film trials, but no one has time for me: Kangana
body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has said many of her contemporaries don\'t support her work, but when it comes to promoting their films, they call her "shamelessly". She added, "When Aamir called me for Dangal, Secret Superstar, I went all the way to Ambani\'s house," she added. "But they don\'t have time for any of my film screenings," Kangana further said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Pune man jailed for raping 3 daughters, wife also imprisoned
body: A Pune court has sentenced a 45-year-old man to life imprisonment for raping his three daughters, one of whom was a minor at the time. It sentenced the girls' mother to seven years' imprisonment for abetting the crime. When the girls had complained of the abuse to their mother, she told them he was under the influence of black magic.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Parrikar surviving on God's blessings, ailment has no cure: Lobo
body: BJP legislator and deputy speaker of the legislative assembly, Michael Lobo on Monday said that Goa CM Manohar Parrikar is surviving on "God’s blessings" in combating the ailment that "has got no cure." Goa will plunge into a political crisis the day Parrikar steps down as CM, Lobo added. The 63-year-old Goa CM is suffering from a pancreatic ailment.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: BJP wins by-polls in Haryana's Jind by over 12,000 votes
body: BJP candidate Dr Krishan Lal Middha on Thursday won Haryana\'s Jind by-polls with a margin of over 12,000 votes. "There were big leaders in the contest as well, but we have defeated them too," Middha said. He added that the party will follow the schemes launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and take them forward.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: MP govt makes it mandatory for industries to hire 70% locals
body: Madhya Pradesh Congress government on Tuesday made it mandatory for industries seeking various incentives from the state government to provide 70% employment to locals. Firms which took land and other facilities by the former BJP government have also been asked to follow the new policy, reports said. Congress had promised employment for the locals in its 2018 Assembly elections manifesto.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Pics of asteroid that may hit Earth in next century released
body: NASA's OSIRIS-REx spacecraft has sent the most detailed images of asteroid Bennu, which has a one-in-2,700 chance of hitting Earth in the next century as per NASA. The two images of the potentially Earth-bound asteroid's south pole were clicked from a distance of around 1.6 kilometres on January 17, NASA said. OSIRIS-REx has travelled around 2.2 billion km till date.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Yashwant Sinha demands probe into alleged fund diversion by DHFL
body: Former Finance Minister Yashwant Sinha on Tuesday demanded a probe into the alleged diversion of loans worth ₹31,000 crore by Dewan Housing Finance (DHFL). All agencies including regulators of the government have failed to track nefarious deals, he said. This comes after a media report on Tuesday accused DHFL's controlling shareholders of diverting funds to shell companies to buy assets.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: UK government clears Vijay Mallya's extradition to India
body: UK Home Secretary Sajid Javid has signed an order to extradite beleaguered liquor baron Vijay Mallya to India. Mallya has 14 days from now to appeal against the extradition order. Earlier, the Westminster Magistrates' Court had sent the case of Mallya to the Home Secretary for a decision on his extradition.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Marcus Rashford helps Man United maintain winning run
body: Manchester United have registered five successive away victories after Marcus Rashford's goal proved to be the match-winner for his side in the EPL fixture against Leicester City on Sunday. With the win, United have extended their unbeaten run under interim manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer to 10 games. Rashford's goal was his 10th goal of the season.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: FBI conducts sting on Huawei in Vegas burger outlet: Report
body: As per a report, the FBI conducted a sting operation on Huawei for possible intellectual property theft in a Prime Burger outlet in Las Vegas. Huawei had reportedly taken a prototype of US company Akhan Semiconductor\'s "Miraj Diamond Glass" and returned it heavily damaged, with three shards missing. Diamond coatings could potentially be used in laser weapons, the report said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Woman turns Apple AirPods into earrings to avoid losing them
body: Gabrielle Reilly, a 22-year-old US woman, created earrings for her Apple AirPods and put it up for sale online for $20 (about ₹1,500). "I absolutely refuse to lose them (AirPods)...So I made earrings," she explained. The earrings, which took her over an hour to make, debuted in a video on Twitter that has since garnered over three million views.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Bosch makes its 1st India investment in IISc spinoff SimYog
body: German multinational engineering and electronics firm Bosch has made its first investment in India in Bengaluru-based deep-tech startup SimYog. SimYog has raised about ₹6.3 crore in the funding round, with participation from early-stage venture capital firm Ideaspring Capital. Incubated at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), it provides design and sign-off tools for automotive electronics.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: ICC bans WI captain for slow over-rate, Warne criticises decision
body: Windies captain Jason Holder has been banned for one Test and fined 40% of his match fee by the ICC for maintaining a slow over-rate during the second Test against England, which Windies won on the third day on Saturday. Cricketer-turned-commentator Shane Warne criticised the decision, tweeting, "The Test didn\'t go 3 days...What a ridiculous decision...where\'s the common sense here?"
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Liam Neeson criticised for comment on wanting to kill black man
body: Actor Liam Neeson is facing criticism for revealing he wanted to "kill a black man" nearly 40 years ago after his friend was raped. "My immediate reaction was I asked, \'Did she know who it was?\' No. \'What color were they?\' She said it was a black person," the 66-year-old actor said. "It was horrible...that I did that," Liam added.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: UN marks 150 years of periodic table with year-long celebration
body: The UNESCO on Tuesday launched 'International Year of the Periodic Table of Chemical Elements', a year-long celebration to mark its 150 years. The first-ever periodic table with elements organised using number of protons was given by Russian chemist Dmitri Mendeleev in 1869. The event in Paris included a Chemistry Nobel laureate and Russia's science minister, among others.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Saha still in our scheme of things for Tests: MSK Prasad
body: Speaking about the competition for the wicket-keeper spot in India\'s Test team, selector MSK Prasad said, "Wriddhiman Saha has been our number one wicket-keeper till he got injured... Saha is still in our scheme of things for [Tests]." Speaking about Rishabh Pant, Prasad said that following Saha\'s injuries Pant was given an opportunity which he has \'grabbed with both hands.\'
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Indian filmmakers will now get single window clearance for shoot
body: While delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced that Indian filmmakers will now get single window clearance for ease of shooting films. This facility was so far available only to foreign filmmakers. Additionally, anti-camcording provision will be introduced to Cinematography Act to combat film piracy, he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: CM Parrikar under pressure from PM after our Goa meet: Rahul
body: Rahul Gandhi has replied to Goa CM Manohar Parrikar\'s letter, which accused the Congress President of using his "visit to an ailing man for political gains". "He\'s under immense pressure from the PM after our meeting and needs to demonstrate his loyalty by attacking me," Gandhi wrote in his letter. Parrikar had clarified he didn\'t discuss Rafale deal with Rahul.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: 50-yr-old flight attendant walks on 2-seater aircraft's wing midair
body: A United Airlines flight attendant walked on a wing of a 2-seater aircraft to celebrate her 50th birthday. "I knew I\'d to do it...This will live on in my memory until my last day," Sabrina Swenson, who was tied to a harness, said. Swenson took training at Mason Wing Walking Academy in Washington before she and her pilot took off.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Ekta Kapoor confirms birth of baby boy Ravie via surrogacy
body: Producer Ekta Kapoor has confirmed she has become a mother to a baby boy via surrogacy. "Everything in life doesn\'t go the way you want it to but there are always solutions to those hiccups. I found mine and today I feel immensely blessed to become a parent," she wrote. The 43-year-old revealed that the baby has been named Ravie.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Bangkok deploys water-spraying drones to curb air pollution
body: Bangkok on Thursday deployed 50 water-spraying drones in order to reduce harmful PM2.5 particles, which had accumulated in the city\'s atmosphere. The drones, equipped with sprinklers, could reportedly carry 5-10 litres of water and fly over a two-square-kilometre area for 15-20 minutes on one charge. "If we do nothing, people will criticise us", Bangkok\'s Governor said.\n
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Hero MotoCorp sets up new R&D centre in Germany
body: Two-wheeler major Hero MotoCorp on Wednesday announced the setting up of its Research and Development (R&D) centre in Germany. The centre will operate in tandem with Hero's Global R&D hub in Jaipur, the company said. It would be under the direct supervision of Hero MotoCorp's Chief Technology Officer Markus Braunsperger, the company added.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: India get all out for 92, their lowest ODI total in New Zealand
body: India recorded their lowest ODI total in New Zealand after getting all out for 92 runs in 30.5 overs in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday. Seven of India's batsmen were dismissed for single-digit scores, while their number ten batsman Yuzvendra Chahal top-scored with 18*(37). India's previous lowest ODI total in New Zealand was 108.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Yogi has no idea about laptop, how will he give it: Akhilesh
body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday said, "Our CM (Yogi Adityanath) is baba, he has no idea about laptop, how would he give it?" "We have distributed a large number of laptops in Kannauj...if they have given any bigger laptop, they should tell us," he added. Akhilesh had launched free laptop scheme for 12th pass students in 2013.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: 3 golden crowns missing from Tirupati temple; probe underway
body: Three golden crowns belonging to the processional deities at Sri Govindaraja Swamy Temple in Tirupati went missing on Saturday evening. "Doors of the temple were closed after the evening ritual...When the doors were re-opened half-an-hour later, the crowns were found missing, a Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams official said. Police are suspecting one of the temple staffers to be involved, he added.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Qatar to invest $200 million in Airtel Africa
body: Airtel on Wednesday said that Qatar's sovereign wealth fund Qatar Investment Authority will invest $200 million through a primary equity issuance in Airtel Africa. India's second-largest telecom operator's Africa unit recently raised $1.25 billion from six investors. Airtel Africa, the holding company for Airtel's operations in 14 African countries, is preparing for an initial public offering.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Mumbai's talent tech startup Shortlist raises $2 million
body: Mumbai-headquartered talent technology startup Shortlist has raised $2 million in a Series A round of funding. The round was led by Blue Haven Initiative, with participation from Compass Venture Capital, Zephyr Acorn among others. Founded by Simon Desjardins, Paul Breloff and Matt Schnuck, Shortlist screens candidates using predictive chat-based interviews and online competency-based assessments.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Brain signals converted directly into speech using AI: Study
body: New York\'s Columbia University neuro-engineers claim to have developed a system that can convert human brain signals directly into speech using artificial intelligence. Researchers revealed a computer algorithm \'vocoder\' was used. "This is the same technology used by Amazon Echo and Apple Siri to give verbal responses to our questions," senior author of the study Nima Mesgarani said.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Feel lost how we got only six wickets vs Windies: Stuart Broad
body: After the Windies finished the second Test\'s second day at 272/6, registering a lead of 85 runs, England pacer Stuart Broad said that he felt a bit lost as to how England took only six wickets. "We\'ve put everything into it. Heart and soul has gone into that day," Broad further added about the ongoing second Test.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Alia buys apartment in Mumbai's Juhu for over ₹13 cr: Reports
body: Actress Alia Bhatt has reportedly bought a 2,300-square feet apartment for ₹13.11 crore on the first floor of a posh building in Mumbai's Juhu. She also received two open car parks. The 25-year-old actress had earlier reportedly purchased two properties on the second floor of the building from Anupam Kher and Kirron Kher for ₹5.16 crore and ₹3.83 crore.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Girls like Alia send me their trailers, don't return favours: Kangana
body: Kangana Ranaut has said many of her contemporaries don\'t support her work, but when it comes to promoting their films, they call her "shamelessly". "These girls send me their trailers like Alia (Bhatt) sent me the trailer of \'Raazi\' and said, \'Please watch it\'," she added. Kangana further said when it was their turn, there was no response from anyone.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Pandya has abundance of talent which he needs to realise: MSK Prasad
body: Talking about Hardik Pandya, who recently returned to India playing XI after being suspended over his comments on Koffee with Karan, chief selector MSK Prasad said Pandya "definitely" adds huge strength to team\'s balance. "He brings in...additional strength to all three departments...He has an abundance of talent, which he needs to realise and convert into match-winning performances," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Kapil meets ex-PM Manmohan Singh and his wife, shares pics
body: Kapil Sharma recently met the former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and his wife Gursharan Kaur. Sharing the pictures on social media, he wrote, "Was an honour meeting such a humble and simple statesman like you, and receiving blessings from ma\'am." "Thank you...for the warmth, hospitality and a heart to heart conversation about our roots in Amritsar," Kapil further wrote.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: This budget is just a trailer of what is to come after polls: PM
body: Speaking about the Interim Budget, PM Narendra Modi on Friday said, "This is an Interim Budget. This is just a trailer of the budget which, after elections, will take India on the path to development." "From middle class to labourers, from farmers\' growth to the development of businessmen...everyone has been taken care of in this Interim Budget," PM Modi added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: MP to get 1,000 cow shelters to house 1 lakh cows by May
body: The Madhya Pradesh government will open 1,000 cow shelters to provide shelter to one lakh cows by May, a senior official revealed. The official added, "The capacity of 614 private cow shelters would be increased to 60,000." The scheme is the first of its kind in the state and is expected to cost ₹450 crore, he further said.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Welcome move: Producer Madhur on anti-camcording provision
body: Filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar said that the government\'s decision to introduce anti-camcording provision in the Cinematography Act to curtail piracy was a "welcome move". "The anti-camcording provisions will support the industry\'s growth by curtailing illegal recordings of films in cinema halls,” producer Siddharth Roy Kapur said. The provision was introduced as part of the Interim Budget 2019-20.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Flipkart CEO opposes revised FDI policy deadline: Report
body: Flipkart CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy reportedly opposed the February 1 deadline of the revised FDI norms on e-commerce saying the regulations could cause "significant customer disruption" if the deadline wasn\'t extended. Reports added, he said the policy imposes conditions that could have undesirable impacts on India\'s e-commerce growth. His statements were written in letter to DIPP, as per Reuters.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Budget unquestionably pro-growth, pro-farmer, pro-poor: Arun Jaitley
body: Complimenting Finance Minister Piyush Goyal for delivering an "excellent" budget, Union Minister Arun Jaitley said, "The budget is unquestionably pro-growth, fiscally prudent, pro-farmer and pro-poor." "The budget expands spending while pragmatically sticking to fiscal prudence," Jaitley said. "Between 2014-19, every budget has given significant relief to the middle class," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: UP police get adoption requests for rape survivor's newborn baby
body: Days after a 15-year-old rape survivor gave birth to a boy in Meerut, several couples have approached the police seeking to adopt the baby. The police said the girl will take a decision on the adoption requests, even as her family expressed displeasure over them. She had used her baby as evidence against her rapist in court.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Ayushmann's wife Tahira walks the ramp at Lakmé Fashion Week
body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana\'s wife Tahira Kashyap walked the runway at Lakmé Fashion Week Summer/ Resort 2019. Tahira shared a picture from the event and wrote, "I got the instructions to not to smile too much, but couldn\'t control...first time and super fun!" She had revealed in September last year that she has been diagnosed with breast cancer.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: 2nd Apple worker arrested over self-driving car secret theft
body: The FBI has arrested Apple employee Jizhong Chen for allegedly stealing secrets from its self-driving car unit and trying to sell it to a Chinese competitor. An employee reportedly saw Chen taking photos in a sensitive work area, after which an investigation was conducted. Former Apple employee Xiaolang Zhang was arrested in July 2018 for the same.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Tulsi Gabbard, 1st Hindu in US Congress, launches prez campaign
body: Tulsi Gabbard, the first-ever Hindu elected to the US Congress, officially launched her 2020 presidential campaign on Saturday. The 37-year-old launched her candidacy in the US state of Hawaii, where she has served as a congresswoman since 2013. A Samoan-American, Gabbard is an Iraq war veteran and a member of the Democratic Party.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Tribunal rejects Ruias' ₹54,000-cr settlement bid for Essar Steel
body: The National Company Law Tribunal has rejected the settlement offer made by Essar Steel's promoters, the Ruia family, to regain control of the company. Ruias made a ₹54,389-crore offer on the day the Committee of Creditors approved ArcelorMittal's ₹42,000-crore resolution plan. ArcelorMittal welcomed the ruling and said it protects the integrity of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC).
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Don't overburden Iraq with your own issues: Iraq President to Trump
body: After US President Donald Trump said he would ask US troops stationed in Iraq to "watch" Iran, Iraqi President Barham Salih said, "Don\'t overburden Iraq with your own issues." Salih added US troops in Iraq are there as part of an agreement between the two countries with a specific mission of combating terrorism and that they should stick to that.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: SpaceX 'almost succeeds' to catch $6M rocket nose using boat
body: Elon Musk-led SpaceX has tweeted a video of its boat, Mr. Steven, \'almost succeeding\' in catching its rocket\'s nose. The nosecone equipped with a parachute can be seen falling into the boat\'s net before bouncing off it and falling into the water. Musk once tweeted, "Imagine you had $6 million cash flying through air. Would you try to recover? Yes".
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Gmail faces temporary global outage, users face '404 error'
body: Gmail on Tuesday faced a global outage, which also affected India, wherein certain users complained they faced a \'404 error\' message while trying to sign-in to their accounts. The error message read: "The requested URL was not found on this server. That\'s all we know." Google responded saying "problem with Gmail should be resolved (now). We apologise for the inconvenience".
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: PM waving at imaginary friends in J&K: Mufti on his Dal Lake video
body: After PM Narendra Modi was seen waving in a video of his Dal Lake boat ride, former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti said, "The wave is for BJP\'s countless imaginary \'friends\' in Kashmir." "This camera person has done the Hon PM a huge disservice...there\'s no way the PM would be waving at an empty lake," National Conference\'s Omar Abdullah tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Toll staffer shares video of being shot at, says it was by police
body: A Nainital toll plaza employee named Nandan Singh has filed a complaint alleging a police constable fired at him after asking him the whereabouts of another employee who was not present. Singh, who submitted CCTV footage showing he narrowly escaped the bullet, further claimed the constable threatened him to keep quiet. The police have ordered an investigation into the incident.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Human mind can overcome any disease: Parrikar on World Cancer Day
body: To mark the World Cancer Day on Monday, Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar tweeted, "Human mind can overcome any disease #WorldCancerDay." The 63-year-old is suffering from a pancreatic ailment and is currently admitted at the Institute Rotary Cancer Hospital at AIIMS, New Delhi. Parrikar was diagnosed with a pancreatic ailment in February last year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Boeing sales cross $100bn for 1st time in its 102-yr history
body: US-based Boeing on Wednesday reported annual sales worth $101.12 billion in 2018, the first time the planemaker's sales crossed the $100-billion mark in its 102-year history. The company said it expects to deliver between 895 and 905 commercial aircraft in 2019. Boeing retained its position as the world's largest planemaker for the seventh straight year, delivering 806 aircraft in 2018.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Let's have another demonetisation: Chidambaram on revised GDP rate
body: Taking a dig at the government after it revised GDP growth rate upwards from 7.1% to 8.2% for 2016-17, the year of demonetisation, Congress MP P Chidambaram tweeted, "The demonetisation year was the best year of growth (8.2%) under Mr Modi." "So, let\'s have another round of demonetisation. This time let\'s demonetise 100 rupee notes," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Interim Budget a 'jumla' by the BJP govt: CPI Gen Secy Reddy
body: CPI General Secretary S Sudhakar Reddy on Sunday said that the Interim Budget placed by the BJP-led central government is a "jumla". He added that the BJP government is "destroying" all the institutions in the country. He said "even the Parliament does not function properly" and people\'s issues are not raised inside the Parliament.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Logistical nightmare: BCCI official on players taking families to WC
body: A BCCI official has said it\'d be a \'logistical nightmare\' if families of Indian cricketers travel with them during the 2019 World Cup in England. "If the team is travelling with less number of members...it\'s easier to manage," he added. He further said there is also the problem of arranging match tickets for families and it has to be regulated.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Happy birthday to my hero: Tiger on dad Jackie's birthday
body: Tiger Shroff took to Instagram to share a picture of his father Jackie Shroff on the occasion of his 61st birthday. "Happy birthday to my...handsome father/friend/love/hero! Love you daddy," the actor wrote. Tiger\'s \'Student Of The Year 2\' co-star Ananya Panday shared an old picture with Jackie and wrote, "Happy birthday to the coolest there is and ever will be!"
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Gandhi family should be named as 'bail family': BJP
body: Talking about Congress, BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Saturday said, "Gandhi family...should be named as the \'bail family\'." "Such is the credibility of the family that most of the family members are out on bail," he added. This comes after Congress chief Rahul Gandhi\'s brother-in-law Robert Vadra was granted interim bail in a money laundering case on Saturday.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Yogi has no place to stand in UP, so roaming in WB: Mamata
body: Talking about Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said, "He doesn’t have a place to stand in UP that’s why he\'s roaming around in Bengal." "He should take care of UP first," she added. This comes after the West Bengal government denied permission for Yogi\'s chopper to land at Balurghat.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Yogi's Bankura rally scrapped over delay in chopper permit
body: West Bengal BJP has cancelled a public rally of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Bankura as the district administration was delaying in giving permission for the chopper landing. However, Yogi's Purulia rally will take place as per schedule, BJP state president Dilip Ghosh said. On Sunday, West Bengal government had denied permission for Yogi's chopper to land at Balurghat.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Nagpur Police uses 'Valentine's Day' in tweet to promote road safety
body: Nagpur Police on Sunday posted a tweet to promote road safety which began with 'Valentine's Day' and ended with 'ay Bhai Zara Dekhke Chalo!!' With Valentine's Day approaching, such tweets which begin with 'Valentine's Day' and end unexpectedly have gone viral on social media. Earlier, the Mumbai Police used film Uri's 'How's the Josh?' dialogue to promote stronger passwords.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: JNU writes to VP Naidu, LS Speaker over MPs' protest
body: The JNU administration has written to Vice President Venkaiah Naidu and Lok Sabha speaker Sumitra Mahajan alleging that two MPs violated Delhi High Court orders. "JNU Teacher\'s Association office-bearers mislead the MPs and brought them to protest at administration building which has been prohibited," it said. The two had joined a protest to resist dilution of reservations in public education.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Associated Press, Snopes stop fact-checking for Facebook
body: Two US-based agencies Associated Press and Snopes have ended their fact-checking partnerships with Facebook. "AP constantly evaluates how to best deploy its fact-checking resources...that includes ongoing conversations with Facebook", an AP spokesperson said. Snopes said it needed to "determine...that [their] efforts to aid any particular platform are a net positive for...online community".
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Venezuela bars self-declared President from leaving country
body: Venezuela has barred Juan Guaidó, who declared himself the interim President, from leaving the country and froze his bank accounts. He\'s prohibited from leaving for having "caused harm to peace in the republic", President of Venezuela\'s Supreme Tribunal of Justice, Maikel Moreno, said. This came after the US gave Guaidó the right to control Venezuela\'s bank accounts in the US.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Jason Roy pulls off one-handed diving catch near boundary
body: Sylhet Sixers' Jason Roy pulled off a one-handed diving catch near the boundary rope to dismiss Chittagong Vikings' Yasir Ali for 27(27) in their Bangladesh Premier League 2019 match on Friday. Ali pulled a delivery from Alok Kapali in the eight over with an aim at clearing deep midwicket but Roy plucked the ball with his outstretched left hand.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: SA's Miller wins Man of the Match for 4 catches and 2 run-outs
body: South Africa batsman David Miller was named Man of the Match in the first T20I against Pakistan for taking four catches and effecting two run-outs. The 29-year-old became the second cricketer to win the award without taking a wicket or scoring over 10 in a T20I. Pakistan lost while chasing for the first time since 2016 T20 World Cup.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Ireland says it won't leave European Union and join UK
body: Republic of Ireland's Europe Minister, Helen McEntee, has said the country won't leave the European Union (EU) and join the UK. She added that 92% of the country's population voted last year to remain in the EU. The border between the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland (part of the UK) has been a major issue in the Brexit negotiations.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Twitter bug mislabels retweets, confuses users: Report
body: A Twitter bug caused users to view retweets on their timelines which appeared to be from users they didn\'t follow, according to TechCrunch. Twitter reportedly confirmed the bug was mislabelling "social proof" tag on retweets due to which users viewed retweets from those they did follow as unfamiliar. Twitter\'s support handle hasn\'t responded to users about the bug as yet.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: India-Aus 1st T20I shifted to Vizag due to security concerns
body: The first India-Australia T20I has been moved from Bengaluru to Visakhapatnam due to security concerns raised by Karnataka's state association. Bengaluru will now host the second T20I on February 27 after the KSCA and Andhra Cricket Association decided to swap the T20Is. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be visiting Bengaluru on the day the match was set to be held.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Called PM Modi 'sir' 10 times to satisfy his ego: Andhra CM
body: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu has said, "When I met then US President Bill Clinton, I addressed him as Mr Clinton, not as \'sir\'. (PM Narendra) Modi is my junior in politics...I addressed him as sir 10 times." "I did this...to satisfy his ego in the hope that he will do justice to the state," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Over 2,000-year-old tomb with 50 mummies uncovered in Egypt
body: Egyptian archaeologists have uncovered a Pharaonic tomb containing 50 mummies dating back more than 2,000 years in Egypt\'s Minya city near Cairo, the antiquities ministry said. The mummies, of which 12 were children, were found in four burial chambers 30-ft deep in the Tuna el-Gebel archaeological site. "We have not found names written in hieroglyphics," Supreme Council of Antiquities said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Self-styled godman arrested for allegedly raping 2 girls
body: Self-styled godman Manmohan Saheb was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly raping two sisters at his ashrams in Bihar and Punjab. The elder sister, now aged 20, alleged she has been sexually abused since 2016, adding her 19-year-old sister has been sexually exploited since 2010. The Ludhiana-based survivors said they came forward after Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim's conviction.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: India crash out of Davis Cup after 1-3 loss to Italy
body: India crashed out of the Davis Cup after losing to Italy 1-3 in the World Group Qualifiers knockout stage in Kolkata on Saturday. India's only win of the tie came when Rohan Bopanna and Divij Sharan beat Matteo Berrettini and Simone Bolelli in the doubles match. This was the sixth time that India faced Italy in the Davis Cup.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Indian Coast Guard evacuates ill baby in Maldives' Gan Island
body: Indian Coast Guard pilots successfully evacuated a critically ill infant in the Maldives\' Gan Island on Monday. "The noble efforts of the Indian technical team, in collaboration with the Maldives National Defence Force Air Wing, are truly valued," Chief of Defence Force of the Maldives, Major General Abdulla Shamaal said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Can never look at female body, even if naked, in vulgar way: Pooja
body: Filmmaker Pooja Bhatt, while talking about the presentation of women in her films, said, "I can never look at a female body, even if it\'s naked, in a vulgar manner." "Our audience can say...the women in my films are bold or sensual, but never ever vulgar," she added. Pooja further said her censor board is her "own heart and mind".
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Citizenship bill won't violate Assam Accord: Assam CM
body: Talking about the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal on Friday said that the Assam Accord will not be violated if the bill was implemented. "It is not right to unnecessarily create social disturbance" over the bill, he added. “The...bill is for entire nation, not only Assam...Then why unnecessary fear is being created among people?" he further said.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Dewan Housing Finance shares plunge 11% after media report
body: Dewan Housing Finance (DHFL) shares fell as much as 11% on Tuesday following a media report that alleged over ₹31,000-crore fraud by its controlling shareholders, the Wadhawans. The report alleged they diverted funds, including money borrowed from state-run banks, to shell companies. DHFL in response said the report was made with "mala fide intent" to damage its "goodwill and reputation".
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Ex-stats body chief Mohanan says leaked jobs report was final
body: After NITI Aayog called the leaked government job survey for 2017-18 a "draft report", former acting National Statistical Commission Chairman PC Mohanan said it\'s the "final report" and needed no further approval. The leaked report shows India\'s unemployment rate reached a 45-year high in 2017-18. Mohanan has resigned earlier this week because the report wasn\'t released.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: BJP used me to win 2014 elections: Anna Hazare
body: Social activist Anna Hazare, on the sixth day of his hunger strike, said that the BJP "used" him in the 2014 elections. "Everybody knows that it was my agitation for Lokpal that catapulted the BJP and also the AAP to power," he added. Hazare is fasting to press for the appointment of Lokpal, Lokayukta and resolution of farmers\' issues.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Disproportionate overreaction: Jaitley on Mamata's dharna
body: After WB CM Mamata Banerjee sat on a dharna to protest CBI action in Kolkata, Union Minister Arun Jaitley called her actions a "disproportionate overreaction". In a Facebook post titled \'The Kleptocrat\'s Club\', Jaitley wrote, "She did it to defocus from other opposition aspirants for the highest office and to project herself as the nucleus of India\'s opposition."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: UK MP jailed for lying to avoid speeding ticket
body: UK MP Fiona Onasanya has been jailed for three months after she was found guilty of lying about a speeding ticket. Onasanya was found texting and speeding in an incident last year. She'd said that one of her former tenants was driving her car when it was caught speeding, however, he was found to be in Russia at the time.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Real Madrid's 18-yr-old Vinicius scores 1st La Liga goal
body: Real Madrid's 18-year-old attacker Vinicius Jr scored his first La Liga goal as Real Madrid cruised to a 3-0 win over Alaves on Sunday. The match also saw Karim Benzema score his sixth goal in four games. The was Real Madrid's fifth consecutive win, helping them reach within two points of second-placed Atletico Madrid.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: I've nothing to do with Delhi restaurants, pubs in my name: Gambhir
body: Ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir took to Twitter to clarify that he has nothing to do with the restobars, restaurants and pubs using his name in central and west Delhi. "In fact I\'ve no such establishment in my name anywhere in the world," Gambhir added. In 2017, Gambhir had sought to restrain a Delhi-based restobar chain from using his name.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Support removing Hirani's name from 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha...': Rajkummar
body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said he supports the revoking of filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani's credit from the film 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga' amid the sexual harassment allegations levelled against Hirani. The director has been accused of sexually assaulting a woman on 'Sanju' sets. Rao said he feels sad for the woman and hopes an investigation is conducted.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: 'French Spiderman' arrested for climbing Philippines skyscraper
body: Urban free climber Alain Robert, popularly known as the \'French Spiderman\', has been arrested in the Philippines after climbing an over 700-foot-tall skyscraper in Manila. "I see thousands of people inside the building. I did brighten their day," Robert said when asked about his climb. He holds the Guinness World Record for \'most buildings climbed\', having scaled over 120 structures.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Waited for women to be liberated in B'wood: Sneha on comeback
body: Sneha Ullal, while talking about her comeback in Bollywood, said, "I was so waiting for this time to come where women are free, liberated to do anything in the business, not only acting but filmmaking, producing everything." "When I started in 2005, things were very different," said Sneha, who made Bollywood debut with Salman Khan\'s \'Lucky: No Time for Love\'
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: This isn't Pak: AAP MP on 'Budget is surgical strike' remark
body: After Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi likened the Interim Budget to "surgical strike", AAP MP Sanjay Singh said the government shouldn\'t use such phrases as "this is India and not Pakistan". "Did you waive farmers\' loans? You\'ve waived loans of big businessmen," he added. "You are giving ₹17 per day to farmers and calling this surgical strike," he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Can't keep quiet now: Ex-PM after K'taka CM offered to quit
body: Amid growing differences between alliance partners Congress and Janata Dal (Secular) in Karnataka, former PM HD Deve Gowda said, "I am in pain...I can\'t keep quiet now." All kinds of things have happened since HD Kumaraswamy became the CM, he added. This comes after Kumaraswamy recently threatened to quit if Congress doesn\'t control its MLAs.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Stones thrown at India's fastest train in 2nd such incident
body: India\'s fastest train, Vande Bharat Express, was pelted with stones on Friday while it was on its way to New Delhi station, from where it was to begin its trial run to Prayagraj. "Second coach from the front was hit near [Delhi\'s] Sadar area," officials said. In December, stones were pelted during the train\'s trial run between Delhi and Agra.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Facebook hires its privacy critic as privacy policy manager
body: Social media giant Facebook has hired privacy critic Nate Cardozo, formerly the top legal counsel for US privacy watchdog EFF, as a privacy policy manager for WhatsApp. Cardozo had called Facebook a "faceless corporation" whose business model depends on user\'s confusion and indifference about privacy, in October 2015. Facebook has also hired attorney Robyn Greene as its privacy policy manager.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Rajasthan CM announces hike in youth unemployment allowance
body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday announced to raise the unemployment allowance for the youth of the state from March 1. "Girls will get ₹3,500 and boys ₹3,000 as unemployment allowance for two years," he said. The Congress had promised unemployment allowance to youths in its election manifesto if it was voted to power.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Indian embassy opens hotline for 129 students detained in US
body: The Indian embassy in the US has opened a 24/7 hotline and appointed a nodal officer to assist 129 Indian students who were arrested in a "pay-and-stay" university visa scam. Following Indian authorities\' intervention, some of the students were released. The students are accused of enrolling at a fake university to maintain their student visa status to obtain work permits.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: US firm fined $1mn over fake eyelashes with materials from N Korea
body: A US cosmetics firm has been fined nearly $1 million for importing fake eyelashes containing materials from UN-sanctioned North Korea. The firm's compliance program and its supplier audits failed to discover that approximately 80% of the fake eyelash kits contained materials from North Korea. Sanctions have been imposed on North Korea over its nuclear and ballistic missile programs.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Railways to give ₹5L to family of Seemanchal Express victims
body: Indian Railways has announced an ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each to family of those who lost their lives in the Seemanchal Express derailment in Bihar on Sunday. Additionally, ₹1 lakh will be given to the grievously injured and ₹50,000 to those who have suffered "simple injuries". The Railways will bear all medical expenses, office of Railway Minister Piyush Goyal tweeted.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Syria was loaded with ISIS until I came along: Trump
body: US President Donald Trump on Friday said, "Syria was loaded with ISIS until I came along", adding that he "inherited a total mess in Syria and Afghanistan". "We\'ll soon have destroyed 100% of (ISIS) but will be watching them closely. It is now time to start coming home after many years", he said defending the withdrawal of American troops.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: No one who cheats India can hide anywhere in world: Jaitley
body: Union Minister Arun Jaitley on Thursday said no one who cheats India can hide anywhere in the world and escape. His statement comes against the backdrop of Dubai-based businessman Rajiv Saxena and corporate aviation lobbyist Deepak Talwar (both accused in AgustaWestland scam) getting deported to India. He added Prime Minister Narendra Modi has introduced a culture of honesty in governance.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Can't see anyone but Shahid in 'Kabir Singh': Kiara Advani
body: Kiara Advani, who is starring opposite Shahid Kapoor in their upcoming film \'Kabir Singh\', said, "After completing an entire schedule with [Shahid], I can definitely say that I can\'t see anyone but him in the titular role." "It\'s a pleasure to work with someone who brings so much to a scene," Kiara added while talking about her co-actor.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Lady Gaga, Bradley Cooper to perform at 91st Academy Awards
body: Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper will be performing their Oscar-nominated song 'Shallow' from their film 'A Star Is Born' at the 91st Academy Awards [also known as the Oscars] that will be held on February 24. Reports had earlier stated that The Academy Awards will be held without a host for the first time in 30 years.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: I'm going to shoot up a school: US boy tells Siri; gets list of schools
body: A middle school student in Indiana, US got a list of schools after he told Apple\'s digital assistant Siri, "I am going to shoot up a school." The 13-year-old, who took a screenshot of Siri\'s response and posted it on social media, was arrested and charged with intimidation. His friends on social media had alerted the police.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: I'm not missing being in front of the camera: Karisma Kapoor
body: Karisma Kapoor said she doesn\'t miss being in front of the camera and she has always believed in doing what interests her as an artiste. "Everybody says I should do something...I\'ve never planned anything in my life. So, you never know I may do a movie soon," added the actress who was last seen in a cameo role in \'Zero\'.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Piyush Goyal says MGNREGA scheme to get ₹60,000 crore in FY20
body: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20 speech, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal has said that MGNREGA, the rural job guarantee scheme, will get ₹60,000 crore in 2019-20. The government will also allocate ₹19,000 crore for construction of rural roads in 2019-20. Farmers affected by natural disasters will receive 2% interest subvention and additional 3% if they repay loans on time.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Indian Oil looking for annual deal to buy crude from US
body: Indian Oil Corporation on Wednesday said it's looking for an annual deal to buy US crude as it seeks to broaden oil purchasing options. This comes amid uncertainties over Iran imports. The US had in November granted a six-month waiver to India from sanctions against Iran and restricted the country's monthly intake of Iranian oil to 3,00,000 barrels per day.\n\n
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Two-thirds of Himalayan glaciers could melt by 2100: Report
body: As per Hindu Kush Himalaya Assessment, two-thirds of the Himalayan glaciers could melt by 2100 if current rates of global warming and greenhouse gas emissions aren't cut. The Hindu Kush Himalaya region, spread across eight nations, inhabits 240 million people, the report said. Impacts could range from worsened air pollution to increase in extreme weather events, a report editor said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Sonam, Anil starrer 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh...' hits the theatres
body: Sonam Kapoor and Anil Kapoor starrer \'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga\', which released today, is an "important, well-intended entertainer," wrote Times Now. Firstpost called the film "a warm ode to loving and living". The "film is a whiff of fresh air with daring vision," said NDTV. It has been rated \n3.5/5 (Times Now), 3/5 (Firstpost) and 4/5 (NDTV).
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Goa minister 'compares' CM Parrikar to Jesus, apologises later
body: Congratulating Goa CM Manohar Parrikar for new cable bridge Atal Setu, Goa minister Vijai Sardesai said, "Jesus built bridges not walls. You need to build bridges. Manohar Parrikar is a person who builds bridges." Later, Congress criticised Sardesai for comparing Parrikar to Jesus and "hurting religious sentiments". He then apologised saying, "I seek pardon from people whose sentiments are hurt."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Protecting Rani Lakshmi Bai in real life: Ankita on Kangana
body: Ankita Lokhande, who plays Rani Lakshmi Bai\'s chief commander Jhalkari Bai in \'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi\', said that she\'s protecting the film\'s star and co-director Kangana Ranaut in real life too. "I\'ve loved Kangana for what she is. Most of my scenes have been shot by her," she added. She further said she respected Kangana for co-directing the film.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Tesla patents open for all, our competition is gasoline cars: Musk
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday reiterated that the company\'s patents were open to all for the advancement of electric vehicle technology and sustainable transport. "Our true competition is not the small trickle of non-Tesla electric cars being produced, but the enormous flood of gasoline cars pouring out of the world\'s factories every day," tweeted Musk.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Delhi consultant accuses SpiceJet MD of cheating, police file FIR
body: The Delhi Police has registered an FIR against SpiceJet Chairman and MD Ajay Singh and seven other directors in a cheating case. A Delhi-based private consultant alleged that they used his services in the aviation sector, but did not pay his fees. "The complainant has defrauded the company and is now filing frivolous complaints to extract money," SpiceJet said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: People in AC rooms don't know what ₹6,000 is for farmers: PM
body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday hit out at the opposition for criticising the income support scheme of ₹6,000 per year for farmers owning up to two hectares of land. "People sitting in air-conditioned rooms...don\'t know what ₹6,000 means for a poor farmer,” he said. Earlier, Congress President Rahul Gandhi called the scheme, announced during Interim Budget, an "insult" to farmers.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: 3D printer that uses light to turn liquids into objects made
body: UC Berkeley researchers including PhD scholar Indrasen Bhattacharya, have created a light-powered 3D printer that can transform liquids into detailed objects within minutes. The researchers first created a video of a 3D model's images, which was beamed to a rotating container with a light-sensitive liquid. The liquid then hardened in reaction to the light rays to produce the 3D model.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: In team, name on front more important than one on the back: Jadhav
body: Following India\'s 4-1 ODI series victory against New Zealand, batting all-rounder Kedar Jadhav took to Twitter to share an article on him asking the team \'How\'s the josh?\' during celebrations. "As they say, when you work as a team, name on the front is more important than name on the back...How\'s the josh?...Right Vicky Kaushal, MS Dhoni," he wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Sushmita dances to her song 'Chunari...' at nephew's wedding
body: A video shows Sushmita Sen dancing to her song \'Chunari Chunari\' from 1999 film \'Biwi No. 1\' with her nephew at his wedding in Delhi. Sharing the video on social media, Sushmita wrote, "This seems to be one of Shiv Chopra\'s [nephew\'s] favourite songs for he knows all the steps!!!" The original song features Sushmita and Salman Khan.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: SC dismisses PIL against Asthana's appointment to aviation body
body: The Supreme Court has dismissed a petition against the appointment of former CBI Special Director Rakesh Asthana as Director General of Bureau of Civil Aviation Security when an FIR is still pending against him. The apex court told the petitioner, lawyer Manohar Lal Sharma, "Your PIL... made little sense. Everything cannot be rolled in under one sky into a petition."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Ranveer Singh jumps into a crowd at event, hurts people
body: Ranveer Singh, who was at an event on Sunday to promote \'Gully Boy\', jumped into a crowd of people after completing his performance. However, he ended up hurting a few people, who were recording his performance on their phones. Sharing a news clipping of the incident, a Twitter user wrote, "Grow up Ranveer Singh and stop your childish antics."
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Chargesheet filed against producer Prernaa for ₹31-cr fraud
body: Economic Offences Wing of Mumbai Police filed a chargesheet against producer Prernaa Arora for selling distribution rights of 'Kedarnath' to multiple companies. Prernaa was earlier arrested following a complaint by producer Vashu Bhagnani accusing her of fraud of ₹31.6 crore. Bhagnani further alleged Prernaa failed to repay a loan of ₹9 crore which she'd taken to buy a house.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: BJP using government agencies to blackmail people: Mamata
body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday alleged that the BJP is using central agencies like the CBI to "blackmail" people. She added, "Once you join the BJP, then there will be no cases." She further said that there will be no CBI, no ED, no I-T (Income Tax Department) against a person if he/she joins the BJP.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: US biologist who criticised China gene-edited babies editing embryos
body: A Columbia University cell biologist who called the birth of gene-edited babies in China "genome vandalism" has said he\'s trying to repair DNA mutations in human embryos. Dr Dietrich Egli, who is also using the award-winning CRISPR gene-editing method, said his experiments are intended to determine the procedure\'s safety. Egli claimed to destroy embryos after just one day of development.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Shami India's standout performer in last 5 months: Ravi Shastri
body: Head coach Ravi Shastri has said that fast bowler Mohammad Shami has been Team India\'s standout performer in the last five months. "He got a kick up the backside after failing the yo-yo test. He went back, did the hard yards, came back fit and hasn\'t broken down since. He has been outstanding, that too across all formats," Shastri added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Final jumla of Modi government: Kejriwal on Interim Budget 2019-20
body: Reacting to Centre keeping Delhi\'s share in central taxes and duties unchanged in the Interim Budget 2019-20, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Final jumla of Modi govt: it\'s interim budget too completely disappoints Delhi."  "Our share in central taxes remains frozen at ₹325 crore & nothing earmarked for local bodies. Delhi continues to be on its own financially," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Domino's operator fined ₹41.4 cr for not passing GST benefit
body: The GST anti-profiteering authority has found Domino's Pizza India's operator, Jubilant FoodWorks, guilty of not passing ₹41.42-crore GST cut benefit to consumers during November 2017-May 2018. The company has been asked to deposit the illegal gains with the government. This came after a customer complained that prices of items including 'Domino's Stuffed Garlic Bread' weren't reduced despite GST cut.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Woman rejects job after CEO bullies her in interview; he apologises
body: A 22-year-old writer turned down a job offer, claiming she was bullied to the point of tears during her two-hour interview by a UK company\'s CEO. Olivia Bland added the "brutal" interview brought back painful memories of her abusive relationship. "I am so sorry that anyone has been hurt, it is never my intent," Web Applications CEO Craig Dean replied.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: 7.4cr have bathed in Sangam during Kumbh till Feb 3: UP govt
body: Around 7.49 crore people have taken bath in Sangam at Prayagraj till Sunday during the Kumbh Mela, the Uttar Pradesh government said. It added that 2.25 crore people bathed in the Sangam on the first day of Kumbh Mela. It further said that an average of 5-7 lakh devotees took a dip in Sangam every day between January 21-30.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Picture of children 'clicking selfie with chappal' goes viral
body: A picture of five children pretending to pose for a selfie, with one of them holding his chappal like a smartphone, went viral. Producer-photographer Atul Kasbekar shared the image on Twitter and wrote that he would send them something each if "anyone can reliably" locate them. "I\'m sure this selfie deserves more likes than most," Boman Irani wrote on Instagram.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: BJP has given green signal to fight again from Mathura: Hema
body: BJP MP Hema Malini on Tuesday claimed that she had been given the "green signal by higher-ups" of the party to contest again from Mathura. She also promised the people of her constituency "modernisation" of the Mathura Junction railway station. The actor-politician also inaugurated various projects at the Mathura Junction.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: When film like 'Thackeray' works, you feel happy: Nawazuddin
body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui, who portrayed Bal Thackeray in the biopic \'Thackeray\', said, "It was just about the life of a man, whose story we chronicled in two hours. When a film like this works, you feel happy." Nawazuddin added, "I was slightly nervous because unlike what we call \'content-driven films\' which too now have five songs this wasn\'t the one."
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Kerala Congress leader charged for raping girl for 1.5 years
body: Wayanad District Congress Committee member OM George has been booked for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor tribal girl for one and a half years in Kerala. George, who is currently absconding, was suspended from the primary membership of the party. Meanwhile, the girl has been shifted to a government-run shelter home.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Ancient tsunami proof found in coastlines of Kachchh: Study
body: Researchers have found geological evidence for a palaeo-tsunami in northern Arabian Sea, believed to have taken place in 1008 AD, in the coastlines of Kachchh. Researchers identified a 250-km-long sand sheet deposition dating back to a thousand years, which is indicator of an underwater earthquake and an ancient tsunami. The coastline has unique geomorphic features of sediments, researchers said.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Shabana, Javed to attend conference on Kaifi Azmi in Pak
body: The Arts Council in Karachi has invited actress Shabana Azmi and her husband lyricist Javed Akhtar for a conference which will pay tribute to her father, noted poet Kaifi Azmi. Shabana and Akhtar have confirmed that they will be attending the event, an office bearer of the Arts Council said. The event will be held on February 23 and 24.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: B'desh board to build stadium after PM Sheikh Hasina’s name
body: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has decided to build an international cricket stadium in the country after the name of the current Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina. The stadium will be built in Dhaka's Purbachal area over the next three years. The board also thanked the PM for allocating nearly 38 acres in Purbachal for the new cricket stadium complex.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Direct tax collection up from ₹6.38 lakh cr to ₹12 lakh cr: FM
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal while presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 said the direct tax collections had risen from ₹6.38 lakh crore in 2013-14 to nearly ₹12 lakh crore this fiscal. He added the tax base was up from 3.79 crore to 6.85 crore. Last year, 99.54% returns were accepted without any scrutiny, he further said.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Explosives recovered from train coach, Assam railway station
body: Explosives including 600 gelatin sticks and 1,200 detonators were recovered from the Guwahati Railway Station and Avadh-Assam Express in Assam's Morigaon district on Monday. A bag was found abandoned at the railway station, while another unclaimed bag was recovered from the train coach. The items were seized and a case was registered.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Five killed, 30 injured in road accident in Jharkhand
body: Five people, including three women and a child, were killed and at least 30 injured on Sunday when the bus carrying them overturned in Jharkhand's Deoghar, police said. The driver lost control over the steering at the turn following which the vehicle overturned, the police added. Jharkhand Labour Minister has announced an immediate relief of ₹50,000 to the victims' kin.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Healthtech firm Medlife acquires IIT alumni's startup MedLabz
body: Bengaluru-based healthtech firm Medlife has acquired Mumbai-based digital healthcare platform and diagnostics startup MedLabz for an undisclosed amount. Medlife stated it plans to consolidate its diagnostics business through this acquisition. Founded in 2015 by six IIT Bombay and IIT Delhi alumni, MedLabz offers diagnostic services using its AI-based symptom-to-disease search engine.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Nadal to marry girlfriend this year after 14 years of dating: Report
body: Seventeen-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal will tie the knot with his longtime girlfriend Xisca Perelló this autumn in a ceremony in his hometown Mallorca, according to Spanish magazine 'Hola'. Nadal and Xisca, who have been dating since 2005, reportedly got engaged during a trip to Rome in May last year. The couple had kept their engagement private until recently.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: No precedent for non-NPT countries to join NSG: China
body: China has said there's no precedent for countries which haven't signed the Non-Proliferation Treaty to join the Nuclear Suppliers Group. China has opposed India's entry into NSG on the ground that India hasn't signed NPT. India's entry into the NSG 'requires sufficient negotiation among NSG members and a consensus among them to reach a resolution to the issue', China added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: College students, aged 19 and 21, arrested for ATM fraud of ₹1 crore
body: Two college students, Rajasthan's 19-year-old Asif Khan and Haryana's 21-year-old Asmat Khan, were arrested in Mumbai for allegedly cheating over 10 banks of ₹1 crore. The duo used to switch off ATM machines seconds before they dispensed money. After withdrawing the cash, they claimed that the money was debited from their accounts despite incomplete transactions and demanded refunds from banks.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Kangana made fake promises to cast: 'Manikarnika' actress Mishti
body: Actress Mishti, who has featured in \'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi\', has said the film\'s co-director Kangana Ranaut made false promises to the cast. "Kangana had said, \'I want dates because all characters look jumbled up...I\'m trying my best to give everybody a prominent space on screen.\' After watching the movie, there is no scope for other characters," Mishti added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Dance India Dance winner Salman Yusuff Khan booked for molestation
body: A molestation case has been filed against Bollywood choreographer Salman Yusuff Khan, Dance India Dance season 1 winner, at a Mumbai police station. The victim alleged that Salman, along with his brother, tried to misbehave with her on two separate occasions. According to the FIR filed, Salman "touched her inappropriately" and said "such things happen in Bollywood" when she objected.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Four BJP men held for thrashing journalist in Chhattisgarh
body: Four BJP functionaries, including the Raipur unit chief, were arrested for allegedly thrashing a local journalist at the party office in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, police said. The journalist had gone to cover a meeting the BJP had called to review their defeat in Raipur city in recent Assembly elections. Journalists had staged a protest demanding the arrest of the four accused.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Even if I tie rakhi to Amar Singh, people will talk: Jaya Prada
body: Actor-turned-politician Jaya Prada has said people will continue to talk about her and Amar Singh even if she tied him a rakhi. "So many people have helped me...and Amar Singh ji is my godfather," she added. Talking about when her morphed images were circulated and her fall out with Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan, Jaya said, "Only Amar ji...supported me."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Rahat Fateh Ali Khan gets notice for smuggling currency out of India
body: Pakistani singer Rahat Fateh Ali Khan has been issued a show cause notice by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for allegedly smuggling illegal foreign currency out of India for three years. Khan got $340,000 (₹2.42 crore) through illegal means, of which he reportedly smuggled $225,000 (₹1.6 crore). The ED has sought the singer's response within 45 days.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: People will blame PM if something happens to me: Anna Hazare
body: Social activist Anna Hazare, on the fourth day of his hunger strike said, “If something happened to me, people will hold Prime Minister responsible.” This comes after Hazare received a letter from PM Narendra Modi, which Hazare said did not address any issues raised by him. Hazare is fasting to press for the appointment of Lokpal and Lokayukta.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Would be great to star with Ranveer in gay film: Rajkummar
body: While speaking about acting in a \'gay film\', Rajkummar Rao said, "I think Ranveer would be a great choice to star opposite." "He\'s a great friend and also the way his career graph is going and how he has come up as an actor, I\'m a huge fan," he added. Rajkummar further said he shares a "great rapport" with Ranveer.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Pacer once took 7 wickets for just 1 run in 32 balls in a Test
body: Former Windies fast bowler Curtly Ambrose dismissed seven Australian batsmen within a span of 32 balls giving away just one run, in a Test match on January 30, 1993. Ambrose's spell helped his team bowl out Australia for 119 in the first innings, after being 85 for 2 at one point. Ambrose ended with first-innings figures of 18-9-25-7.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: L&T's retired Chairman encashes unused leaves of 50yrs, gets ₹19 cr
body: Padma Vibhushan awardee and retired non-executive chairman of L&T Group, Anil Manibhai Naik, received at least ₹19 crore after encashing his accumulated leaves of over 50 years. The company also revealed Naik got ₹55.038 crore as gratuity and ₹1.50 crore as pension that is a part of his retirement benefit. Naik had joined L&T in 1965 as a junior engineer.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Want to buy house for my parents: Dance Plus 4 winner Chetan
body: \'Dance Plus 4\' winner Chetan Salunkhe, who was nicknamed Shravan Kumar for his love towards his parents, has said that he wants to buy a house for his parents. "That will be the priority for now. I never thought that I would be on \'Dance Plus\' and even win it...I will take opportunities as and when it comes," added Chetan.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Film industry is full of petty and small people: Kangana
body: Kangana Ranaut said that she feels the film industry is full of "petty and small people" who don\'t rise above their likes and dislikes. Talking about the reaction of people of the industry after watching her latest film \'Manikarnika\', Kangana added, "Industry people are being absolutely obnoxious and ganging up against the film. They\'re not saying anything and ignoring it."\n\n
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Apple Siri head steps down as VP after 7 years: Report
body: Apple's Vice President for its voice-enabled assistant Siri, Bill Stasior, has stepped down from his role after seven years, according to a report. Stasior, who was hired in 2012 reportedly after two of Siri's creators left, will continue to work in Apple in a different role, the report added. Stasior worked in Amazon's A9 retail search team before joining Apple.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: 45 meetings with banks in 12 months couldn't resolve anything: RCom
body: Reliance Communications (RCom) said that 100% approval of 40 banks had been "impossible to achieve" on any matter despite 45 meetings in over 12 months, driving the company to the bankruptcy court for resolution. RCom said lenders received zero proceeds from the asset monetisation plans. The company added its "overall debt resolution process is yet to make any headway".
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Govt gave nothing to Andhra even in its last budget: CM Naidu
body: Expressing discontentment over the Interim Budget, Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Friday said, "Nothing is assured to the state even in [BJP-led Centre\'s] last budget." "I...kept calling PM Narendra Modi. But he didn\'t pay heed", he added. On Friday, TDP observed \'Black Day\', demanding special category status for Andhra Pradesh and fulfilment of other promises made to the state.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Swiggy tests grocery delivery, to launch in Gurugram: Report
body: Online food delivery startup Swiggy is internally testing its grocery delivery service 'Swiggy Dash', which will launch in a few weeks, a report said. Swiggy has tied up with some stores in Gurugram and will reportedly work with partnership model similar to its food delivery. It will offer free deliveries up to four kilometres from the store, the report added.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Film on Celine Dion 'The Power of Love' to release in 2020
body: A film inspired by the 'Titanic' singer Celine Dion, titled 'The Power of Love', will be released in 2020. It will be directed by Valérie Lemercier who will also be playing Dion. The film has been authorised by Dion and she's also granted the rights to her music, including 'My Heart Will Go On', 'All By Myself' and 'I'm Alive'.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Robert Swan becomes seventh CEO in Intel's 50-year history
body: US chipmaker Intel on Thursday named Robert Swan as the seventh Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in its 50-year history. The 58-year-old has been serving as Intel's interim CEO for seven months and as Chief Financial Officer since 2016. Swan's predecessor Brian Krzanich left the company after the board was informed that he had an affair with an employee.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Denied permission for rally in WB's Murshidabad: BJP Leader
body: BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain said that the West Bengal government has denied the party permission to hold a rally in Murshidabad which was scheduled for Tuesday. However, Hussain said that he will still go to Murshidabad for the rally. This comes after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's chopper was denied permission to land in the state ahead of a rally.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Bohra gets new passport on being detained in Russia, thanks Swaraj
body: Actor and Bigg Boss contestant Karanvir Bohra took to Twitter to thank External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj for helping him get a temporary passport to gain entry into Russia, after he was detained in Moscow due to passport damage. Earlier, he tweeted the authorities were contemplating deporting him back to India. Karanvir is in Moscow to attend a film festival.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: I said 'Shakal dekhi hai': Tahira on Ayushmann wanting to be actor
body: Ayushmann Khurrana\'s wife Tahira Kashyap has revealed when her husband told her he wanted to be an actor, she ridiculed him by saying, "Ae shakal dekhi hai? (Have you seen your face?)" "I was very brutal...and wasn\'t even shocked, I laughed," she added. VJ-turned-actor Ayushmann made his Bollywood debut with \'Vicky Donor\' in 2012, nearly four years after his wedding.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: 2 Andhra boys score 100 percentile in JEE Main Paper-2 for BArch
body: Two boys from Andhra Pradesh, Gollapudi N Lakshmi Narayana and Gudla Raghunandan Reddy, have topped the JEE Main 2019 Paper-2 exam by scoring 100 percentile. The Paper-2 exam was held in January for admission to architecture-related courses of BArch and BPlanning. Following the results announced on Friday, Narayana said he wants to pursue BTech from IIT-Bombay.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Why was Hardik Pandya's double converted into single in 49th over?
body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya took a double off the 49th over's fourth delivery in the fifth ODI against New Zealand. Trent Boult suspected that Pandya didn't cross the crease and appealed to umpires. The double was converted into single after replays confirmed Pandya's hands weren't touching his bat when he threw it into the crease while taking the first run.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: BMC to cancel licence of hawkers using banned plastic bags
body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to cancel the licence of hawkers selling or using banned plastic bags, effective from Friday. In March last year, the Maharashtra government issued a notification to ban the sale, use and manufacture of plastic bags. As per the rule, violators face fine ranging from ₹5,000-25,000 and may also face three-month imprisonment.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Pope Francis becomes first Pope to visit Arabian Peninsula
body: Pope Francis reached the UAE on Sunday for the first-ever visit by a head of the Catholic Church to the Arabian Peninsula. Pope Francis and Sheikh Ahmed al-Tayeb, the Grand Imam of Egypt\'s Al-Azhar mosque, signed a \'Document on Human Fraternity for World Peace and Living Together\'. The UAE said Pope\'s visit reflects its history as a "cradle of diversity".
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Was told I'd lose everything if I took 6-month break: Nargis
body: Actress Nargis Fakhri revealed that when she said she was taking a break from films for six months, people around her told her that she would "lose everything". "I was told...people will get ahead of me. They\'ll forget about me. They put all those things in my head," the actress further said. "I said I don\'t believe that," Nargis added.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Javed Tamilus Killingam: Siddharth on Javed misspelling film name
body: Responding to a tweet by lyricist Javed Akhtar where he misspelt the name of Tamil film \'Sarvam Thala Mayam\' as "Sarvam Thalamus Maryam", actor Siddharth wrote, "\'Javed Tamilus Killingam\' achha naam hai." Apologising for the error, Javed responded, "This is how I feel when someone murders Hindi or Urdu." "I\'ve punished myself by writing...title again and again," Javed added.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Liverpool's lead cut to 3 points after draw against West Ham
body: Liverpool's lead at the top of the Premier League was cut to three points after being held to a 1-1 draw by West Ham on Tuesday. Liverpool were playing without captain Jordan Henderson and midfielder Georginio Wijnaldum. Manchester City have a chance to take the top spot in the EPL in their next EPL fixture against Everton on Thursday.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Tejashwi Yadav, DMK's Kanimozhi join WB CM Mamata's dharna
body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav and DMK's Kanimozhi on Monday extended their support to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee by sharing the stage where she has been sitting on 'Save the Democracy' dharna. Mamata is protesting against the CBI's move to raid Kolkata Police chief in connection with chit fund scams. Ready to give life but will not compromise, Mamata said.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Newly married woman killed over dowry demand in UP
body: A newly married woman was allegedly killed by her in-laws for being unable to meet their dowry demands, in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli. According to the complaint lodged by the deceased's brother, the woman was being harassed for a dowry of ₹10 lakh. A case has been registered against the husband and five in-laws, who are absconding, a police official said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Mithali Raj becomes 1st woman cricketer to play 200 ODIs
body: India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj has become the first woman cricketer to feature in 200 ODIs, achieving the feat in the third ODI against New Zealand on Friday. The 36-year-old, who made her ODI debut on June 25, 1999, has played 200 of India Women's 263 ODIs. With 6,622 runs, she is the highest run-scorer in women's ODI cricket.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Russian MP arrested in Parliament for double murder
body: Russian Senator Rauf Arashukov was arrested on Wednesday on the floor of the Parliament over his suspected role in ordering at least two contract killings. He was detained after the Senate voted to strip him of immunity from prosecution. Arashukov attempted to flee through the Parliament gallery but later surrendered to the authorities.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: BJP, Amit Shah 'most corrupt' in India: Chandrababu Naidu
body: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Monday alleged the BJP and its President Amit Shah are most corrupt in India. He added, "It\'s under their rule that [people] like Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi escaped after looting the banks of our country." He further said opposition parties are not against PM Narendra Modi but are against his "policies and behaviour".\n
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Modi govt clears one more step to get Mallya extradited: Jaitley
body: After UK Home Secretary signed an order clearing beleaguered liquor baron Vijay Mallya\'s extradition to India, Union Minister Arun Jaitley tweeted, "Modi Government clears one more step to get Mallya extradited while Opposition rallies around the Saradha Scamsters." Jaitley\'s tweet came amid opposition parties extending support to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee in ongoing protest against CBI.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Overwhelming to be compared to Ranbir, Ranveer: Rajkummar
body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has said that he finds it "overwhelming" to be compared to Ranbir Kapoor and Ranveer Singh. "I take it as a compliment...I take it with a lot of gratitude because you are comparing me with two great actors,” he added.
