Rajkummar further said he doesn\'t take competition into account and only hopes to grow as an actor.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: 200 just a number: Mithali on becoming 1st woman to play 200 ODIs
body: After becoming the first ever woman cricketer to play 200 ODIs, India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj said that 200 is just a number for her. "[But] it feels nice to come so far. When I started...my aim was to only wear...India colours, be...a core member...but never did I think I\'ll continue to play for so long," Mithali added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Poised to be $5 tn economy in 5 yrs, aspire for $10 tn in 8 yrs: FM
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said, "We are poised to become a $5 trillion economy in the next five years."  "We aspire to become a $10 trillion economy in the next eight years," Goyal added. The Finance Minister further mentioned that an 18% increase in direct tax collections was registered in 2017-18.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: 17-yr-old Nepalese becomes youngest to score fifty in T20I cricket
body: Nepal batsman Sundeep Jora has become the youngest cricketer to score a fifty in T20I cricket, achieving the feat aged 17 years and 103 days on his debut against UAE on Thursday. Jora slammed 53*(46) including three fours and a six. The previous record was held by Canada's Hiral Patel, who scored a fifty aged 18 years and 177 days.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Nothing but cricket can make people smile in Afghanistan: Rashid
body: Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan has said that cricket has changed everything in Afghanistan in the last five-six years. "(We players) just try and give 100% in each and every competition. Everywhere, we try our best to give something to the people back home...There is nothing else that can bring such a smile on their faces," Rashid added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: ED gets 4-day custody of AgustaWestland scam accused Saxena
body: Dubai-based businessman Rajiv Saxena, a key accused in the ₹3,600 crore AgustaWestland VVIP chopper scam, on Thursday has been remanded to four-day Enforcement Directorate (ED) custody. The ED had asked for an eight-day remand of Saxena. "We are aware of his (Rajiv Saxena) health and medical issues, every possible need will be taken care of,"  ED counsel DP Singh said.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: No law says MLAs need to file assets to Lokayukta: AAP
body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Monday said there is no law which mentions MLAs need to file their assets to the Lokayukta. "AAP MLAs had filed their assets and liabilities to Election Commission in 2013 elections and then in 2015 elections," the party added. AAP will again file the affidavits in 2020 elections detailing the assets, the party said.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Man jailed for life for tying concrete to wife, throwing her in lake
body: A US man who killed his estranged wife in 2016 by tying a massive chunk of concrete to her neck and throwing her off a bridge into a lake has been sentenced to life in prison. Rodolfo 'Rudy' Arellano pleaded guilty to capital murder earlier this week. The 36-year-old could have faced death penalty if convicted at trial.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Apple to pay $571 mn in back-dated taxes to France: Reports
body: Technology giant Apple has reached an agreement to pay nearly $571 million to French authorities to settle back-dated taxes, reports said. Apple confirmed the agreement but did not disclose the amount to be paid. In 2016, the European Union directed Apple to pay about $15 billion to Ireland, citing that the company received illegal tax benefits from the Irish government.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: RCom shares down nearly 50% as firm approaches bankruptcy court
body: Anil Ambani-controlled Reliance Communications (RCom) shares were down nearly 50% on Monday after the company decided to go for insolvency proceedings through NCLT following its failure to sell assets for paying back its lenders. RCom's per share price hit an intraday low of ₹6 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. RCom has a debt of around ₹46,000 crore on its books.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Goa CM Parrikar's health condition is stable: AIIMS sources
body: The health condition of Goa CM Manohar Parrikar, who is admitted in AIIMS Delhi for a routine check-up, is stable, sources at the hospital said on Saturday. He is admitted at the Institute-Rotary Cancer Hospital at AIIMS under the observation of oncologist Atul Sharma. Parrikar was diagnosed with a pancreatic ailment in February last year.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: 15 Thai election candidates change names to those of former PMs
body: Fifteen election candidates in Thailand have changed their names to those of former Prime Ministers in a bid to remain memorable to voters. While 10 men have legally changed their names to Thaksin, after former PM Thaksin Shinawatra, five women have changed their names to Yingluck, after the country's first female PM, Yingluck Shinawatra.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Brazilian mother narrates football matches to blind son from stands
body: Silvia Grecco, a 56-year-old Brazilian mother narrates her local football team Palmeiras\' matches live to her 12-year-old blind and autistic son Nickollas from the stands. "I describe details: this player is wearing short sleeves...colour of...football boots, hair colour...Everything I see and feel, I tell him, even when I need to curse the referee!" Grecco said after a recent match.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Martin Guptill set to miss T20I series against India
body: New Zealand batsman Martin Guptill is set to miss the three-game T20I series against India starting February 6. The 32-year-old sustained a back injury ahead of the final ODI against India in Wellington. The 28-year-old all-rounder Jimmy Neesham, who scored a 32-ball 44 in the final ODI against India was named as Guptill's replacement.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Don Ravi Pujari lived with new identity, ran restaurants in Africa
body: Underworld don Ravi Pujari, who was arrested in Sénégal, took a new identity as Antony Fernandez and had got Burkina Faso passport for himself, his wife and children, Karnataka Police said. Pujari also ran a chain of restaurants in partnership in several West African countries. Police said he ran away from Burkina Faso, fearing his identity might get exposed.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Jet Airways grounds 3 more planes over rental dues: Reports
body: Cash-strapped Jet Airways on Tuesday reportedly grounded three Boeing 737 planes due to non-payment of lease rentals, leading to cancellation of around 20 domestic flights. The number of aircraft grounded by the carrier due to rental payment issues now stand at six, reports added. The carrier has about 123 aircraft in its fleet, including 5 new Boeing 737 MAXs.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Mamata sits on 'dharna' to protest CBI action in Kolkata
body: Protesting CBI action in Kolkata, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Sunday went on an indefinite \'dharna\' in front of the Metro Channel Control Post, Kolkata. She said her agitation was to "save democracy, Constitution and the country". She added that on Monday proceedings in the state assembly will take place where she will hold a meeting.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Those not giving birth responsible for falling population: Japan Dy PM
body: Japan\'s Deputy Prime Minister Taro Aso has said that those who "didn\'t give birth" are to be blamed for the country\'s declining population. "There are lots of strange people who say the elderly are to blame, but that is wrong," he added. In 2017, around 9.5 lakh babies were born while the number of deaths rose to around 13 lakh.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Vani Kapoor becomes first Indian to earn Australian LPGA card
body: Indian golfer Vani Kapoor became the first Indian to earn a card for the Australian Ladies PGA Tour (LPGA) after coming through its first-ever qualifying tournament at Australia's Ballarat Golf Club. Other Indians in the Australian LPGA qualifying tournament were Diksha Dagar, Ridhima Dilawari and Astha Madan. Vani had finished tied-12th with three others at the qualification event.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Pay ₹25,000 to contest LS polls: AIADMK to ticket seekers
body: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) has told party leaders who want to contest the upcoming Lok Sabha polls to pay ₹25,000 while submitting their application forms. The fee is applicable for a total of 40 seats in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry. AIADMK had issued a similar notification for party ticket aspirants ahead of the 2014 Lok Sabha polls.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: SoftBank fund may put $1.5bn in China used car site Guazi: Report
body: SoftBank Vision Fund is reportedly in talks with Chinese used car trading platform Guazi.com to invest up to $1.5 billion at a valuation of $8.5 billion before investment. The report added the fund had also held talks with Guazi.com rival Renrenche, backed by Chinese ride-hailing platform Didi Chuxing. Guazi.com counts Tencent Holdings and Sequoia Capital China among its backers.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: PM shortens speech after stampede-like situation at WB rally
body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday had to cut short his speech at a rally in West Bengal's Thakurnagar after a stampede-like situation broke out. People outside the venue tried to barge into the rally ground and after the commotion, PM Modi ended the speech saying he has another rally to attend. Several women and children were injured, police said.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: People called me s**t performer in the beginning: 'Baby Doll' singer
body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, who has sung songs like \'Baby Doll\' and \'Chittiyaan Kalaiyaan\', said that at the beginning of her career, people said on her face that she\'s a \'sh** performer\'. "I performed live on stage, I was a bad live performer," said Kanika. "I don\'t have any ego to listen to criticism, I learn something from there," she added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Kolkata Police wanted info on our probe plan: CBI official
body: A senior CBI official on Monday claimed the Kolkata Police wanted information on the "investigation plan" of the agency officials, who were detained for a few hours at a city police station. He added the police kept pressurising the CBI team. The CBI couldn\'t complete the proceedings and had to return due to forceful obstruction by the police, he said.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: What's the story behind egg pic that broke Kylie's Instagram record?
body: Instagram account that broke Kylie Jenner\'s record of most-liked Instagram picture with an egg\'s picture is made by London\'s 29-year-old advertising professional Chris Godfrey to spread awareness about causes including mental health. A video showed the egg cracking and saying, "The pressure of social media\'s getting to me." It takes viewers to several mental health support websites across nations.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Pune court orders release of Bhima-Koregaon accused activist
body: Pune sessions court on Saturday ordered the release of activist Anand Teltumbde hours after he was arrested in connection with the Bhima-Koregaon case, and called the arrest "illegal". "As per the Supreme Court order, Teltumbde has interim protection till February 11," the court said. The court also said that Teltumbde can approach the competent authority for regular or pre-arrest bail.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: What are the income tax changes proposed in Interim Budget?
body: The government proposed full tax rebate for taxable income up to ₹5 lakh/year and enhanced standard deduction limit to ₹50,000. Further, there'll be no TDS on interest income of up to ₹40,000, while the TDS threshold on rent income will be hiked to ₹2.4 lakh. The government also proposed to exempt income tax on notional rent on second self-occupied home.\n
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Japan footballers clean dressing room after Asian Cup final
body: Following their 1-3 defeat in the final of Asian Cup 2019 against Qatar, Japan national football team players cleaned the dressing room and left a "Thank You" message in English, Arabic and Japanese. "Japan leave the Asian Cup 2019 dressing room spotless," organisers tweeted. Japanese players had done the same following their 2018 FIFA World Cup exit.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Filmmaker Aribam returns Padma Shri to protest Citizenship Bill
body: Manipur filmmaker Aribam Syam Sharma on Sunday returned the Padma Shri award to protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, 2016. On January 8, the Lok Sabha passed the bill which seeks to give citizenship to Hindus, Sikhs, Jains, Buddhists, Christians and Parsis from Afghanistan, Pakistan and Bangladesh. The veteran director received the award in 2006.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Retiring German Chancellor Angela Merkel quits Facebook
body: German Chancellor Angela Merkel, who will leave politics following the end of her term in 2021, has announced that she is closing her Facebook account as she's no longer the head of the CDU party. In a video message, Merkel thanked her 2.5 million followers and invited them to continue following the government's official Facebook page and her Instagram account.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: India issues demarche to US embassy on Indian students' detention
body: India on Saturday issued a demarche to the US embassy over the detention of Indian students in the US and sought immediate consular access to them. "We\'ve urged the US side to share full details and regular updates of the students...to release them at the earliest and not to resort to deportation against their will," the External Affairs Ministry said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Former MP DGP Rishi Kumar Shukla appointed as new CBI Director
body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led panel has appointed former Madhya Pradesh Director General of Police (DGP) Rishi Kumar Shukla as the new CBI Director for a period of two years. Shukla is a 1983-batch Madhya Pradesh Indian Police Service (IPS) officer. He replaces Alok Verma, who was removed as CBI chief by a PM Modi-led panel on January 10.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Shopping without wife a disaster: Rohit shares pic from supermarket
body: India stand-in captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to share a picture of himself shopping in a supermarket in New Zealand, writing, "Supermarket shopping without the wife is a disaster, one of the many reasons I miss her." Reacting to the post, Rohit\'s wife Ritika Sajdeh commented, "aaawww." "That\'s a lot of eggs...Rohit..you baking a cake!" The Bharat Army commented.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Shamita Shetty abused, driver slapped after accident: Report
body: Actress Shamita Shetty was verbally abused and her driver was slapped in an incident of road rage in Mumbai on Tuesday, as per reports. The incident reportedly took place after a motorist who was accompanied by two friends, rammed his vehicle into Shamita's car. The men allegedly manhandled and threatened Shamita's driver when he stepped out to inspect the damage.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: SP leader Azam Khan booked for allegedly defaming RSS
body: An FIR was lodged against Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan on Friday for allegedly misusing the government letterhead and stamp for "maligning" the RSS when he was a minister in the previous government. The FIR, filed by a social worker, also accuses Khan of insulting religious leader Kalbe Jawad and his secretary.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Not true: Rajkummar on replacing SRK in Rakesh Sharma biopic
body: Denying the reports that said Rajkummar Rao will be replacing Shah Rukh Khan in Rakesh Sharma\'s biopic titled \'Saare Jahaan Se Achcha\', Rao said, "There\'s no truth to that...haven\'t heard anything like that." Earlier, there were reports that Shah Rukh opted out of the biopic for Farhan Akhtar\'s \'Don 3\'. Reports also claimed Vicky Kaushal was considered for the role.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: RBI removes two banks from corrective action list: Reports
body: A Reserve Bank of India (RBI) panel has reportedly decided to remove Bank of India and Bank of Maharashtra from its Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework. The move follows improvements in the asset quality and capital ratios of both banks, reports added. State-run banks with high levels of bad debt and inadequate capital are brought under the PCA framework.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Rustomjee set to redefine luxury real estate in South Mumbai
body: Rustomjee has introduced a palatial gated estate in Prabhadevi with 3,4 and 5 bedroom luxury residences, spread over 5.75 acres. This gated estate is replete with 60+ lifestyle amenities, from tropical pools to idyllic spas. It features two 68 storey towers and one 65 storey tower with a floor to ceiling height of up to 11.9 ft.
author: Roshan Gupta

headline: PM Modi clarifies that govt will present Interim Budget
body: PM Narendra Modi told an all-party meeting that his government will present the Interim Budget on Friday. The clarification came after Union Minister Piyush Goyal said, "Budget is a Budget and there is nothing like an Interim Budget or a vote-on-account." Earlier, Congress said it would oppose a full-fledged Budget as the government\'s tenure is scheduled to end in May.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Amazon, Walmart lose $50 bn value after India applies new rules
body: Amazon and Walmart together lost over $50 billion in market value on Friday after India’s revised e-commerce rules came into effect. E-commerce marketplaces are now barred from selling products through sellers in which they have a stake, and from making deals to sell exclusively on their platforms. Amazon and Walmart's Flipkart were forced to remove numerous products from their websites.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: US student jailed for 10yrs for stealing $5M by SIM swapping
body: American college student Joel Ortiz, who stole over $5 million in cryptocurrency through SIM swapping, pleaded guilty and was sentenced to 10 years in prison. Ortiz is the first person to be sentenced for SIM swap fraud, authorities said. SIM swapping consists of tricking an operator into transferring a user's phone number to a SIM card controlled by the hacker.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Social media users liken US singer Julia Michaels to Anushka Sharma
body: Several social users on Twitter and Instagram are likening American singer-songwriter Julia Michaels to actress Anushka Sharma. A user commented, "@juliamichaels looks more like @AnushkaSharma than Anushka herself!" "Never knew you had a twin sister in India," another user wrote. Meanwhile, another comment read, "Julia Michaels must be wondering what just happened. Why she\'s getting so much attention."
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Income Tax refunds to be processed in 24 hrs, released immediately
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal, while delivering the Interim Budget speech, said that Income Tax refunds will be processed in 24 hours and released immediately. Goyal also said that within the next 2 years, returns chosen for scrutiny will also be processed digitally with anonymity. "India has now moved to a moderate tax regime with high tax collection," he added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Actress Patralekhaa to make her Kannada film debut
body: Actress Patralekhaa will make her debut in the Kannada film industry with the action-comedy film \'Where is my Kannadaka?\' "I can definitely say that it’s a kind of role that I haven’t portrayed on screen so far and that makes it special for me," the actress said in a statement. Shooting for the film will reportedly begin in April.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: PNB Q3 profit up 7% at ₹247cr, first profit in four quarters
body: State-run Punjab National Bank (PNB) on Tuesday reported a 7% year-on-year rise in its third-quarter profit at ₹247 crore, the lender's first profit in four quarters. The bank said it made a provision of ₹2,014.04 crore during the quarter against the ₹14,357-crore Nirav Modi fraud, thereby fully providing for it. The lender's net interest income rose 7.5% to ₹4,290 crore.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: So much to love about Hardik Pandya the cricketer, tweets user
body: Reacting to Hardik Pandya\'s hat-trick of sixes and his 22-ball 45 in the fifth ODI against New Zealand, a user tweeted, "So much to love about Hardik Pandya the cricketer." "Excellent burst from Pandya. He hits boundaries from shapes and positions that others may not be able to. Brilliant timer," tweeted commentator Harsha Bhogle.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Fadnavis meets Anna Hazare, asks him to call off fast
body: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday met social activist Anna Hazare and requested him to call off his fast. Hazare, who began his indefinite fast on January 30 over the appointment of Lokpal and Lokayukta (anti-corruption watchdogs), has lost around 4.30 kg weight in the last seven days, doctors said. Fadnavis met Hazare in his native village in Ahmednagar.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Google parent Alphabet stocks fall despite 22% revenue rise
body: Google's parent company Alphabet's shares on Tuesday plunged over 3% in after-hours trading despite delivering fourth-quarter revenue of $39.27 billion, a 22% rise from the year-ago period. This comes as the company's capital expenditures rose 80% to $6.85 billion during the quarter. The rise was largely due to building and running data centres and offices, Alphabet CFO Ruth Porat said.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Sensex ends 213 points higher after Interim Budget 2019-20
body: Indian equity benchmark Sensex on Friday ended 213 points higher at 36,469 following the Interim Budget session for 2019-20. Auto stocks Maruti Suzuki and Hero MotoCorp were the biggest gainers in the Sensex, ending up to 7% higher. The broader Nifty 50 index ended 63 points higher at 10,893.65.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Priyanka to play Osho disciple Ma Anand Sheela in H'wood film
body: Priyanka Chopra will be portraying Osho disciple Ma Anand Sheela in upcoming Hollywood film. Talking about the project on \'The Ellen DeGeneres Show\', Priyanka said, "We are developing it [from the viewpoint of] Sheela who was with this guru who originated from India. She was [Osho\'s] right-hand woman." The film will be directed by \'Rain Man\' director Barry Levinson.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: IIT Hyderabad student falls 7 floors while talking on phone, dies
body: A 22-year-old final year engineering student of IIT Hyderabad died when he accidentally fell from the terrace of his seven-storied hostel building while talking on his phone on Friday. "His father M Rajan, a businessman, is in a state of depression because Anirudhya was his only son. The boy\'s elder sister got married to a doctor only recently," police said.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: It’s our moral victory: Mamata on SC order on police chief
body: After the Supreme Court on Tuesday said that CBI cannot arrest Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar in connection to the chit fund scams, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "It’s our moral victory." “Nobody is the big boss of this country, democracy is the big boss of this country,” she further said. This comes amid Mamata\'s dharna against CBI action.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: UK man who had sex with corpse in funeral home jailed for 6 years
body: A UK man who broke into a funeral home and had sex with a corpse has been sentenced to six years in jail. A court heard how he lifted the lids of several coffins inside the funeral home in Great Barr, Birmingham, before selecting his victim. "The offences you have committed offend all human sensibility," the court said.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: CM Manohar Parrikar skips morning session of Goa Assembly
body: Goa CM Manohar Parrikar on Thursday skipped the morning proceedings of the ongoing budget session of the state Assembly. While presenting the state budget in the House on Wednesday, Parrikar said, "I\'m presenting the budget in josh. The josh that is too high, very high, and fully in hosh". The three-day-long budget session of the state Assembly will end today.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Pakistan skipper Sarfaraz Ahmed denies talks of rift with Malik
body: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed denied talks of a rift with Pakistan\'s stand-in captain Shoaib Malik. "There is no truth to the claim people who play under Shoaib bhai don\'t want to play under me. All the boys are very good and support each other. I don\'t think there\'s anything about that," the 31-year-old said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Over 12 lakh new voters added to UP electoral roll
body: According to Uttar Pradesh Chief Electoral Officer L Venkateshwarlu, over 12 lakh new voters have been added to the electoral roll in the state. "The total number of voters in the state is 14.40 crore," he added. "As many as 16.75 lakh voters fall in the age group of 18-19," he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Elon Musk's Tesla to begin Model Y production by end of 2020
body: Elon Musk-led Tesla has said it\'ll "start tooling" to begin production of its Model Y car by 2020 end. Model Y production cost is expected to be lower than Model 3 as it will share 75% of its components with the Model 3, Tesla said. Model Y will likely be produced in Tesla\'s Gigafactory 1 in Nevada, US, it added.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Girl gets fake call to link Aadhaar to bank account, loses ₹16,000
body: Kanika, a 21-year-old Delhi University student, was robbed of ₹16,000 after she shared her bank details following a phone call to link her Aadhaar Card to her bank account. Kanika, a resident of Laxman Vihar, was conned in July 2017, but the FIR was filed on Friday night. The police are yet to make any arrest or identify the suspect.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: 9 EU nations recognise Guaidó as Venezuela's interim President
body: Nine European Union nations including the UK, France and Germany have recognised Juan Guaidó as Venezuela's interim President after the country's President Nicolás Maduro failed to meet an ultimatum calling for elections within eight days. Spain, Sweden, Denmark, Austria, the Netherlands and Latvia are among the nine EU nations. Earlier, the US recognised Guaidó as Venezuela's interim leader.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Sarfaraz Ahmed to captain Pakistan in 2019 World Cup, PCB confirms
body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has confirmed Sarfaraz Ahmed will remain Pakistan's captain till World Cup 2019, which will be staged in England and Wales from May 30 to July 14. Sarfaraz, who returned to Pakistan from South Africa after being banned by ICC for four matches over racist remarks, said he's delighted the PCB has reassured its confidence in him.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: WhatsApp bug affecting 'reply context', beta users complain
body: Some WhatsApp Android beta version users have complained of a bug that affects 'reply context' in messages. The bug, spotted by WABetaInfo, is reportedly triggered when users use 'swipe to reply' feature or long press to reply in chat. When users return to chat, the 'reply context' of last sent message is automatically selected in the text box, WABetaInfo said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Agent who fled with diamonds worth ₹26 crore held in Mumbai
body: A diamond trading agent who allegedly fled with diamonds worth over ₹26 crore has been arrested in Mumbai, police officials said. While fleeing from the police, the agent travelled over 10 places across the country and even posed as a saint at Kumbh Mela, police added. As many as 25 traders had lodged complaints about the theft in December.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Cong wants to earmark ₹3 lakh cr for income scheme: Chidambaram
body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram has said the party wants to earmark ₹3 lakh crore for the minimum income guarantee scheme. He added that it was an "eminently doable" idea. This comes after Congress President Rahul Gandhi had announced earlier this week that his party would implement the scheme if it was voted to power in the Lok Sabha elections.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Govt cuts ₹3 crore from FY20 allocation for Startup India
body: The government has reduced allocation for Startup India in Interim Budget 2019-20 to ₹25 crore from ₹28 crore in FY19. The government-backed initiative, which was launched in January 2016, aims to boost innovation among Indian startups and eventually generate employment. The allocation for Make in India initiative was, however, increased to ₹473.3 crore for 2019-20 from ₹149 crore in FY19.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Rahul Gandhi is a compulsive liar, says Goa CM's OSD
body: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi claimed Goa CM Manohar Parrikar had told him he had nothing to do with the new Rafale deal, OSD (Officer on Special Duty) to Parrikar, Prasanna Karthik called Rahul "a compulsive liar." Karthik accused Rahul of "shamelessly" lying about Parrikar after claiming he wanted to meet the CM to wish the latter a speedy recovery.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Jet Airways denies being told to ground aircraft
body: Jet Airways on Wednesday denied it was directed by GE Capital Aviation Services to ground its aircraft due to non-payment of dues. The airline said it's in the process of delivering three aircraft to lessors due to the expiry of lease terms. Further, three aircraft have been temporarily grounded to carry out an engine normalisation exercise, it added.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Chicago sets train tracks on fire to keep trains moving in -30°C
body: America's Chicago is setting its rail tracks on fire with gas-fed heaters running alongside the tracks to keep them warm and keep trains moving amid temperatures as low as -30°C. The extreme cold shrinks the metal and the rails may pull apart from each other. The fire expands the metal until two rails can be put back together again.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Anna loses over 5 kg of weight as hunger strike enters day 7
body: Social activist Anna Hazare, whose hunger strike entered its seventh day on Tuesday, has lost over 5 kg of weight, said a doctor attending to him. The doctor added, "He is in a critical condition...We have advised him to call off the strike as soon as possible." Anna is fasting to press for the appointment of Lokpal and Lokayukta.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Sri Lanka halts imports of J&J baby powder pending tests
body: Sri Lankan officials said the country has halted imports of Johnson & Johnson's baby powder until the company proves the product is free from cancer-causing asbestos. Stocks of the talc already in the country can still be sold. This comes after reports suggested J&J knew that asbestos was present in its product, leading to tests in several countries including India.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Not 51, only 2 women entered Sabarimala temple: Kerala govt
body: Kerala Devaswom Minister Kadakampally Surendran has informed the state assembly that the government has confirmation about only two women in the 10-50 age group offering prayers at the Sabarimala temple. Earlier, it was reported that around 51 women had managed to enter the temple for prayers. The minister was responding to question raised by Congress MLAs in the state assembly.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Over 5.4 lakh villages declared Open Defecation Free
body: Delivering the Interim Budget on Friday, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said over 5.4 lakh villages have been declared Open Defecation Free and more than 98% rural sanitation coverage has been achieved as part of Swachh Bharat Abhiyan. Goyal also called Swachh Bharat Abhiyan the "world\'s largest behavioural change movement" and said it was initiated as a tribute to Mahatma Gandhi.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: US stops all aid to Palestinians in West Bank and Gaza
body: The US Agency for International Development has stopped all financial assistance to Palestinians in the occupied West Bank and Gaza. It will end about $60 million in US aid for the Palestinian security forces. The aid cut requested by the Palestinian Authority, is linked to a new American legislation under which foreign aid recipients could be sued under anti-terrorism lawsuits.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Not too worried about his form: Dravid on KL Rahul's golden duck
body: After India A batsman KL Rahul got out for a golden duck in the fifth one-day against England Lions on Thursday, coach Rahul Dravid said he isn\'t too worried about Rahul\'s form. "I have no doubt that he has got quality and ability. He\'s a proven performer," Dravid added. Rahul scored 55 runs in 3 one-day matches against England Lions.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Wreckage from missing plane carrying Argentine footballer found
body: The wreckage from the plane carrying 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala has been discovered, two weeks after it disappeared from radar over English Channel. A search boat hired privately by Sala's family located the wreckage after an official search operation was called off on January 24. Sala and 59-year-old pilot, Dave Ibbotson, were travelling to Wales' Cardiff from France's Nantes.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Kareena Kapoor to appear in a song in 'Dabangg 3': Reports
body: Kareena Kapoor Khan, who had appeared in the song 'Fevicol Se' from Salman Khan's 'Dabangg 2', will reportedly be appearing in a song in 'Dabangg 3'. Arbaaz Khan, who will be producing the film, recently revealed that Salman will start shooting in April. Actress Sonakshi Sinha had earlier confirmed that she will be starring in the film opposite Salman.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Intent of extorting money: Salman Yusuff Khan on molestation claims
body: Bollywood choreographer and Dance India Dance season 1 winner Salman Yusuff Khan has denied the molestation allegations against him. "Wrong allegations with vested interests...intent of extorting monies [money]...have complete faith in judiciary...truth with prevail INSHA ALLAH," he wrote. The woman alleged Salman "touched her inappropriately" and said "such things happen in Bollywood" when she objected.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: I'm in full hosh: CM Parrikar presents Goa budget with tube in nose
body: Goa CM Manohar Parrikar, who is also the state Finance Minister, presented the annual budget in the state Assembly on Wednesday with a tube in his nose. Suffering from a pancreatic ailment for months, Parrikar said he was in full 'hosh' (consciousness) after Goa Congress chief Girish Chodankar said the CM should come back to 'hosh' before speaking about 'josh'.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Wrong of Krish to attack me: Kangana on 'Manikarnika' row
body: Addressing the controversy surrounding the direction credits for her film \'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi\', Kangana Ranaut said it was wrong for the film\'s co-director Krish to "attack" her. "If he has any issues with the film, then he should talk to the producers," the actress added. Kangana was credited as co-director of the film after Krish left the project.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Batsman collides into partner, breaks his helmet and gets run-out
body: BBL side Sydney Thunder's Jonathan Cook got run-out after colliding into his partner Gurinder Sandhu while running between the wickets against Melbourne Renegades. The collision happened after pacer Harry Gurney moved towards the ball and ended up unsighting the batsmen, who were converging on the same side. A part of Cook's helmet broke and he was left stranded.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: We're trivialising #MeToo movement, need to be careful: Sonam
body: Sonam Kapoor, while talking about #MeToo movement, said, "We are definitely trivialising it...We need to be a little more careful about the accusation and articles." "If you have to, you have to do it with a lot of thought...because it\'s become watered down now. It\'s all gone and unfortunately, it is the way it is," the actress added.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Man murders wife, 3-yr-old daughter with lover's help; held
body: A Mumbai-based man and his girlfriend have been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and three-year-old daughter. The man slit the throats of his wife and daughter, while his lover burned the bodies with cooking oil, police said. To give the murder an impression of suicide, the lover texted the man, "We\'re going forever," from the wife\'s phone, police added.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Odisha CM Patnaik controls mining mafia: Union Minister
body: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Wednesday claimed the illegal mining mafia in Odisha operates under the control of CM Naveen Patnaik and state Congress chief Niranjan Patnaik. He added, "The time has come for the people of Odisha to put a full stop to their activities...The time has come for us to ask for an explanation from this corrupt government."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Anand Mahindra shares menu with dish 'delicious roasted husband'
body: Mahindra Group\'s Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share the picture of a menu featuring a dish named \'Delicious roasted husband\'. He captioned it, "I\'m certainly going to think twice about visiting this restaurant with my wife. Don\'t want her getting any creative ideas....!" Reacting to his tweet, a user commented, "Doesn\'t the wife roast the husband daily?"
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Queen Elizabeth to be evacuated in case of Brexit unrest: Reports
body: British officials have reportedly revived Cold War emergency plans to relocate Queen Elizabeth II should there be riots in London if Britain suffers a disruptive departure from the European Union next month. Notably, Prime Minister Theresa May's government is struggling to get parliamentary support for a Brexit transition agreement with the EU before the departure date of March 29.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Catholic Church in Texas names 300 priests accused of sex abuse
body: The Roman Catholic Church in Texas, US, has released the names of around 300 priests who have been accused of sexually abusing children. "The Bishops of Texas have decided to release the names because it\'s right and just and to offer healing and hope to those who have suffered", President of US Conference of Catholic Bishops, Cardinal Daniel DiNardo said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Deepika Padukone replaces Kiran Rao as chairperson of MAMI
body: Deepika Padukone has taken over as chairperson of Mumbai Academy of Moving Image (MAMI), replacing filmmaker Kiran Rao, who served as chairperson for four years. "I believe in MAMI’s vision and we are committed towards creating a community that cinema lovers and creators...truly deserve,” Deepika said. Kiran Rao reportedly stepped down as chairperson to focus on a film project.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Option of going with SP-BSP open: Om Prakash Rajbhar
body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Monday said the option of going with the SP-BSP alliance in the general elections was open to the party. Speaking on Kolkata issue, he questioned the CBI action saying how the agency could go there without any order. He said the Supreme Court has already called the CBI a "caged parrot".
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Denied ₹37,000 phone for PUBG, 18-yr-old allegedly kills self
body: An 18-year-old Mumbai-based boy allegedly committed suicide after having an argument with his family over buying a phone for playing online multi-player game PUBG. The boy had demanded a smartphone worth ₹37,000 to play the game but was permitted to buy mobile of not above ₹20,000, police said. Following this, the boy hanged himself from a ceiling fan, police added.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Don’t see light at the end of tunnel for SL: Marvan Atapattu
body: Following Sri Lanka\'s Test series loss to Australia, Marvan Atapattu said, "I would say there have been bad times. But we always could see a light at the end of the tunnel... [W]hat I see now, there\'s nothing like that." "[I]t\'s something to do with people outside waiting to come into the [Sri Lankan] board," Atapattu added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Govt committed to completing NRC on time: Rajnath Singh
body: After the Supreme Court hit out at the government for "not cooperating" in NRC process, Home Minister Rajnath Singh said the government is committed to complete the process within the stipulated time. SC on Tuesday turned down Centre\'s plea seeking suspension of NRC exercise during General elections as central armed police forces in Assam had to be withdrawn for polls.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Bad dream: Missing footballer's father after plane wreckage found
body: After wreckage from the plane carrying 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala was found around two weeks after the plane disappeared over the English Channel, Emiliano\'s father Horacio said that he can\'t believe it. "This is a dream. A bad dream. I am desperate," he added. Both Sala and 59-year-old pilot David Ibbotson are missing presumed dead.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: 3-yr-old's black jacket removed for Assam CM's event, probe ordered
body: A video of a mother removing black jacket of her three-year-old child on orders of security personnel before entering an event addressed by CM Sarbananda Sonowal in Assam has surfaced online. A policeman said they had been asked to not allow anyone to carry black items inside the venue. A probe has been ordered into the incident by CM Sonowal.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Sonu's contract terminated, shouldn't speak on Manikarnika: Kangana
body: Talking about her film \'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi\' and Sonu Sood who was earlier part of the film, Kangana Ranaut said, "He shouldn\'t be speaking about the film as his contract was terminated." Kangana added that Sonu doesn\'t hold "any sort of participation" in the film, so he shouldn\'t "malign" the film. "These people have deep-rooted agendas," she said.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Trump ordered to kill me: Venezuela President Maduro
body: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has claimed that his American counterpart Donald Trump ordered the Colombian government and the Colombian mafia to kill him. "If something happens to me, Trump and Colombian President Iván Márquez will bear responsibility," he added. The US has blamed Maduro for the economic crisis in Venezuela and recognised opposition leader Juan Guaidó as interim President.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Pic shows '5,000 troops to Colombia' in notes of US official
body: US\' National Security Advisor John Bolton was photographed with a notepad that had "5,000 troops to Colombia" written on it, as he talked to reporters about neighbouring Venezuela. "As the President has said, all options are on the table," a White House spokesperson said when asked if the US would consider taking military option amid the political crisis in Venezuela.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Walking into wedding reception 100047: Nick on pic with Priyanka
body: Singer Nick Jonas took to social media to share a picture with his wife, actress Priyanka Chopra, and captioned it, "Walking into wedding reception 100047 like... Haha just kidding." The picture is from the Learning Lab Ventures Winter Gala that the couple attended. Nick and Priyanka, who got married in December 2018, had hosted four wedding receptions.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Dhoni third in list of players with most ODI matches for India
body: MS Dhoni reached the third spot in the list of cricketers with the most number of ODI appearances for India. The list is being led by Sachin Tendulkar with 463 ODIs and Rahul Dravid with 340 ODIs is occupying the second spot. Dhoni's appearance in the fifth ODI against New Zealand was his 335th for India in ODI cricket.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: I hope I make 'Munna Bhai 3' this year: Vidhu Vinod Chopra
body: Vidhu Vinod Chopra, while talking about the third instalment of \'Munna Bhai\' has said, "I haven\'t yet made my next \'Munna Bhai\' because I didn\'t get a proper script...hope I make it this year." The 2003 film \'Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.\' and the 2006 film \'Lage Raho Munna Bhai\' was directed by Rajkumar Hirani who was recently accused of sexual allegations.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: 22nd AIIMS will be set up in Haryana: Piyush Goyal
body: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said that the 22nd All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) will be set up in Haryana. Currently, 21 AIIMS are operating or being established, 14 of which have been announced since 2014, he added. Talking about Ayushman Bharat, he further said that it has benefitted 10 lakh patients.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Bank of Baroda Q3 profit surges fourfold to ₹471 crore
body: Bank of Baroda on Tuesday posted 321% year-on-year rise in profit at ₹471 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2018. The net interest income rose 16.6% to ₹4,744 crore compared to ₹4,068 crore in the same period a year ago. The lender's asset quality eased with gross bad loans declining to 11.01% as against 11.3% in the year-ago period.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: 71 Bengaluru policemen transferred after women's assault in station
body: Bengaluru City Police transferred 71 personnel from the Kumaraswamy Layout Police Station after a video of an Assistant Sub-Inspector of Police (ASI) assaulting women in the station went viral. The ASI and a constable who recorded the video have also been suspended till further orders. "We want a new environment...new culture at the...station," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (South).
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Vatican priest handling sex abuse cases quits over alleged sex abuse
body: A senior priest at the Vatican who handled cases of sexual abuse has quit after being accused of sexual abuse by a former nun. The accused priest claimed he is innocent and said he would consider taking legal action. The Vatican said in a statement that a Church investigation of the case was underway.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Congress, BJP, BJD looting country: Delhi CM Kejriwal
body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said the Congress, BJP and BJD were looting the country. He added that even after 70 years of independence, crores of people were still poor in the country and most of them were from Odisha. He said despite the large pool of talent, India had not developed due to the loot by political parties.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: People laughed at us when we made Yo-Yo test compulsory: Shastri
body: India head coach Ravi Shastri, in a recent interview, said people laughed when Yo-Yo test was made compulsory for India selection. "What they missed was that was a very important part," he added. Citing Mohammad Shami\'s example, Shastri said he was dropped for failing Yo-Yo test for England ODIs and no one performed better than him after he cleared it.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Mamata's posters put over PM Modi's banners in WB before his rally
body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi\'s rally in West Bengal, CM Mamata Banerjee\'s posters were put over PM Modi\'s banners informing people of his visit. Criticising the incident, BJP National Secretary Rahul Sinha on Saturday said, "This shows there is no democracy in the state." Meanwhile, BJP activists alleged that TMC workers were behind the act.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Man hurls slippers at judge after he convicts him for theft
body: After being convicted in a theft case, a 22-year-old man hurled a pair of slippers at a magistrate in a court in Maharashtra's Thane in a fit of rage, a police official said Wednesday. The magistrate ducked in time and escaped getting hit by the slippers, he added. The accused was later booked for the incident as well.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Feels like I'm back home: Sonakshi on working in 'Dabangg 3'
body: Speaking about teaming up with Salman Khan to work in the third instalment of the \'Dabangg\' film franchise, Sonakshi Sinha said, "It feels like I\'m back home because that\'s where I started my career." "My life changed completely after that film, it\'s how I found my calling," she added. Sonakshi made her acting debut opposite Salman in \'Dabangg\' in 2010.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Will return Padma Bhushan if promises not fulfilled: Hazare
body: Social activist Anna Hazare on Sunday said, "If this government doesn\'t fulfil its promises...in the next few days, I will return my Padma Bhushan." "If the country...is in this condition, then why should I keep that?" he added. Hazare is currently on a hunger strike against the delay in appointment of Lokpal and Lokayukta, and for resolution of farmers\' issue.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: 1 more institution died: Chidambaram on stats body resignations
body: After the only two non-government members of National Statistical Commission resigned citing lack of involvement in key decisions, Congress leader P Chidambaram tweeted, "One more venerable institution died...owing to malicious negligence by the government." He added, "We...remember with gratitude its valiant fight to release untainted GDP data...May the NSC rest in peace until it is re-born again!"
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Punjab brother, sister get married, forge documents to get Aus visa
body: Punjab Police is looking for a brother-sister duo, who allegedly forged documents and got married to each other in order to get an Australian visa. "The brother was already a permanent resident of Australia and documents were forged to give his sister the identity of their cousin," police said. The siblings\' cousin, whose name they used, had approached the police.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Really like Karan Johar, he's in your face whatever he is: Kangana
body: Kangana Ranaut, who had called Karan Johar the "flagbearer of nepotism" and a "movie mafia" on a \'Koffee With Karan\' episode in 2017, has said, "I really like [Karan], he is in your face whatever he is." In response to Kangana\'s "flagbearer of nepotism" statement, Karan had said that she should leave the film industry if it is so bad.\n
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Accenture's former CEO passes away weeks after stepping down
body: Global consulting firm Accenture on Thursday said its former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Pierre Nanterme has passed away, weeks after stepping down from the company due to health reasons. He had been diagnosed with colon cancer in 2016. Nanterme, who took the helm in January 2011, had been with Accenture for 36 years.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Rahul is hybrid specimen, has no clue about religion: Hegde
body: Union Minister Anantkumar Hegde took a dig at Congress President Rahul Gandhi by calling him a "hybrid specimen" who has no clue about religion. "A father who\'s...Muslim, a mother who\'s...Christian and the son is supposed to be...Brahmin. How is that even possible?" he said. He added such "hybrid specimen" cannot be found in any laboratory in the world.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: New phase in Ekta's life: Tusshar on nephew Ravie's birth
body: Opening up about the birth of his sister Ekta Kapoor\'s son Ravie, actor Tusshar Kapoor said, "This marks the beginning of a new phase in [Ekta\'s] life." "Ekta is a very family-oriented person and has been like a mother to my son Laksshya," the actor added. Ekta\'s son was born via surrogacy on January 27.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Delhi policeman arrested for being drunk on duty in Bihar
body: Delhi Police head constable Mukesh Kumar was arrested for allegedly being drunk during a raid in Bihar on Monday. Kumar was part of a team that went to Bihar to arrest a 19-year-old man who eloped with a 17-year-old girl. He reportedly created a ruckus at the house where the teenagers were found, following which the Excise Department was informed.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Ready to give my life but won't compromise: Mamata Banerjee
body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, who is on a dharna following the confrontation between CBI officials and Kolkata Police, has said she is ready to give her life but won\'t compromise. "I didn\'t take to streets when you touched TMC leaders," she added. "But I\'m angry when they tried to insult the chair of Kolkata Police Commissioner," she further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Video shows Brazil dam collapse that killed 115 people
body: A video shows the exact moment a dam collapsed in Brazil on January 25. The dam collapsed at an iron ore mining complex operated by a mining firm, killing at least 115 people, with 248 others listed as missing. In the video, vehicles can be seen driving around desperately trying to escape as a gush of mud approaches.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: No one should test the patience of Hindus: Giriraj Singh
body: Claiming people who talk about intolerance in India are actually part of an "intolerance gang", Union Minister Giriraj Singh said, "No one should test the patience of Hindus." He also asked people who are opposed to the construction of Ram Mandir and claim there is intolerance in India to go to Pakistan and "see what kind of democracy they have."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Pakistan captain once called bird instead of head or tail in toss
body: The coin toss in the Pakistan-Zimbabwe Test at Harare on January 31, 1995, was done twice as Pakistan captain Saleem Malik called 'bird' instead of heads or tails. The coin had an eagle, the national bird of Zimbabwe, inscribed on one side. Malik won as the 'bird' turned up but referee ordered a re-toss which came out in Zimbabwe's favour.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Salman and Sooraj Barjatya to collaborate for a family drama
body: Salman Khan and Sooraj Barjatya will collaborate for a family drama. Confirming the news, Sooraj said, "It will have all the necessary ingredients that a Rajshri production has - emotions, drama and a lot of music." Sooraj and Salman earlier collaborated for films like \'Maine Pyar Kiya\', \'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!\', \'Hum Saath-Saath Hain\' and \'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo\'.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: AgustaWestland scam accused Rajiv Saxena extradited to India
body: AgustaWestland chopper scam co-accused Rajiv Saxena was extradited to India from UAE on Wednesday. He had been evading the Enforcement Directorate\'s summons claiming he was suffering from leukaemia but had moved an anti-money laundering court for anticipatory bail in December, stating he had never been summoned at his Dubai address. Saxena\'s lawyers alleged he had been "illegally extradited".
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: 1-month-old leopard cub seized from passenger at Chennai airport
body: Customs officials at Chennai airport have seized a one-month-old leopard cub from the baggage of a passenger who arrived from Thailand. The officials heard some faint sounds from the checked-in baggage of the passenger, identified as 45-year-old Kaja Moideen. The cub will be rehabilitated at Chennai's Arignar Anna Zoological Park, while the passenger was handed over to the forest department.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Modi govt devoted to dreams of poor, farmers, youth: Shah on budget
body: After the Interim Budget was presented in the Parliament, BJP President Amit Shah said, "Today\'s budget has re-certified that the Modi government is a government devoted to the dreams and aspirations of the poor, farmers and youth of the country." "For this all-inclusive budget, I congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi ji and his entire government," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Budget mentions 'village', 'middle class' more than previous years
body: The Interim Budget 2019 speech by Finance Minister Piyush Goyal mentioned the words 'village' and 'middle class' 10 times and 13 times respectively, more than the previous three years. Goyal mentioned the word 'job' or 'employment' only 17 times, against 29 in the previous year. The words 'development,' 'manufacturing,' 'growth' and 'infrastructure' found fewer mentions than previous three years.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Bee attack stops India A's match for 15 minutes, 5 fans injured
body: A bee attack forced officials to stop play for around 15 minutes during fourth India A-England Lions one-day at Greenfield International Stadium in Thiruvananthapuram on Tuesday. A group of fans provoked the bees by throwing stones at a beehive in the stands during England Lions' 28th over. Around five spectators were injured and taken to a hospital for medical care.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: I am where I am today because of my modelling career: Diana
body: Diana Penty, who began her modelling career in 2005, has said that she will always be grateful for it, adding, "I\'m where I\'m today because of my modelling career." "It was through the various magazine covers and TV commercials I was doing at the time that I was spotted and offered my first film \'Cocktail\'," she further said.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Wadhawan sells Aadhar Housing Finance to US' Blackstone
body: Wadhawan Global Capital has agreed to sell its 70% stake in affordable housing finance company Aadhar Housing Finance to American private equity giant Blackstone. Dewan Housing Finance, Wadhawan's flagship entity, will also offload its 9.15% stake in Aadhar Housing as part of the transaction. Dewan lost half its value this week after allegations that it diverted funds to shell companies.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Now I know why Didi resorts to violence: PM Modi thanks large crowd
body: Referring to a large number of people present at his rally in Thakurnagar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "I now understand why Didi (West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee) has resorted to violence. She\'s scared because of your love for us." Thanking the crowd "for turning out in large numbers," he added, "I am confident West Bengal wants to see change."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Three, including 2-year-old, die as roof collapses in Thane
body: As many as three people, including a two-year-old girl, were killed after roof of a five-storey building collapsed in Thane\'s Ulhasnagar on Sunday. "The second floor collapsed onto the first floor which in turn...crashed onto the ground floor where a clinic was situated," an official said. Three others were injured in the incident and are undergoing treatment, another official said.\n\n
author: Shweta Singh

headline: 4 dead, 1 injured in explosion at firecracker factory in UP
body: As many as four people were killed and one was injured after an explosion at a firecracker factory in Uttar Pradesh's Banda district on Thursday. The two-storey factory, which was being run at the residence of its owner, collapsed after the explosion, a police official said. An investigation is underway to ascertain if the factory had a licence, police added.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Those on bail will go to jail: PM Modi takes jibe at Rahul
body: In a jibe at Congress President Rahul Gandhi, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said those on "bail will have to go to jail." PM Modi added, "He is out on bail and his associates too are facing charges...I know they will be convicted one day." The PM claimed he\'d waged a war on corruption because he\'s from a common household.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Congress leader Harihar Karan passes away at 72
body: Senior Congress leader and former minister Harihar Karan passed away at the age of 72 on Monday. Karan was being treated for septicaemia for the last three weeks, his son said. A six-time MLA from Daspalla constituency, Karan was also the chairperson of the disciplinary committee of the Odisha Pradesh Congress Committee (OPCC) in 2013.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: We haven't met since, it isn't bitter: Sidharth on breakup with Alia
body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra on \'Koffee With Karan\' revealed he hasn\'t met actress Alia Bhatt after their breakup and that their relationship is civil and not bitter. "I have known her for much longer even before we dated," said Sidharth. "There is a reason why two people decide not to be together. There were lots of ups and downs," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Robert Vadra gets anticipatory bail in money laundering case
body: Delhi's Patiala House Court has granted anticipatory bail to Robert Vadra, the brother-in-law of Congress President Rahul Gandhi, in a money laundering case lodged by the Enforcement Directorate. Vadra's lawyer said the businessman would join the investigation on Wednesday. The ED is probing allegations of money laundering in the purchase of a London property worth £1.9 million (nearly ₹18 crore).
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: GST collections cross ₹1 lakh crore in January
body: The Finance Ministry on Thursday said the Goods and Services Tax (GST) collection crossed ₹1 lakh crore in January. This has been a significant improvement over collection of ₹94,725 crore in the previous month and ₹ 89,825 crore collected in January 2018, it added. This is the third time the collections have crossed ₹1 lakh crore in this fiscal.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Irish regulator warns FB of app integration's privacy risks
body: An Irish regulator has asked Facebook Ireland for an "urgent briefing" over privacy risks concerning the proposed integration of WhatsApp, Instagram and Facebook. The regulator seeked assurances adding that previous proposals to share data between Facebook companies had led to data protection concerns. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg recently said the integration would be "good for user experience".
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: NASA's Hubble 'accidentally' finds 13-bn-yr-old dwarf galaxy
body: Astronomers using NASA\'s Hubble Space Telescope "accidentally" found a 13-billion-year-old dwarf galaxy, while trying to photograph globular star cluster NGC 6752. The galaxy, located 30 million light-years away from Earth, is one-thirtieth the diameter of the Milky Way galaxy and is roughly a thousand times dimmer than it. The dwarf spheroidal galaxy has been named Bedin 1.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Pace of rural roads' construction increased by 3 times: Govt
body: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said the pace of construction of rural roads tripled under the Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana. He added that 2.5 crore rural households will be electrified by March. Meanwhile, he also said India is the world's fastest highway developer with 27 kilometres of highways being built each day.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: UK zoo offers people to name cockroach after their ex on Valentine's
body: A London zoo is offering people to name a cockroach after their exes on Valentine\'s Day for £1.50 (nearly ₹140). "For those that don\'t quite require revenge, there\'s another way to make you feel better about getting back at your ex," the zoo said in a statement. The names will appear on zoo\'s \'roach board\' on February 14.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Don't play around with the law, SC warns Karti Chidambaram
body: The Supreme Court today allowed former Finance Minister P Chidambaram\'s son Karti Chidambaram to travel abroad but warned him, "You can go wherever you want...but don\'t play around with the law." The court also directed Karti, an accused in the Aircel-Maxis case, to deposit ₹10 crore as surety and warned him of action in case of "an iota of non-cooperation."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Entire idea of cash transfer to farmers stupid: Abhijit Sen
body: Former member of the erstwhile Planning Commission Abhijit Sen has said the "entire idea" of cash transfer of ₹6,000 per year to farmers is "stupid". He added the scheme announced in Interim Budget for small and marginal farmers is "regressive" and inefficient. It neither includes the poorest landless farmers nor does it seek to improve farm productivity, he further said.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Thank you for copying Congress: Chidambaram on Budget
body: Reacting to the Interim Budget 2019-20, Congress leader P Chidambaram tweeted, "Thank you Interim FM for copying the Congress’ declaration that the poor have the first right to the resources." "It was not a Vote on Account. It was an Account for Votes," he added. Interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal presented the BJP-led government\'s budget on Friday.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Confiscated benami assets worth ₹6,900 crore: I-T Dept
body: The Income Tax Department on Tuesday said it has confiscated assets worth ₹6,900 crore so far under the anti-benami transactions law. Those who "abet and induce" benami transactions, benamidar and beneficiaries may face rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years besides being liable to pay fine, it added. The tax department started initiating action under the new law from November 2016.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Karan Johar, Tabu turn showstoppers on opening night of LFW
body: Filmmaker Karan Johar and actress Tabu turned showstoppers for Gaurav Gupta on the opening night of Lakmé Fashion Week Summer/ Resort 2019. While Johar wore a red sequinned jacket with black pants, Tabu walked the ramp in a grey embellished gown. The fashion show, which began on January 29, will continue till February 3.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Dekh bhai, promise not to take bribe: PM's mom when he became Guj CM
body: PM Narendra Modi in an interview to \'Humans of Bombay\' revealed that his mother Heeraben Modi said, "Dekh bhai...I don’t understand what you do...but promise me you\'ll never take bribe," after he became Gujarat\'s CM in 2001. "Those words really impacted me," said PM. "A woman...who has lived in poverty her entire life...asked me to not take bribe," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Starc registers 10-wicket-haul as Australia win Test series 2-0
body: Mitchell Starc registered a ten-wicket-haul in the match as Australia won the two-match Test series against Sri Lanka by winning the second Test by 366 runs on Monday. Tim Paine received the Warne-Muralitharan Trophy from former Australia batsman Michael Hussey. Australia will now play Test cricket in August, when they will travel to England for the Ashes series.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Didn't see my mom for 3 yrs while I was working in India: Nargis
body: Actress Nargis Fakhri has revealed she did not see her mother for three years while she was working in India. "I only worked all the time. I didn\'t even have my friends and family around... If you don\'t have the support system, it\'s detrimental to your health," she added. Nargis further said acting as a job is "super emotionally demanding".
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Ben Affleck no longer starring in 'The Batman': Reports
body: Hollywood actor Ben Affleck will no longer star in Warner Bros and DC Entertainment's upcoming film 'The Batman', which is scheduled to release in 2021, as per reports. Affleck earlier stepped down as director for the film in 2017 and was replaced by filmmaker Matt Reeves. Affleck debuted as Batman in the 2016 film 'Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice'.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: CJI-led SC bench to hear CBI's plea against WB govt on Feb 5
body: Supreme Court's three-judge bench headed by CJI Ranjan Gogoi will hear CBI's pleas on February 5. The CBI on Monday has filed pleas against West Bengal government and Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar for alleged non-cooperation in a case connected with Saradha chit fund scam. Justice Deepak Gupta and Justice Sanjiv Khanna will be part of the bench.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Who is Kolkata police chief for whom Mamata Banerjee sat on dharna?
body: Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar, for whom West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee sat on a dharna, is a 1989-batch IPS officer. Mamata began the 'Save the Constitution' dharna after CBI officials arrived at Kumar's residence in connection with the agency's probe into the Saradha and Rose Valley Ponzi scams. Kumar headed the SIT that was looking into both the scams.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Budget like surgical strike, silenced Opp'n: Sushil Modi
body: Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi on Friday called the Interim Budget a "surgical strike type Union Budget", which has "silenced the speech of Opposition". "In the all-inclusive budget of PM Narendra Modi...care has been taken of farmers, labourers," he added. He further said that most benefit will go to states like Bihar "where 91% of small and marginal farmers are".
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: HCL Technologies Q3 profit rises 26% to ₹2,605 crore
body: Software services giant HCL Technologies on Tuesday posted a 26% rise in December quarter profit at ₹2,605 crore. Revenue for the period stood at ₹15,699 crore, up 23% from the same period in the previous year. During the quarter, the company acquired seven IBM software products for $1.8 billion in its biggest-ever acquisition.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Film industry is an egotistical place: Tillotama Shome
body: Actress Tillotama Shome, who has featured in films like \'Hindi Medium\' and \'Monsoon Wedding\', has said that the film industry is an "egotistical place". "The industry...is very hierarchical...Even on the filmmaking side, there are some people who are given more importance than others," the actress added. Tillotama further said she doesn\'t believe in taking success too seriously as it\'s "seasonal".
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Koenigsegg aims to make completely CO2 neutral supercar: CEO
body: Swedish automaker Koenigsegg\'s CEO Christian von Koenigsegg in a recent interview said the automaker\'s "ambition" is to make its upcoming \'slightly lower priced\' hybrid supercar "completely CO2 neutral". "[W]e can...cold-start the car on pure alcohol, down to -30°C, so there’s no need for any fossil fuel mix", he said. Car will combine automaker\'s combustion engine technology with electrification.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Don't shed crocodile tears for farmers: Jaitley to Opposition
body: Hitting out at the Opposition over its remarks on the Interim Budget, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said they shouldn\'t shed crocodile tears for farmers. Adding that the agricultural sector isn\'t just Centre\'s responsibility, he said, "Opposition also has...governments, let them announce similar schemes." "Loan waiver isn\'t a long-term solution. Income support still is," he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Instagram to add 'sensitivity screens' after UK teen suicide
body: Instagram head Adam Mosseri said the platform will hide self-harm imagery of \'cutting\' behind \'sensitivity screens\' following 14-year-old British girl Molly Russell\'s suicide. Molly\'s parents believe she took her life after viewing graphic images of self-harm on Instagram and Pinterest. We let people "share that they are struggling", but remove posts that promote such activity, Mosseri added.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Kapil, Ginni to host wedding reception in Delhi on February 2
body: Kapil Sharma and his wife Ginni Chatrath will host their third wedding reception on February 2 in New Delhi. The couple, who got married on December 12 in Jalandhar, hosted their first wedding reception in Amritsar on December 14. They also hosted their second reception on December 24 at\n JW Marriott in Mumbai for their telly and film industry friends.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Developer platform raises ₹7 crore from Binny Bansal, others
body: Developer platform 'Crio.Do' has raised ₹7 crore ($1 million) from investors including Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal and B2B online marketplace Udaan's Co-founders Amod Malviya, Vaibhav Gupta and Sujeet Kumar. Mekin Maheshwari, Udhyam Learning Foundation's founder, also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2018, the Bengaluru-based startup offers a learning environment for developers.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: 7-year-old girl kidnapped, gangraped in Rohtak railway yard
body: A seven-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gangraped by four men in the Rohtak railway yard in Haryana on Thursday night. The minor, who was left bleeding profusely, managed to reach home and narrated the ordeal to her parents. One of the accused has been identified by name, and three police teams have been constituted to nab the men.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Upset about my 'Manikarnika' scenes being removed: Actress Mishti
body: Actress Mishti, who has featured in \'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi\', has said she\'s really upset about some of her scenes being removed from the film. "After the movie, I didn\'t...speak to anyone. I just walked out of the theatre," she added. "[From] a selfish perspective, as an artiste I think my character has turned into a caricature," said Mishti.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: 25-year-old man killed by girlfriend's brothers in Mumbai
body: A 25-year-old man named Saif Ali Sharafat Ali was allegedly killed by the two brothers of his girlfriend in Mumbai on Tuesday. The police said Saif was going to marry his girlfriend, whose house he was at when her brothers attacked him. The 19-year-old and 23-year-old brothers, who were opposed to their relationship, fled after the incident but were arrested.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Govt pegs dividend from RBI, banks at ₹82,900 crore for FY20
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said the government estimated getting ₹82,912 crore by way of dividend from the banks, financial institutions and the RBI in 2019-20. The dividends to the government for FY19 has been revised to ₹74,140 crore from ₹54,817 crore. Goyal further said he expects banks under RBI's corrective action framework to be removed soon.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Boko Haram kills at least 60 in Nigeria attack
body: The Boko Haram militant group has killed at least 60 people in an attack in the Nigerian town of Rann, human rights group Amnesty International said. Militants on motorcycles drove through the town near the Cameroon border, setting houses on fire and killing people left behind. The attack came a day after the military abandoned the region, Amnesty quoted witnesses.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: SC didn't consider sentiments of Hindus: RSS on Sabarimala
body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Thursday said the Supreme Court didn\'t consider the emotions of "crores of the country\'s Hindus" when it allowed all women to worship at Sabarimala Temple. "The crisis of Ayyappa devotees is crisis of the Hindu society," he added. "Women are saying they\'re ready to wait...Why has...[the] decision been taken in a hurry?" he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Three state-owned banks out of RBI's corrective action list
body: The RBI on Thursday said it has removed state-owned Bank of India, Bank of Maharashtra and Oriental Bank of Commerce out of Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework. The banks have provided a written commitment that they'd comply with minimum regulatory capital, net bad loans and leverage ratio norms, RBI added. Under PCA, restrictions are placed on banks' lending and expansion.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Over 100 girls rescued from trafficking in Manipur
body: Over 100 girls suspected to be trafficked from Nepal were rescued by police in separate raids conducted in Manipur, police said on Saturday. In one of the raids, nearly 40 Nepali girls were rescued and a suspected trafficker was arrested. “The operations were conducted based on inputs by some NGOs,” police sources added.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: No inclination to join politics: Malayalam actor Mohanlal
body: Malayalam actor Mohanlal has said he has "no inclination" to join politics or contest elections. “Politics is not my cup of tea. I always want to remain an actor. I enjoy the freedom I have in this profession," he added. This comes after multiple BJP leaders in Kerala publicly offered Mohanlal a ticket to contest the upcoming Lok Sabha elections.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: India attracted FDI worth $239 billion in last 5 years: FM Goyal
body: India received Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) worth $239 billion in the last five years on account of a stable and predictable regulatory regime, growing economy and strong fundamentals, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said while delivering Interim Budget 2019-20. "This period also witnessed a rapid liberalisation of the FDI policy allowing most FDI to come through the automatic route," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: I only cried at my 'bidaai' as I felt peer pressure: Isha Ambani
body: Reliance Industries\' Chairman Mukesh Ambani\'s daughter Isha Ambani, who got married last month, said she only cried at her \'bidaai\' because she felt peer pressure as everyone was crying, especially her parents. "I was emotional too but everyone around me would cry all the time," she added. "It was a very emotional affair for everyone in my family," said Isha.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: 4th ODI defeat vs NZ was India's worst in terms of balls remaining
body: New Zealand defeated India in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday by eight wickets and with 212 balls to spare. This was India's worst loss in their 960-ODI history in terms of balls remaining. India's previous worst ODI defeat in terms of balls remaining had come on August 22, 2010, when Sri Lanka defeated them with 209 balls remaining.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: No objection to restoration of Mallya's assets to banks: ED
body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday told a special court it had no objection to restoration of fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya\'s properties to a consortium of banks led by SBI. The banks should, however, give an undertaking to return the amount claimed if the court deems it "fit" in future, it added. The banks claimed an amount of ₹6,200 crore.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Where's justice? Vijay Mallya after assets worth ₹13,000 cr seized
body: After Debts Recovery Tribunal attached Vijay Mallya\'s group assets worth ₹13,000 crore in India on behalf of the consortium of banks, Mallya tweeted, "Where\'s justice or fair play?" "The narrative\'s that I ran away with the claimed amount of ₹9,000 crore causing loss to public sector banks," Mallya tweeted. "Every morning I wake up to yet another attachment," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: 81-yr-old woman conducts physical training in J'khand schools
body: Isha Ghosh, an 81-year-old member of Bharat Scouts and Guides (BSG), has been imparting physical and mental training to schoolchildren in Jharkhand for several decades. Chaibasa-based Ghosh reportedly walks seven kilometres daily and spends eight hours conducting physical training, apart from climbing and yoga sessions. She says, "One should do something for society till one\'s last breath."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Film body issues 6-month ban on Alok Nath over alleged rape
body: Indian Film and Television Directors' Association (IFTDA) announced that its parent body Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) issued a six-month non-cooperative directive to rape accused actor Alok Nath.
