The ban was issued after the actor failed to turn up for a POSH (Prevention of Sexual Harassment) inquiry. Nath was allegedly summoned thrice by the Internal Complaints Committee.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Messi's brace against Valencia salvages draw for Barcelona
body: Lionel Messi scored a brace to help Barcelona secure a 2-2 draw in Saturday's La Liga match against Valencia. This was the ninth consecutive La Liga match in which Messi scored. Barcelona are set to face Real Madrid in the Copa del Rey on Wednesday. Barcelona are six points ahead of Atletico Madrid in the La Liga points table.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Amazon removes many products from India site over new e-comm rules
body: Amazon was forced to remove numerous products including certain batteries and floor cleaners from its India website as new e-commerce rules came into effect from Friday. New e-commerce investment rules bar online retailers from selling products via vendors in which they have an equity interest. They are also barred from making deals with sellers to sell exclusively on their platforms.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Aguero scores three as Man City beat Arsenal 3-1
body: Sergio Aguero scored his 14th hat-trick for Manchester City as they closed the gap on Premier League leaders Liverpool to only two points after a 3-1 victory over Arsenal on Sunday. With the loss, Arsenal have dropped down to the sixth place in the EPL table after Manchester United's latest win at Leicester City.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: 'Fiji Water Girl' sues Fiji Water for using her image on cutouts
body: Model Kelleth Cuthbert, also known as \'Fiji Water Girl\' after photo bombing celebrities while carrying a tray of Fiji Water on the Golden Globes red carpet, has sued the company for using her image on cardboard cutouts without her authorisation. Cuthbert alleged the company attempted to pressure \nher into signing a "fake document" authorising the use of her image.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Mamata Banerjee gives away police awards near dharna site
body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday handed over awards to police officers on a stage adjacent to her 'Save the Democracy' dharna site. The function was the Investiture ceremony of annual awards for the state and Kolkata police. The CM is sitting on dharna after a huge showdown between the Kolkata Police and officials of the CBI on Sunday.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Trump to pick Treasury's Malpass to lead World Bank: Reports
body: President Donald Trump will reportedly pick senior Treasury official David Malpass as the US nominee to lead the World Bank. The 62-year-old is known to have earlier criticised the World Bank and other multilateral institutions for growing "intrusive" and "entrenched". World Bank\'s former President Jim Yong Kim stepped down on February 1 to join private equity firm Global Infrastructure Partners.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: 300-metre-tall cavity in Antarctic glacier surprising: NASA
body: NASA scientists were "surprised" to discover a 300-metre-tall cavity in the bottom of West Antarctica\'s Thwaites Glacier, indicating acceleration in rising sea levels in response to climate change. The hole is big enough to contain 14 billion tonnes ice, the space agency added. The melting glacier is currently responsible for about 4% of global sea level rise, NASA further said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Italian coach knocks rival down with headbutt, banned for 5 months
body: Italian third division football side Lucchese's head coach Giancarlo Favarin has been banned for five months for headbutting Alessandria's assistant coach Gaetano Mancino during a brawl following the teams' 2-2 draw on Sunday. Mancino was caught off-balance and knocked to the ground after the headbutt. Earlier in the match, Favarin had told his own player to break an opponent's legs.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: BJP calls Tharoor's jibe at Yogi's holy dip 'unfortunate'
body: After Congress leader Shashi Tharoor took a jibe at UP CM Yogi Adityanath\'s holy dip in the Ganga, BJP spokesman Nalin Kohli said, "This is very unfortunate." Nalin added, "An extremely educated and respected person like Tharoor always comes up with such kind of comments related to practices of the Hindu religion... Tharoor must show respect for other people too."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: My 1st reaction to something I can't get is aggression: Sidharth
body: Sidharth Malhotra, on TV show \'Koffee With Karan\', revealed that his first reaction to something that he can\'t get is aggression, adding, "I just become quiet and aggressive." He further said, "If I didn\'t have the drive and the aggression, I wouldn\'t have made it because there are millions of kids just like us who want to become actors."
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Was never good at academics, more to life than exams: Akshay
body: Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to share a video from PM Narendra Modi\'s \'Pariksha Par Charcha 2.0\',  and revealed that while he was never good at academics, with hard work and his "parents\' blessings", he "managed pretty well". "With exams around the corner, I’d like to reiterate to students and parents, there’s more to life than just exams," he wrote.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Have known Hirani for yrs, what if MeToo claims are not true: Sonam
body: Speaking about the sexual harassment allegations against Rajkumar Hirani, Sonam Kapoor said, "I\'ve known Hirani for many years...What if it\'s not true, the [#MeToo] movement will get derailed." "In the #MeToo movement, I always believe a woman. But in this case, we need to reserve our judgment," she added. Hirani has been accused by an assistant who worked in \'Sanju\'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Parma salvage draw against Juventus after Ronaldo's brace
body: Parma's Gervinho completed his brace after scoring his side's equaliser in the 93rd minute in the Serie A match against Juventus on Saturday. Earlier in the match, Cristiano Ronaldo had scored a brace. Following the 3-3 draw, Juventus' lead at the top of Serie A has now been cut to nine points after second-placed Napoli's 3-0 win against Sampdoria.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Army Chief Rawat meets Parrikar to enquire about his health
body: Indian Army Chief General Bipin Rawat on Thursday met Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar at the state Assembly complex in Panaji. After the meeting, Rawat said, "I had come here to enquire about the health of Parrikar. It was just a courtesy visit." Parrikar has been suffering from a pancreatic ailment.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Artist sues Ariana Grande for copying imagery in music video
body: An artist named Vladimir Kush sued singer Ariana Grande over the imagery used in the music video for her song 'God is a Woman'. Kush alleged that visuals from the video, where a woman's silhouette is seen inside a flame, were copied from two of his paintings. Kush is also suing Freenjoy, the production company behind the video.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Woman techie booked for kidnapping carpenter who stalked her
body: Hyderabad Police has booked a 24-year-old woman software engineer on charges of assaulting and kidnapping a carpenter who had allegedly been stalking her. He harassed her by sending messages and calling her on phone. The woman then asked him to come near a college, from where, she and her five friends took him to an isolated place and thrashed him.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: 'How's the josh?!' is no more a line, it's an emotion: Vicky
body: Vicky Kaushal, while talking about the dialogue \'How\'s the josh?!\' from his film \'Uri: The Surgical Strike\', said that it is not just a line anymore, it\'s an emotion. In an Instagram post, the actor wrote, "I get so many \'How\'s the josh?!\' videos from you all every day, each one made with so much love and passion."
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: All Muslims should've been sent to Pak during Partition: BJP MP
body: Claiming our ancestors "made a mistake" during Partition, BJP MP Giriraj Singh said, "Each and every Hindu should have been brought back to India and each and every Muslim should have been sent back to Pakistan." He claimed the Ram Mandir issue would\'ve been resolved earlier if India\'s first Home Minister Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel was the country\'s first PM instead.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Govt directs Alok Verma to join work 1 day before his retirement
body: Weeks after ex-CBI Director Alok Verma told the Department of Personnel and Training to consider him retired, the Home Ministry asked him to join work on the last day of his fixed tenure as Director on Thursday. The ministry directed him to immediately join as DG, Fire Services, the post he was transferred to after his removal as CBI chief.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Kharge tried to manipulate CBI chief selection: Union Min
body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Saturday claimed that Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge "tried to manipulate the objective criteria, based on independent and impartial assessment, to select CBI Director." "He wanted to include some officers of his preference in the short-list of candidates,” he added. Kharge was part of PM Narendra Modi-led panel which selected the new CBI Director.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Maharashtra Cabinet approves 10% general category quota
body: The Maharashtra Cabinet on Monday approved the 10% reservation in government jobs and educational institutes for the economically weaker section in general category in the state. Maharashtra has become the seventh state to approve the implementation of the bill. The Constitution (124th Amendment) Bill, 2019 was approved by President Ram Nath Kovind on January 12.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Bharti Airtel third-quarter profit plunges 72% to ₹86 crore
body: The country's second-largest telecom operator Bharti Airtel on Thursday reported a net profit of ₹86 crore for the December quarter, an almost 72% decline from the same quarter a year ago. The company's revenue rose by almost 1% to ₹20,519 crore. Airtel's domestic average revenue per user plunged 15.5% to ₹104 from ₹123 in the year-ago period.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Govt revises FY19 fiscal deficit target at 3.4% of GDP
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday revised the fiscal deficit target to 3.4% of GDP for 2018-19 in the Interim Budget speech. The government had earlier pegged fiscal deficit target for the year at 3.3% of GDP. Fiscal deficit is the difference between the total revenue and total expenditure of the government.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: MIT makes pill that expands in stomach to track cancer, ulcer
body: MIT engineers have developed a jelly-like ingestible pill that expands inside the stomach and can be used to monitor conditions like cancers and ulcers for up to a month. The pill, made using two types of hydrogels, is embedded with a sensor that continuously tracks the stomach's temperature. It can be removed by drinking a calcium-ion solution that shrinks it.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: There was no domination by Kangana: Manikarnika actor Zeeshan
body: Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub, who played the role of \'Sadashivrao Bhau\' in Kangana Ranaut\'s \'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi\', said, "There was no arm-twisting or domination from her [Kangana\'s] end...Things were under control." "Kangana had clearly told me what my role would be, so I knew exactly what to expect," added Zeeshan, who was cast in film after Sonu Sood\'s exit.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Swedish guards drag 8-month pregnant woman out of train over ticket
body: A video showing a woman, believed to be 8 months pregnant, being dragged out of the Stockholm metro by two guards has surfaced online. The woman, who was with her daughter, was caught without a ticket, officials said. She was later rushed to hospital for treatment and the two guards have been suspended pending an inquiry.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Chirag Patil to play father Sandeep Patil in Ranveer starrer '83
body: Actor Chirag Patil will play his father and ex-India cricketer Sandeep Patil in Kabir Khan directorial \'83, based on India\'s first World Cup victory in 1983. "The man who played \'83 World Cup with broken ribs will be played by his son," a post on the film\'s Twitter handle read. Ranveer Singh will play ex-captain Kapil Dev in the film.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: 15 held for stealing 1000 kg 'Nandi' idol from Andhra temple
body: The police on Saturday arrested 15 people in connection with the theft of a 1000 kg 'Nandi' idol from an ancient Shiva temple in Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari district. The culprits had stolen the granite idol believing rumours that it had diamonds in it. They dismantled the idol in the outskirts of the district but found no precious stones.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Those who steal are afraid, but why is Mamata? Oil Minister
body: Talking about West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee\'s dharna following confrontation between CBI and Kolkata Police, Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "What is she so scared of? Only those who steal are afraid." "It was after the Supreme Court’s direction in 2013 that an inquiry began," he added. "If Mamata is so fearless, why is she opposing it?" he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: US begins sending back asylum seekers to Mexico
body: The US on Tuesday began returning asylum seekers to Mexico, sending back a migrant from a Central American nation and called the move a "response to the illegal migration crisis" faced by it. Under its Migrant Protection Protocols policy, the US will return certain migrants who cross into the country illegally back to Mexico while their asylum requests are processed.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: India in no danger of losing World Cup 2023 rights: ICC
body: ICC CEO David Richardson has said India are not in danger of losing hosting rights of the 2021 T20 World Cup and 2023 World Cup despite tax exemption issues. "There are no plans of taking away...hosting...I\'m sure we\'ll get (exemption) in the end," he added. Notably, ICC lost a revenue of ₹125 crore from 2016 World T20 staged in India.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Kid has become a man: Kaif on player who played despite mom's death
body: Reacting to 22-year-old Windies pacer Alzarri Joseph, who played against England in the second Test just hours after his mother passed away, former India batsman Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "Young kid has grown into a man." "Real grit from Alzarri Joseph...Youngsters standing up has been most vital in making of this new Windies, which is great for Test cricket," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Singer Shivani Bhatia dies in car accident, husband survives
body: Singer and stage performer Shivani Bhatia died in a road accident on Tuesday morning, after her car rammed into a divider on the Yamuna Expressway. The singer was accompanied by her husband Nikhil Bhatia, who survived the accident. "The accident occurred after Nikhil attempted to overtake a high-speed car and lost control of his vehicle," said police.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Rajinikanth's daughter confirms 2nd wedding a week before marriage
body: Actor Rajinikanth\'s daughter Soundarya Rajinikanth took to social media to confirm her second wedding to actor and businessman Vishagan Vanangamudi on February 11, which will be held in Chennai. Sharing a picture of herself, Soundarya wrote, "#OneWeekToGo #BrideMode #Blessed." She was earlier married to industrialist Ashwin Ramkumar and they got divorced in 2017 after six years of marriage.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Sonam has made herself, worked hard to become what she is: Anil
body: Anil Kapoor, while talking about his daughter and actress Sonam Kapoor, said, "She has made herself. She has worked hard to become what she is." Anil added that Sonam is the kind of person who gives a lot of love and affection. He further said, "[Giving love and affection] comes very naturally to her. She is a very sensitive person."
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: SP leader Azam Khan attempted an acid attack on me: Jaya Prada
body: Referring to her conflict with Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan in 2009, actor-turned-politician Jaya Prada on Friday said, "Azam Khan harassed me. He attempted an acid attack on me. I had no certainty if I would be alive the next day." The relation between the two leaders reportedly turned bitter after Prada moved to Amar Singh\'s camp in the party.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Pentagon sending 3,750 extra US forces to border with Mexico
body: The US Department of Defence is sending 3,750 additional US forces to the southwest border with Mexico for three months to support border agents. The deployment will raise the total number of active-duty forces supporting Customs and Border Protection agents there to about 4,350. "We will continue to evaluate the force composition required to secure the border," the Pentagon said.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: West Bengal groom arrives in road roller for his wedding ceremony
body: Arka Patra, a 30-year-old groom from West Bengal, arrived for his wedding ceremony in a road roller on Sunday. "I wanted to make my wedding ceremony memorable and unique. I could take a vintage car, but that would not be new," he said. Patra said his wife also agreed to his idea when he had discussed it with her.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: MS Dhoni runs NZ batsman out while appealing for LBW against him
body: India wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni ran New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham out while appealing for LBW against him in the 37th over in the fifth ODI on Sunday. Neesham was hit on the pads while trying to sweep a Kedar Jadhav delivery. The ball rolled behind to Dhoni and he under-armed it onto the stumps while appealing along with Jadhav.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Consider PIL seeking transparency at petrol pumps: SC to Centre
body: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the Centre and petroleum ministry to consider a plea seeking direction for the government to ensure transparency at petrol pumps across the country. The plea, filed last month, had alleged that fuel stations are installing "microchips" to speed up the pulse meter to give lesser fuel to customers.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Supermodel Tyra Banks to open tech-based attraction
body: American supermodel-turned-entrepreneur Tyra Banks on Tuesday announced plans to open a technology-driven attraction named \'Modelland\' in California, later this year. The 21,000-square-foot attraction will reportedly feature AR and VR-based interactive entertainment. \'Modelland\' is the "genesis for people with all types of different beauty to feel seen and validated," Tyra said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: 251 sedition cases filed in Assam since May 2016
body: Assam government has registered as many as 251 sedition cases since May 26, 2016, the Assembly was informed on Monday. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Chandra Mohan Patowary said that these cases have been filed against militant groups such as Dima Halam Daogah and Zeliangrong United Front, among others. Such cases were also registered against several individuals, Patowary added.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: 13k killed in Maha road accidents in 2018; highest in 3 years
body: As many as 13,059 people were killed in road accidents in Maharashtra in 2018, the highest in last three years, state Transport Minister Diwakar Raote said. Of these, 80% or around 11,000 deaths were caused due to human error, he added. Pedestrians, two-wheeler riders and cyclists together comprised 66% of the fatalities, Raote further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Pathan brothers' cricket academy opens 15th academy in Ranchi
body: The Cricket Academy of Pathans, a cricket academy run by Indian cricketers Irfan and Yusuf Pathan, opened its 15th academy in Ranchi, Jharkhand on Sunday. The Pathan brothers had launched these academies over 2 years ago. Yusuf, who serves as the Director at the Cricket Academy of Pathans, said, "We are providing every possible assistance to the aspiring cricketers."
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: You haven't won the game until you have got Dhoni out: Neesham
body: Speaking about India\'s middle-order batsman MS Dhoni, New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham said, "[W]hen you\'re bowling to him, you know you haven\'t won the game till you\'ve got him out." "Some noise was made especially from Indian media about whether he should be there in their World Cup squad or not... [H]is record speaks for itself," Neesham added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: US woman carrying baby dies after falling down stairs in subway
body: A 22-year-old woman died after she fell down a flight of stairs in a New York City subway station while carrying her one-year-old baby in a pram. The station where she died didn't have elevators. Only about a quarter of New York City's 472 subway stations have elevators, making the rest inaccessible to people in wheelchairs and parents carrying prams.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: We have left behind culture of delays: PM Modi
body: Inaugurating a number of projects in Jammu and Kashmir’s Leh, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said, “Our government believes in working faster. The country has left behind the culture of delays." "Whatever project we begin, we try our level best to finish it within the stipulated time,” he added. The PM also announced opening of five new trekking routes.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Ending life logical: IIT Hyd student wrote to friends before suicide
body: Anirudhya Mummaneni, a 21-year-old student of IIT Hyderabad allegedly committed suicide by jumping off the seven-storey hostel building on the campus, police said. The student had also mailed his friends before committing suicide, saying, "The decision to end my life is purely logical...Life holds no intrigue anymore." "The daily grind is becoming more difficult with time," his mail further read.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: There may be constitutional breakdown in WB: Rajnath Singh
body: Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday said there may be a constitutional breakdown in West Bengal in the wake of the Kolkata Police-CBI face-off. He added it was "unprecedented" the way the CBI was stopped from performing its duty in Kolkata. He said the Centre has the power to take action to maintain normalcy in any part of the country.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: India's Lambda buys US research firm Novum Pharmaceutical
body: Ahmedabad-headquartered Lambda Therapeutic Research on Tuesday announced the acquisition of US-based Novum Pharmaceutical Research Services. The Indian contract research organisation said this is its second acquisition in North America following the acquisition of the R&D facilities of Canada's Biovail in 2010. Apart from India, Lambda has operations in Canada, Poland and the UK.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Government permits women to work in underground mines
body: The Labour Ministry has allowed women to work in underground mines between 6 am to 7 pm in technical, supervisory and managerial work. It has also allowed women to work in mines above ground at any time of the day. The Mines Act, 1952, had restricted women in underground mines and limited working in above-ground mines between 6 am-7 pm.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: SRK approached for Bhandarkar's 'Inspector Ghalib': Reports
body: Shah Rukh Khan has been approached to star in filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar's upcoming film 'Inspector Ghalib', as per reports. Earlier reports suggested that actor Sushant Singh Rajput will be starring in the forthcoming film. The film, which will be set in Uttar Pradesh, follows the story of a policeman who takes on the sand mafia.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Cruel to stop govt use of face recognition tech: Microsoft Prez
body: Microsoft President Brad Smith in an interview said a sweeping ban on all government use of facial recognition technology "risks being cruel in its humanitarian effect". He added researchers used the technology to find rare, genetic disease in Africans, Asians and Latin Americans. "Why should we stop a government from helping identify patients who need medical care?" he further said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: It was my decision to give Kangana 1st credit: Manikarnika producer
body: \'Manikarnika\' producer Kamal Jain, while criticising co-director Krish over the controversy surrounding the direction credits, said, "It was mine and studio\'s collective decision to give credits the way they are." "To attack Kangana who stood by the film from beginning to end is very sad," he added. Krish is trying to claim credit for something he doesn\'t deserve, said Kamal.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Tax rebate proposed for those who need it most: Piyush Goyal
body: Discussing the proposed zero tax for individual taxpayers having an annual taxable income of up to ₹5,00,000, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal has said, "These are the people who need it the most." He added, "We are clear that the benefits of formalisation of the economy, the larger tax base, more taxes... have to be shared."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Having Anu Malik as uncle must be trauma enough: Sona to Amaal Mallik
body: After singer Amaal Mallik said he doesn\'t consider his uncle Anu Malik as family, in light of sexual harassment allegations against him, Sona Mohapatra tweeted, "Having [him] as...uncle must be trauma enough." Reacting to his statement that women should go to court instead of making allegations on social media, Sona added, "These are our \'personal stories\' too...Don\'t go around judging."
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Tiger that mauled 3 people to death captured in Karnataka
body: Karnataka forest department officials on Friday captured a tiger suspected to have mauled a 60-year-old man to death a day ago. A senior official said, "We had spotted the animal in one of our camera traps and successfully tranquillised it." The tiger, which is suspected to have killed three people since December 23, is being relocated to a zoo.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: 34 crore Jan Dhan bank accounts opened in last 5 years: FM
body: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said 34 crore Jan Dhan Yojana bank accounts were opened in last five years. This comes after President Ram Nath Kovind stated that almost every family is now connected to the banking system. Goyal further said Aadhaar has been universally implemented, ensuring the poor and middle class receive government benefits directly.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: MP Congress seeks Governor Anandiben Patel's resignation
body: Madhya Pradesh Congress party has sought the resignation of Governor Anandiben Patel accusing her of working as a worker of the BJP. This comes after Patel reportedly said "Modi sahab ka dhyan rakhana" during her visit to a solar power plant in Rewa district on Saturday. She was interacting with a group of villagers in the area.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: If US Prez threatens a person, we'd take action: Twitter CEO
body: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey in an interview said if a public leader like the US President makes a "violent threat" to an individual, Twitter would take action. Talking about US President Donald Trump\'s tweets \'threatening\' North Korea, he added, "If you...look at President Obama...[he made] threats surrounding the same country". US presidents have used "similar language" across mediums, he said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Swara Bhasker to produce and star in Krishna Sen biopic
body: Swara Bhasker, who recently launched her production house Kahaaniwaaley along with her brother Ishan, will produce and star in a biopic on Krishna Sen. Talking about the project, Ishan said, "Krishna Sen\'s real-life story is the perfect choice to portray a mysterious real-life character as well as bring a strangely true story to life on the big screen."
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: What is polar vortex, setting temperatures in US below Antarctica?
body: The polar vortex is a large area of low pressure and cold air surrounding both of the Earth’s poles. The current of the northern polar vortex has been disrupted and is now pushing south, bringing temperatures in the US Midwest lower than parts of Antarctica. Over 200 million Americans are expected to be affected by the cold weather phenomenon.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: My biggest fear is becoming mundane, doing boring films: SRK
body: Shah Rukh Khan revealed that his biggest fear is becoming "mundane" and taking up "boring" films. "I hope the day never comes when...I tell myself that it\'s okay to do just a regular film which...[becomes] a box office hit and I can buy myself a new car and be happy," the actor said. "That thought scares me," he added.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Taxpayers increased from 3.79 crore to 6.85 crore
body: While delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced that the tax base has risen from 3.79 crore to 6.85 crore. He added, "Direct tax collections increased from ₹6.38 lakh crore in 2013-14 to almost ₹12 lakh crore." He also said that over 1 crore people filed IT returns for the first time after demonetisation.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Don’t need certificate of courage from you: Gadkari to Rahul
body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday took a dig at the Congress President Rahul Gandhi saying he doesn\'t need a certificate of courage from Rahul. His comment came after Rahul said Gadkari is the "only one in the BJP with some guts". Gadkari said he was surprised to see Rahul referring to twisted media reports to attack the BJP.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Gadkari only one in BJP with some guts: Rahul
body: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Monday took to Twitter to praise Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, saying, "You are the only one in BJP with some guts." Rahul said this in reference to Gadkari\'s statement "one who cannot take care of home, cannot manage the country". He further asked Gadkari to comment on Rafale scam, destruction of institutions and farmers\' distress.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Indian-origin businessman Reuben Singh buys 6 Rolls-Royce for ₹50 cr
body: London-based 42-year-old Indian-origin businessman Reuben Singh, who runs private equity fund and family office Isher Capital, recently bought six Rolls-Royce cars worth over ₹50 crore. His newly purchased Rolls-Royce cars include three units each of Phantom luxury sedan and recently launched Cullinan luxury SUV. Rolls-Royce Motor Cars CEO Torsten Muller-Otvos himself delivered the cars to Singh.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Ex-India coach Greg Chappell set to exit Cricket Australia
body: Former Indian team coach Greg Chappell is set to exit Cricket Australia where he currently serves as a selector and national talent manager following the Ashes against England later this year. Chappell's first stint as a selector with the board stretched between 1984 and 1988, the second from 2010 to 2011 and the third and final from 2016 till date.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: It was Account for Votes, not Vote-on-Account: Chidambaram
body: Reacting to the Interim Budget presented in the Parliament on Friday, Congress MP and former Finance Minister P Chidambaram tweeted, "It was not a Vote-on-Account. It was an Account for Votes." Vote-on-Account is a provision by which the government obtains Parliament\'s approval for funds sufficient to incur expenditure till a full budget is presented after formation of new government.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: ₹3,000 per month assured pension for unorganised sector workers
body: The government announced Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Mandhan, that will give an assured monthly pension of ₹3,000, with contribution of ₹100 per month, for unorganised sector workers after reaching 60 years of age. "This will benefit 10 crore workers in unorganised sector, may become the world\'s biggest pension scheme for unorganised sector," Piyush Goyal said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Farmers hit by natural calamity to get 2% interest subvention
body: Delivering the Interim Budget, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced that all farmers severely affected by severe natural calamities will get 2% interest subvention. The scheme, which will replace rescheduling of crop loans, provides for additional 3% interest subvention for farmers upon timely repayment. Further, farmers owning up to 2 hectares of land will get ₹6,000 a year as income support.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Higuain Chelsea's 1st in 19 yrs to score brace on EPL home debut
body: Gonzalo Higuain became the first Chelsea player in 19 years to score a brace on a home league debut after he helped his side register a 5-0 win over Huddersfield Town on Saturday. Eden Hazard also scored a brace in the match which witnessed N'Golo Kanté provide two assists. Earlier in the day, Tottenham salvaged a 1-0 win over Newcastle.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Karunaratne out of hospital after blow to neck from Cummins
body: Sri Lankan opener Dimuth Karunaratne has been released from hospital after he was stretchered off the ground after a bouncer from Pat Cummins hit him on the back of the neck in the Canberra Test. Karunaratne immediately fell to the ground after getting struck and was given medical attention from the medical staff of both the teams.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Women are naughtier and hotter after 40: Vidya Balan on turning 40
body: Vidya Balan, while speaking to \'Filmfare\' about turning 40, said women are "naughtier and hotter after 40". She added, "Generally, we\'re taught to be...coy and not enjoy sex. But...reason they say women get better with age is because you care less and less, it\'s more about you." "When you don\'t care, you\'ve the most amount of fun," Vidya further said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Rahul's simplicity, humbleness should be admired: BJP MLA
body: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi met Goa CM Manohar Parrikar, BJP MLA Michael Lobo said, "His simplicity, his humbleness has to be really admired by all the Indians and the Goans." Lobo added, "These types of leaders are required in Goa and India." Rahul had said he made a personal visit to Parrikar\'s office to wish him a speedy recovery.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: My wife scolded me a day before Slumdog Millionaire won Oscars: Anil
body: Actor Anil Kapoor revealed he got "a lot of firing" from his wife Sunita Kapoor a day before \'Slumdog Millionaire\' won eight Oscars in 2009. "For family, Oscar doesn\'t matter. My wife and I were discussing Sonam the night before Oscars," said Anil. "I said \'let me sleep now\' and she said \'leave Oscar, listen to me first\'," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: upGrad learner switches to career in ML & Al with 90% salary hike
body: Saurav Kant, an alumnus of upGrad and IIIT-B's PG Program in Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence, was a Sr Systems Engineer at Infosys with almost 5 years of work experience. The program and upGrad's 360-degree career support helped him transition to a Data Scientist at Tech Mahindra with 90% salary hike. upGrad's Online Power Learning has powered 3 lakh+ careers.
author: Roshan Gupta

headline: Kedar Jadhav asks team 'How's the josh' during trophy presentation
body: During the trophy presentation ceremony following India's 4-1 ODI series victory over New Zealand, batsman Kedar Jadhav quoted the dialogue from 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' and asked the team 'How's the josh?' repeatedly. Players including Mohammed Siraj, Khaleel Ahmed and stand-in captain Rohit Sharma responded to Jadhav saying, 'High sir'.  The series victory was India's biggest in New Zealand.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Govt sources leaked budget pointers to media: Cong's Manish Tewari
body: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Friday alleged government sources were sending budget pointers to media houses since morning. "If these pointers are there in Finance Minister\'s speech then it tantamounts to a leak. It would be a serious issue of breach of secrecy," added Tewari. He also shared a series of pointers which he claimed were leaked by government sources.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Super Bowl featured its 1st male cheerleader in 53rd edition
body: The Los Angeles Rams cheerleaders Napoleon Jinnies and Quinton Peron became the first male cheerleaders to feature in the National Football League's 53rd Super Bowl event on Sunday. The New England Patriots beat the Los Angeles Rams 13-3 to capture a National Football League record-tying sixth Super Bowl title. Pittsburgh Steelers have also won six Super Bowl titles.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Swiggy acquihires Bengaluru-based AI startup Kint
body: Food delivery startup Swiggy has acquihired Bengaluru-based AI startup Kint.io for an undisclosed amount. As part of the deal, Kint.io's founding members Pavithra Solai Jawahar \nand Jagannathan Veeraraghavan will join the Swiggy team, Swiggy said in a statement. Founded in 2014, Kint.io specialises in applying deep learning and computer vision for object recognition in videos.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Changed mindset, self belief key to Saurashtra's rise: Unadkat
body: Saurashtra Ranji team captain Jaydev Unadkat said, "We have started to believe we can win against the big teams... I have been with teams where the mind-set was just not to lose badly against a big team." "No one would have thought of a Ranji trophy final between Saurashtra and Vidarbha 10 years ago," Unadkat added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: 11-year-old boy seeks ban on PUBG, moves Bombay High Court
body: An 11-year-old boy on Thursday moved the Bombay High Court, seeking a ban on online multi-player game PUBG. The boy said that the game promotes violence, aggression and cyber-bullying. "The petition has also sought a direction to the central government to form an Online Ethics Review Committee for periodical checking of such violence-oriented online content,” the petitioner’s lawyer said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Mallikarjun Kharge is a regular 'dissenter': Arun Jaitley
body: Senior BJP leader Arun Jaitley on Sunday termed Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge a regular "dissenter". "He dissented when Shri Alok Verma was appointed, dissented when Shri Alok Verma was transferred and has now dissented when Shri RK Shukla has been appointed," he added. Jaitley further said that Kharge made the appointment of CBI Director look like a "political battle".
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Sultan Abdullah crowned Malaysia's 16th King
body: Sultan Abdullah Sultan Ahmad Shah was on Thursday crowned Malaysia's 16th King, nearly a month after Sultan Muhammad V's abdication. The 59-year-old took the oath of office in a nationally televised ceremony at the national palace in Kuala Lumpur. The Malaysian King is elected on a rotational basis from the sultans of the country's nine states for a five-year term.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Choksi still a citizen, pushing for his extradition: Govt
body: The government has said fugitive jeweller Mehul Choksi is an Indian citizen despite holding Antigua and Barbuda passport and that it's pushing for his extradition from Antigua. Choksi, who is one of the accused in the over ₹14,000-crore PNB fraud, fled India before accusations surfaced last year. Choksi and his nephew Nirav Modi are under probe by CBI and ED.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Real surprise: Jadhav on Dhoni advising him in Marathi during ODI
body: Team India\'s Kedar Jadhav took to Twitter to reveal that it came to him as a "real surprise" when MS Dhoni advised him in Marathi during fifth ODI against New Zealand. "Pudhe nako bhau...gheun taak (Don\'t bowl full...get him)," Dhoni was heard telling Jadhav. "You always feel at home on foreign tours when @msdhoni is behind the stumps," Jadhav tweeted.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Six injured after bus falls into drain in Rajasthan
body: At least six people were injured after a Rajasthan Roadways bus fell into a drain in Rajasthan's Chaksu, 40 km from Jaipur, on Tuesday. A crane and a boat were used to take the bus out of the drain, as per reports. All the 25 passengers have been rescued and the injured have been admitted to a nearby hospital.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Varun injures knee on sets of Remo D'souza's film: Reports
body: Actor Varun Dhawan injured his knee while shooting for choreographer-turned-filmmaker Remo D'souza's upcoming dance film in Punjab, as per reports. The injury occurred while the actor was performing a dance step called the knee drop for a dance sequence in the film, reports further suggested. Varun is reportedly recovering from the injury and is undergoing physiotherapy in Mumbai.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Grenade thrown into mosque in Philippines; 2 killed
body: At least two people were killed and four others were injured on Wednesday after a grenade was thrown into a mosque in Zamboanga, Philippines, authorities said. An unidentified assailant reportedly threw a grenade when about 10 people were sleeping. This comes days after explosions at a Roman Catholic cathedral left 21 people dead and over 100 injured in the Philippines.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Hyderabad's Mayor fined for parking in restricted zone
body: Hyderabad Mayor Bonthu Rammohan was fined by the city traffic police for parking his car in a 'No Parking' zone. A local of the city took a photo of the car and uploaded it on social media drawing the attention of the traffic police, reports said. Following this, the police issued a challan and Rammohan paid the penalty.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Bhagwant Mann to take over as Punjab chief of AAP again
body: AAP MP Bhagwant Mann will again take charge as the chief of the party's Punjab unit on Wednesday. In March 2018, Mann had tendered his resignation after Kejriwal apologised to Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader Bikram Singh Majithia over allegations of his involvement in drug trade. However, his resignation was rejected by Punjab AAP last week.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Google removes 29 apps that steal pics, show porn: Report
body: Google has reportedly removed 29 apps from Play Store, which stole users' images, showed pornographic content via ads and redirected users to phishing websites. As per Trend Micro, the apps, disguised as beauty and camera apps, could access remote ad configuration servers to carry out malicious activities. These apps were downloaded millions of times, particularly in India, Trend Micro said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Amazon suspends grocery service after revised e-comm rules
body: E-commerce major Amazon has suspended its grocery service 'Amazon Pantry' in India for an undisclosed duration of time. This development follows the February 1 implementation of the revised FDI rules on e-commerce that prohibit e-tailers from selling products of companies in which they have a stake. Amazon also had to remove numerous products including floor cleaners from its India website.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Russia won't deploy missiles anywhere as long as US doesn't: Putin
body: After announcing that Russia would withdraw from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with the US within 6 months, President Vladimir Putin said, "Russia won\'t deploy missiles anywhere as long as US doesn\'t." Adding that doors for negotiations with US are open, Putin asked Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu to not initiate talks on the issue.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Yuvraj meets Shakti Kapoor at airport, makes him say 'Aaoo Lolita'
body: Indian all-rounder Yuvraj Singh met actor Shakti Kapoor at Mumbai airport and shared a video of their meet on Instagram. Yuvraj called Shakti "an all-time rockstar" and asked him to say his "epic dialogue" after which the actor said, "Aaoo Lolita". Shakti added that he loves Yuvraj and wants to see him hit six sixes in an over again.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: No TDS on rental income of up to ₹2.4 lakh per year, govt proposes
body: While delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal proposed exemption of TDS on rental income of up to ₹2.4 lakh/year from the existing ₹1.8 lakh/year. He also proposed to exempt tax on notional rent on second self-occupied houses. Goyal further proposed exemption of tax on notional rent on unsold real estate inventory for first two years.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: I don't consider Anu Malik family: Nephew Amaal on #MeToo claims
body: Singer Amaal Mallik, while speaking about the sexual harassment allegations against his uncle, singer-composer Anu Malik, said, "My family is first my four people. Beyond that, I don\'t count anyone as a family. He has his own family." "It was a tough time for them," he added. "When it happened, it was obviously a little humiliating," Amaal further said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: MP CM reinstates teacher suspended for objectionable post on Rahul
body: MP CM Kamal Nath has ordered the reinstatement of a government school teacher suspended for an objectionable online post on Congress President Rahul Gandhi. Stating the suspension was "contrary to his (Rahul\'s) way of thinking" and "to my way of thinking as well," Nath advised the teacher to read about the sacrifice of the Gandhi family to "dispel any prejudice".
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Jet Airways cancels 15 flights, grounds 6 Boeing 737 planes
body: Cash-strapped carrier Jet Airways cancelled 15 flights on Wednesday after grounding six Boeing 737 planes over non-payment of lease rentals. Facing debts of about $1.14 billion, Jet Airways had cancelled around 20 flights a day ago after three Boeing 737 aircraft were grounded. Meanwhile, the airline is in talks with its partner Etihad for additional cash infusion.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Electoral reforms pending due to lethargy: Ex-CEC Quraishi
body: Former Chief Election Commissioner SY Quraishi said, "Electoral reforms are long pending due to...lethargy." In the introduction of \'The Great March of Democracy: Seven Decades of India\'s Elections\', he further said that it is "imperative to be mindful of some shortcomings in our system." He added that several reforms have come due to the intervention of judiciary.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Apple apologises for FaceTime bug, thanks 14-yr-old for finding it
body: Apple on Friday issued a statement apologising for a FaceTime bug that allowed users to listen in on people before they picked up the group video call. Apple also thanked 14-year-old American boy Grant Thompson's family for reporting the bug. The iPhone maker added it will issue a software update to re-enable the Group FaceTime feature for users next week.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: New CBI chief lacks experience: Cong leader in PM panel dissents
body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge, who was part of PM Narendra Modi-led panel which selected Rishi Kumar Shukla as the new CBI Director on Saturday, has sent a dissent note saying the 1983-batch IPS officer lacks experience in anti-corruption investigations. Kharge previously disagreed on Alok Verma's removal as CBI chief and asked PM Modi to make the CVC probe documents public.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Shraddha has done really well, biopic turning out well: Saina
body: Saina Nehwal, while talking about her upcoming biopic starring Shraddha Kapoor, said, "As far as I have seen Shraddha preparing for it, she has done really well...I am sure it is turning out well." Saina added that the biopics on sportspersons motivate her a lot. "I am sure people would like to know my story as well," she further said.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Man arrested for cheating Amazon of ₹30 lakh by taking refunds
body: Twenty-seven-year-old Mohammed Mahuwala was arrested in Indore on Wednesday for allegedly cheating e-commerce giant Amazon of nearly ₹30 lakh. Mahuwala was a member of a gang who ordered costly gadgets from Amazon. "[They] used to get refund of the amount paid...by saying the parcel...was empty. In reality, these devices were taken out from parcel and sold...to local shopkeepers," said police.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: IKEA Hyderabad resells veg biryani 5 months after caterpillar found
body: Swedish home furnishing retailer IKEA's Hyderabad store began selling vegetarian biryani at its store from Thursday, five months after it was taken off the menu after a caterpillar was found in the item by a customer. The dish is now being made in-house and sold for ₹99 like in the past. The dish was earlier being sourced from Nagpur's Haldiram's.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Every dog has its day: ICC CEO Richardson on NZ's win over India
body: Reacting to New Zealand\'s eight-wicket victory against India in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday, ICC CEO David Richardson said, "Every dog has its day." India were bowled out for 92 runs, while New Zealand chased down the target with 212 balls remaining. India lead the five-match series 3-1, with the final match scheduled to take place on Sunday.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: 14-year-old son found FaceTime bug a week ago, claims mother
body: A 14-year-old US boy's mother claims he found Apple's Group FaceTime call bug over a week before it went viral while setting up call to play Fortnite with his friends. Grant Thompson's mother said she tweeted about the bug on January 21 but didn't receive a response from Apple. FaceTime Group calls were disabled by Apple pending a software update.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Kerala businessman spends ₹31 lakh on number for his Porsche car
body: Kerala businessman named KS Balagopal has spent ₹31 lakh including reservation fee to buy the number 'KL-01-CK-1' for his Miami Blue-coloured Porsche 718 Boxster car. Balagopal, the Managing Director of Devi Pharma, placed the winning bid for the auction of the number which started from ₹500. Kerala RTO officials said this is the costliest car number in the state.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Ex-NZ captain Brendon McCullum calls time on BBL career
body: Former New Zealand captain Brendon McCullum announced that he is set to end his Big Bash League (BBL) career and that Friday\'s match against Melbourne Stars might be his last BBL match. "I\'ll continue to play T20 cricket in 2019 in various competitions around the world and will then look to transition into a coaching career," said Brisbane Heat\'s McCullum.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Small plane crashes into a house in US' California; 5 killed
body: A small plane crashed into a single-family home in US' California on Sunday, killing the male pilot, who was the only person in the plane, and all four occupants of the house. The plane had caught fire mid-flight before crashing into the two-storey house. An aviation accident investigator said that debris was scattered over four blocks.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Isha Ambani features on February cover of Vogue magazine
body: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani's daughter Isha Ambani has featured on the cover of the February edition of Vogue India. She's dressed in a white shirt dress and black ruffled skirt by Australian designer Toni Maticevski, while accessorising her look with a Misho ring. In the cover story on her, Isha has spoken about her work and life after marriage.\n
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: I want my old life back: German woman who joined ISIS at 15
body: A German woman who joined militant group Islamic State at the age of 15 has said, "I want to go back to Germany to my family, because I want my old life back. Now I know that it was a big, big mistake." Leonora, who fled the jihadists\' last bastion in eastern Syria, added, "I was a little bit naive."
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Delhi techie wins free food from Swiggy for one year on CRED
body: Kunal Shah's credit card bill payment platform, CRED, gave users a chance to win free food from Swiggy for one year. Pranav Kaushik, a Delhi techie, bagged this reward after spending 2000 CRED coins. Users get one CRED coin per rupee of bill paid, which can be used to avail rewards from brands like Ixigo, BookMyShow, UberEats, Cult.Fit and more.
author: Roshan Gupta

headline: Snake found in khichdi served to govt school students in Maharashtra
body: Students of a government primary school in Maharashtra's Nanded were served khichdi with a snake in it, officials said on Thursday. The school staff members saw the snake in a large vessel while serving khichdi to around 80 students studying in Classes I to V. Nanded District Education Officer (DEO) Prashant Digraskar said that a probe has been ordered.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Paytm Mall cuts down cashbacks by over 80% across categories
body: Paytm\'s e-commerce unit \'Paytm Mall\' has cut down cashbacks by over 80% across categories to build "stronger O2O (online-to-offline) business model". Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said they would direct cashbacks from warehouses to physical stores. He said, "Most brands...are well distributed across thousands of cities...while warehouse inventory...is concentrated in top 20 to 30 cities only".
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Don't use visit to ailing man for political gains: Goa CM to Rahul
body: Goa CM and ex-Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar has written a letter to Congress President Rahul Gandhi over his claim that Parrikar told him he has nothing to do with new Rafale deal. Parrikar wrote, "Kindly do not use your visit to an ailing person to feed political opportunism." In their five-minute meeting, they didn\'t discuss anything about Rafale, he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: If Kolkata police chief mulls destroying evidence, he'll regret: SC
body: CJI Ranjan Gogoi has said, "If Kolkata Police Commissioner even remotely thinks of destroying evidence, bring the material before this Court. We will come down so heavily on him that he will regret." Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar is alleged to have destroyed evidence in the Saradha chit fund cases. The SC will hear CBI\'s plea against Rajeev on Tuesday.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Girl photobombs minister speaking outside Parliament, shows tongue
body: A picture of a girl photobombing Minister of State Jayant Sinha as he speaks on the Interim Budget 2019-20 outside the Parliament has gone viral. In a video, she can be seen showing her tongue more than twice standing behind Sinha as he speaks to the media. "The government always presented a good budget, this year\'s no different," Sinha said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: N Korea unlikely to give up nuclear weapons: US intelligence chief
body: North Korea is "unlikely to completely give up its nuclear weapons and production capabilities", Director of US\' National Intelligence, Daniel Coats, said. "North Korean leaders view nuclear arms as critical to regime survival," he added. His statements come despite North Korea\'s agreement with the US at the Singapore summit last year to denuclearise the Korean Peninsula.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Rapper 21 Savage faces deportation from US
body: Rapper 21 Savage faces deportation from the US after authorities claimed he is British and staying in the US illegally. The rapper, whose real name is Sha Yaa Bin Abraham-Joseph, was arrested over accusations that he had overstayed his visa by more than a decade. He was convicted on felony drug charges in the US state of Georgia in 2014.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Ranveer, Alia shot for Gully Boy in slums for 25 days: Report
body: Actors Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt have shot in the slums of Mumbai for around 25 days for their upcoming film \'Gully Boy\', as per reports. "All the combined sequences of Ranveer and Alia have been shot at the open area of slums in Mumbai," stated reports. Directed by Zoya Akhtar, the film also stars Kalki Koechlin and Ali Asgar.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Twitter testing news-first timeline feature on Android
body: Micro-blogging platform Twitter is testing a new feature on Android to put news on the top of a user\'s timeline. "With this update, we’re making it easier for people to see news and stories their followers have been discussing," Product Manager Walter Gurzynski said. The feature comes alongside a prompt saying, "Catch up on what\'s happened while you were away."
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Govt will launch National Artificial Intelligence Portal: FM
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday announced that the government will soon launch a National Artificial Intelligence Portal. Presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 in the Lok Sabha, Goyal added that nine priority areas have been identified for the development of the AI sector in the country. Reportedly, about 200 AI startups in India are creating AI-based solutions for various industries.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Gujarat govt asks Ola, Uber to start electric taxi services
body: The Gujarat government has asked ride-hailing services like Ola and Uber to start electric vehicle services. The state energy department, led by Gujarat's Energy Minister Saurabh Patel, is working on creating a policy to provide required infrastructure to mass-run electric vehicles. Patel said recharge stations with charged batteries will be available in a manner similar to existing petrol pumps.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: 2-yr-old kidnapped by woman in Gurugram, rescued within 5 hrs
body: A two-year-old toddler was allegedly kidnapped by a woman while playing outside his house with his 11-year-old sister in Gurugram on Tuesday morning. The woman took the toddler to her home after lying to his sister that someone was calling her inside the house. Meanwhile, the police rescued the toddler within five hours and arrested the woman.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: 8 Asian billionaires aged over 90, including Mistry, control $125bn
body: Eight Asian billionaires aged 90 or above on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index of world's 500 richest people have a combined net worth of $125 billion. The richest among them is Hong Kong's Li Ka Shing with a net worth of $30.5 billion. India's 90-year-old Pallonji Mistry, who controls 18.3% of Tata Sons through Shapoorji Pallonji Group, is worth $20.1 billion.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: New Leh Airport terminal will cost ₹480 crore: AAI Chairman
body: Airports Authority of India (AAI) Chairman Guruprasad Mohapatra on Sunday said the new terminal at Leh Airport will be built at a cost of ₹480 crore. The construction of the terminal building is expected to be completed by September 2021, he added. Earlier in the day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi had laid the foundation stone for the Leh Airport terminal.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: In tit-for-tat move, Russia suspends nuclear arms treaty with US
body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the country will follow US example and withdraw from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty within 6 months. He added that Russia will design new intermediate-range weapons. The 1987 arms control pact bans both the US and Russia from stationing short- and intermediate-range land-based missiles in Europe.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Triple Talaq bill gives our Muslim daughters equality: Prez
body: Highlighting steps taken for women during a joint session of Parliament on Thursday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "Our Muslim daughters were living under constant fear. The Triple Talaq bill gives them equality, lets them live without fear." He claimed the government had generated jobs for women and increased maternity leave, making it easier for young mothers to keep working.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: You're my husband's numero uno: Sonali wishes Abhishek on b'day
body: Wishing Abhishek Bachchan on his 43rd birthday on Tuesday, Sonali Bendre retweeted her husband Goldie Behl\'s tweet and wrote, "You\'re my husband\'s numero uno! After all these years, I\'ve come to terms with it." "Happy birthday, AB! Thanks for always having our backs," she further wrote. Goldie had shared a black and white picture with Abhishek while wishing him.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Match 50% EVM votes with paper trails: Opp'n parties to EC
body: Leaders of several opposition parties on Monday demanded the Election Commission to ensure that 50% of EVM results are matched with Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trails  (VVPATs). The leaders also told the poll panel that people doubted the efficacy of EVMs and this issue needs to be redressed. The poll panel had earlier reiterated that it won't revert to ballot papers.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: 3 dead after avalanche hits snow-clearance team in J&K
body: At least three people were killed on Friday after an avalanche hit a snow-clearance team in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam area. The incident reportedly happened after their snow clearing machine was buried under the avalanche. While two of them were declared brought dead, the third person \nsuccumbed to his injuries later.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: It's a lie: Vishal Dadlani criticises PM's claim of hanging rapists
body: Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani criticised PM Narendra Modi\'s statement claiming rapists are "hanged within three days, seven days, 11 days and a month" under his administration. "LIE! Name one rapist who has been hung in your term, Sir. Nirbhaya\'s rapists...even Unnao child-rape-accused BJP MLA Sengar are...alive and well," he wrote. PM Modi made the comment at a Surat youth conclave.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Naidu a U-turn CM, won't take him back in NDA: Shah
body: BJP President Amit Shah on Monday called Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu a "U-turn chief minister". "When Atal Bihari Vajpayee became the PM, Naidu joined the NDA, but left it in 2005 after the NDA government fell in 2004," he added. Shah further said that "all doors to the NDA are closed for Naidu. We will not take him back".
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: 2nd meeting of PM-led panel to select CBI chief also inconclusive
body: The second meeting of Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led selection committee to appoint the new CBI chief remained inconclusive as well, officials said on Friday. The three-member committee also includes Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi and Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge. M Nageswara Rao has been working as the Interim Director of the CBI.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: I consider Kedar Jadhav a proper spinner: Rohit Sharma
body: Rohit Sharma, who was the stand-in captain in the last two ODIs against New Zealand, has said he considers Kedar Jadhav as a proper spinner. "Every game...he bowls at least four-five overs...and gets a wicket...at the crucial time," Rohit added. The 31-year-old further said when Team India plays four seamers, Jadhav gives the balance by being the second spinner.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Body found in wreckage of plane carrying Argentine footballer
body: A body has been found in the wreckage of plane carrying missing 28-year-old Argentine footballer Emiliano Sala and 59-year-old pilot David Ibbotson, Air Accidents Investigation Branch has confirmed. The wreckage of the missing plane was found in the English Channel on Sunday, hours after underwater search was launched. The plane had vanished over the English Channel on January 21.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Archery board not in list of recognised national federations
body: The Archery Association of India (AAI) does not figure in the Sports Ministry's list of recognised national federations after the annual renewal despite the AAI holding fresh elections under a new constitution. The AAI's elections were initially not recognised by its international parent body, World Archery, but the results were later accepted by them.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Kalank's wrap-up felt like a big loss: Aditya Roy Kapur
body: Aditya Roy Kapur, while talking about his upcoming film \'Kalank\', said that the film\'s wrap-up felt like a "big loss". "It doesn\'t happen with every film but on this one, Varun [Dhawan], Alia [Bhatt], Sonakshi [Sinha] and I got along well," added Aditya. Directed by Abhishek Varman, the film also stars Madhuri Dixit and Sanjay Dutt.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Welfare of 129 students detained in US top priority: Sushma Swaraj
body: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj has assured that "welfare" of the 129 Indian students detained in the US is the "highest priority" for her team. The US authorities arrested Indians in an undercover operation and called it a "pay-to-stay" scheme, where foreign students knowingly enrolled in a fake school to falsely maintain their student visa and illegally obtain work permits.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: DHFL shares plunge 16% following reports of govt probe
body: Dewan Housing Finance (DHFL) shares on Thursday fell 16% after reports said the government has launched a probe into the company's alleged fund diversion. A media report accused DHFL's controlling shareholders, the Wadhawans, of diverting funds worth ₹31,000 crore, including loans from state-run banks, to shell firms. The company, however, said it hasn't received any communication from government.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Fashion brand H&M hires Facebook data scandal whistleblower
body: Swedish multinational fast-fashion brand Hennes & Mauritz AB (H&M) has hired Christopher Wylie, the whistleblower who exposed Facebook's Cambridge Analytica data scandal. Wylie’s focus will be to help get better insights on customers, products and markets and support work on sustainable and ethical artificial intelligence, H&M spokesperson said. Wylie is a former employee of Cambridge Analytica.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Hindu temple vandalised in US in hate crime
body: A Hindu temple has been vandalised in Kentucky, US, in what authorities called a hate crime. Vandals sprayed black paint on the deity, wrote hateful messages on temple walls and broke windows at the temple. A knife was also left stabbed into one of the chairs in the main room of worship at the temple.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Ex-policeman used police database to look up Tinder dates; jailed
body: A former Australian police officer has been jailed for six months for illegally accessing the personal details of almost 100 women to determine if they were "suitable" Tinder dates. Adrian Moore, once a nominee for police officer of the year, has also been fined AU$2,000 for possessing videos and images of women engaged in sexual acts with dogs and horses.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Dhoni runs away from Yuzvendra Chahal to not appear on 'Chahal TV'
body: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal was seen chasing wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni to get him to appear on his chat show 'Chahal TV', which is regularly uploaded on the BCCI's official website, following India's 4-1 ODI series victory. However, Dhoni ran away from Chahal, waved him goodbye and went towards the dressing room. Chahal then interviewed Rohit Sharma for this show.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Aadhaar optional for 1st transfer of ₹2,000 to farmers: Govt
body: The government has said the Aadhaar number of small and marginal farmers will be optional for the first instalment of ₹2,000 under the recently launched direct cash transfer scheme. Aadhaar is, however, compulsory for subsequent transfers. Finance Minister Piyush Goyal had in Interim Budget announced income support of ₹6,000 per year to farmers holding cultivable land up to 2 hectares.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Pharma exec gave doctor a lap dance to sell medicine in US: Witness
body: Former stripper and regional sales director of a pharmaceutical company, Sunrise Lee, gave a doctor a lap dance in a nightclub to persuade him to prescribe an addictive fentanyl spray in 2012, the company\'s sales representative told a US court. She said she saw Lee "sitting on [doctor\'s] lap, kind of bouncing around." Lee has been accused of bribing doctors.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Man buys flat in MP, finds 6-month-old dead body hidden in bed box
body: A man found a body hidden in a bed box in a flat that he had bought in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh. The flat was locked since June last year and the owners from whom the man had bought the flat have not been seen since that time. Forensic officials said the body had been lying there for six months.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Mamata a super nautanki master: Union Minister Giriraj Singh
body: Commenting on West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee\'s dharna following the standoff between CBI officials and Kolkata Police, Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Tuesday called Mamata a "super nautanki master". "She knew everything...did this drama to give a jolt to opposition groups," he added. He further said that a CM on dharna with a police commissioner is "misfortunate" for India\'s democracy.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Venezuela Prez Maduro proposes early elections amid political crisis
body: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has proposed early elections for the National Assembly, which is dominated by the opposition and led by Juan Guaido, who proclaimed himself legitimate head of state last week. Maduro said the government-controlled Constituent Assembly would debate calling elections early for the National Assembly. The parliamentary elections are scheduled for 2020.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Indian man in US smuggled 400 people, took up to ₹60 lakh from each
body: A 60-year-old Indian man has pleaded guilty for his role in a conspiracy to smuggle individuals from India to the US for profit. Yadvinder Singh Bhamba personally assisted around 400 individuals to unlawfully enter the US between 2013 and 2015. Individuals paid between $30,000 (over ₹20 lakh) and $85,000 (over ₹60 lakh) to be smuggled from India to the US.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Posters depicting Rahul as Lord Ram vandalised in Patna
body: A group of unidentified miscreants on Friday vandalised posters depicting Congress President Rahul Gandhi as Lord Ram in Patna. The incident occurred hours after a complaint was filed against Rahul and several others for allegedly hurting religious sentiments. The posters were captioned, "They\'ll keep chanting Ram\'s name! While you live like Ram!!"
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: People with 'negative mindset' quizzing pro-poor schemes: PM
body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said the people with 'negative mindset' are questioning him and his government for floating pro-poor schemes. He added negative mindset people are raising doubts about schemes such as building toilets and providing free gas connections to the poor. He further said that negative mentality laced with a vested interest still exists in the country.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Drug trafficker evades capture for 15yrs using fingerprint implants
body: A drug trafficker who managed to evade capture for 15 years by cutting and burning the skin of his fingertips and having it replaced with micro-implants has been arrested by Spanish police. Police officials said he also had a hair transplant to avoid being recognised, adding he had used very sophisticated methods to alter the fingerprints of both hands.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Was so consumed with work mom used to mail 'Are you alive?': Nargis
body: Actress Nargis Fakhri has revealed during the time she was working in India, she was so consumed with work that her mother used to mail her \'Are you alive?\' "I only worked all the time. I didn\'t even have my friends and family around," she added. "I value my work but now also I value my regular life," said Nargis.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: I was crazy, insecure, pregnant: Tahira on low phase of marriage
body: Opening up on the low phase of their marriage, Ayushmann Khurrana\'s wife Tahira Kashyap said, "I was this crazy, insecure, pregnant person when \'Vicky Donor\' happened. That was the worst phase." "I [was] crazy on my hormones because I was pregnant," she added. Earlier, Ayushmann revealed the onscreen kiss in \'Vicky Donor\' caused trouble in his marriage for three years.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Canada cuts Cuba embassy staff by half after mystery illness
body: Canada will cut its embassy staff in Cuba by up to half after another worker fell ill with mysterious symptoms, Canadian authorities said on Wednesday. A total of 14 Canadians have been affected by the mystery illness which causes dizziness, nausea and hearing loss, among others. Canada recalled the families of diplomatic staff over the mystery illness in April 2018.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Govt cuts UIDAI allocation for FY20 by 8.7% to ₹1,227 crore
body: The government has cut allocation for UIDAI by 8.7% to ₹1,227 crore for 2019-20 as against ₹1,345 crore in FY19. The UIDAI requires money for operations like replacement of old hardware and for IT systems, UIDAI CEO Ajay Bhushan Pandey said. Accordingly, we made an estimate of the amount required and received full support from the Finance Ministry, he added.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Remains of '1st British beer' dating back over 2,000 years found
body: Remains of the first beer believed to be brewed in the UK, dating back over 2,000 years, has been discovered by road workers in Cambridgeshire, England. Fragments of charred residues from the beer-making process revealed signs of the 'Iron Age brew' from around 400 BC. The beer residues were found along with those of bread and porridge, experts revealed.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Huawei Mate20 Pro wins 2 awards at TOI Gadgets Now Awards
body: Huawei Mate20 Pro has won two awards at the Times of India Gadgets Now Awards. It was awarded the honorary titles of the 'Best Innovative Smartphone of the year' and 'Best Camera Smartphone of the Year' under the Jury and People Choice category respectively. Additionally, it has won over 11 awards across outlets like 91mobiles, Digit, Stuff, MKBHD, Android Headlines.
author: Roshan Gupta

headline: India now without a single unmanned railway crossing on broad gauge
body: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced that all unmanned level crossings on broad gauge network of Indian Railways have been completely eliminated. Goyal added that 2018 was the safest year in the history of Indian Railways. He further announced that ₹64,587 crore has been allocated for Railways in FY20.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Actor Karanvir Bohra detained in Russia over passport damage
body: Television actor Karanvir Bohra, who flew to Russia on Tuesday to attend a film festival, has been detained in Moscow due to passport damage. "They [are] contemplating to deport me back to India," the actor wrote on Twitter. The Indian embassy in Russia\'s capital responded to his tweet and said that they were looking into the issue.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Comparisons to PM Modi are an insult to Indira Gandhi: Rahul
body: Congress President Rahul Gandhi has called comparisons between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi "an insult to Indiraji." Rahul said, "My grandmother\'s decisions came from love and affection... Modi\'s decisions come from anger and hatred and his decisions divide the country." He further claimed that unlike PM Modi, Indira had cared for the poor in India.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Anna Hazare calls off fast after 7 days following meet with Maha CM
body: Anti-corruption activist Anna Hazare called off his fast on Tuesday after meeting Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. He had been protesting against the delay in the appointment of a Lokpal at the Centre and Lokayuktas in the states since January 30. Fadnavis said the state will set up a joint drafting committee to prepare a new Lokpal Bill.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Mani Ratnam wanted me to do 'Raavan': Shah Rukh Khan
body: Revealing that he was offered Mani Ratnam\'s 2010 film \'Raavan\', Shah Rukh Khan said, "[Mani] wanted me to do \'Raavan\'. But I was caught up then. Also, it was bilingual. I found it difficult to do that." \'Raavan\' eventually starred Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan. The film also starred Govinda, Ravi Kishan, Vikram and Nikhil Dwivedi.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: 8 held for helping foreigners stay illegally in US as students
body: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement has arrested eight persons, all of whom are either Indian nationals or Indian-Americans, on charges of fraudulently facilitating hundreds of immigrants to illegally remain in the US as students. The accused, in exchange of cash, helped the foreigners in illegally obtaining immigration documents from a university and creation of false student records.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: 6 killed as 9 coaches of Seemanchal Express derail in Bihar
body: Six people were killed and several others were injured after nine coaches of the Delhi-bound Seemanchal Express derailed in Bihar on Sunday. The superfast train was reportedly running at full speed when the accident occurred. A team of doctors has been sent to the site and an accident relief train has also moved for carrying out relief and rescue operations.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Govt implemented new FDI norms in haste: Flipkart
body: US retail giant Walmart-owned Flipkart has said it is disappointed with the government\'s decision to implement the revised e-commerce rules in "haste". The company added that it remains committed to compliance "despite the significant work required to change supply chains and systems". The company remains confident that it will continue to serve its customers and sellers well, it further said.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Yami Gautam trips during her ramp walk at Lakmé Fashion Week
body: Actress Yami Gautam nearly tripped during her ramp walk at the Lakmé Fashion Week Summer/ Resort 2019. The actress, who was the showstopper for designers Gauri and Nainika, was wearing a tulle gown. When asked about how she managed, the actress said after the show, "It just comes\nfrom the fact that you can know it can happen with anyone."
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Please get well soon: Angad Bedi to journalist who fat shamed Neha
body: Actor Angad Bedi questioned Pakistani journalist Hina Khurram\'s upbringing for highlighting his wife and actress Neha Dhupia\'s weight gain after pregnancy. "A woman to fat shame another woman who...just delivered a baby throws a lot of light on your upbringing. Please get well soon," he tweeted. "Fashion Central...this is the maximum mileage you\'ll ever get," he further wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Alphabet to make shoes that can detect wearer's fall: Report
body: Google parent Alphabet's life sciences division Verily has reportedly been seeking partners to co-develop smart shoes that could detect its wearer's fall. The sensor-equipped shoes will measure user movement and weight, the report added. Last year, Apple added fall detection feature to its Watch Series 4 that calls emergency services if it detects no movement for a minute after fall.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Ola raises ₹115 crore from nine investors in Series J round
body: Ride-hailing startup Ola has raised nearly $16 million (₹115 crore) in funding from nine foreign investors in its ongoing Series J round, as per regulatory filings.
