The funding reportedly values the Bengaluru-based startup at about $6 billion. The investors will be issued a total of 53,024 shares as part of this round, the filings stated.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: When people tell me to exercise, I want to say f**k you: Vidya Balan
body: Vidya Balan has revealed that she has suffered from hormonal problems since childhood, saying, "There was a period when the more I\'d work out, the more I\'d put on." "When people tell me why don\'t you start exercising, I want to say f**k you!" added Vidya. The actress further said she has worked hard at accepting her body despite criticism.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Smith, Warner will play huge part in winning Ashes: Tim Paine
body: Australian captain Tim Paine said that suspended cricketers Steve Smith and David Warner will play a huge part in Australia\'s effort to win the Ashes against England later this year. "We know how good they are and hopefully once their bans are up they\'ll be welcomed back and they will win Test matches like they did before," Paine added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Being back on set after major sabbatical is surreal: Sonali
body: Sonali Bendre, who is currently in Mumbai, shared her photo and video on Instagram and wrote, "Being back on a set after a major sabbatical...is a surreal feeling." "After all this...I\'m so grateful to be back in action," wrote Sonali who has been undergoing treatment for \'high grade\' cancer in New York for the last few months.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Malayalam actor Thulasi surrenders over anti-women remark
body: Malayalam actor Kollam Thulasi surrendered before the police on Tuesday and has been arrested for his remarks against women's entry in Sabarimala. A case was filed against the actor after he said that women who try to enter Sabarimala should be ripped apart. The actor surrendered almost a month after Kerala High Court rejected his appeal for anticipatory bail.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Ex-Chattisgarh CM Ajit Jogi, son booked over bypoll fixing
body: An FIR has been registered against five people, including former Chhattisgarh CM Ajit Jogi, his son Amit and former PWD Minister Rajesh Munat, in connection with the Antagarh tapes case. The audio tapes had purportedly revealed that the 2014 Antagarh assembly bypoll, which was won by BJP, was fixed. The FIR was filed following a complaint by a Congress leader.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Priest falls after garlanding 18-foot Lord Anjaneyar idol, dies
body: A 53-year-old priest in Namakkal Anjaneyar temple in Tamil Nadu died after he slipped and fell down from an 11-foot-high platform after garlanding 18-foot-high Lord Anjaneyar statue, officials said. The priest was critically injured and was hospitalised on Sunday but he succumbed to his injuries on Tuesday. An official claimed such an incident has not happened in the temple's history.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Plot, treason by Nissan executives led to my arrest: Ghosn
body: Ousted Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn has said his arrest over alleged financial misconduct was led by "plot and treason" by the Japanese carmaker\'s executives who opposed its deeper integration with Renault and Mitsubishi. Ghosn added he had discussed the integration plans with Nissan\'s CEO in September, a month before his arrest. He further said he wouldn\'t flee if granted bail.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Windies beat England in a Test series for 1st time in 10 yrs
body: The Windies beat the visiting English side in the second Test to clinch the Test series, their first against England after a gap of ten years. Kemar Roach, who finished with match figures of 8/82, was named Player of the Match. Both the teams are set to play the third and final Test of the series from February 9.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Mom was upset over inviting just 200 guests at my wedding: Priyanka
body: Priyanka Chopra, during her appearance on \'The Ellen DeGeneres Show\', revealed her mother Madhu Chopra was upset about inviting just 200 guests at her wedding with American singer Nick Jonas. Priyanka added, "She was like, \'I need to have another party for the other 1,50,000 people that I know!" "Usually Indian weddings [have] a thousand people," Priyanka explained to Ellen.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: UP government directs officials to barcode stray cows
body: Uttar Pradesh government has asked officials to barcode stray cows and set up temporary cow shelters at unused government buildings. The shelters can be established at cooperative institutions and at institutes of the Central government which have been lying closed, a government order read. It also suggested Radio-Frequency Identification (RFID) technology to be used to scan the barcodes. \n
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Fiscal deficit hits 112.4% of FY19 target in April-December
body: India's fiscal deficit in April-December 2018 stood at ₹7.01 lakh crore or 112.4% of the budgeted target for the current financial year. The gap between the government's revenue and expenditure had stood at 113.6% in December 2017. The government had in the Interim Budget revised the fiscal deficit for 2018-19 at 3.4% of the GDP from 3.3% earlier.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Sonam Kapoor to star opposite Akshay in Sooryavanshi: Report
body: Sonam Kapoor will star opposite Akshay Kumar in Rohit Shetty's 'Sooryavanshi', as per reports. Earlier, there were reports that Pooja Hegde and Katrina Kaif had been approached to star opposite Akshay who will reportedly be seen portraying the character of an Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) officer in the film. Rohit had later denied the reports of Katrina starring in the film.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: India won't be easy to beat in World Cup: ICC CEO David Richardson
body: Talking about chances of teams in the 2019 Cricket World Cup, ICC CEO David Richardson said that it is extremely difficult to pick a winner. "England have got their best ODI team in many years. South Africa have also performed. But the progress India have made in the recent years, it will be exceptionally difficult to beat them," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Bihar Cabinet approves 10% general category quota
body: The Bihar Cabinet on Friday approved the 10% reservation in government jobs and educational institutes for economically weaker section in the general category in the state. The government would table a new bill regarding the implementation of the quota in the coming budget session. The cabinet meeting chaired by CM Nitish Kumar also passed 58 agendas placed before it.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Sensex rises 665 points a day before Interim Budget
body: Indian equity benchmark Sensex recorded its best single-day gains of 2019 a day ahead of Interim Budget, rising 1.87% or 665 points to 36,257 on Thursday. Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank and Infosys were among the top gainers. This will be the last Budget presented by the Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led government before the general elections.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Not taken seriously by govt: Stats body chief quits over jobs data
body: The only two non-government members of National Statistical Commission (NSC), including its acting chief PC Mohanan, have resigned and cited government withholding the release of employment survey data for 2017-18 as one of the reasons. "We felt the commission wasn\'t being taken seriously...Some of the decisions of the [NSC] weren\'t also considered. We thought we were being sidelined," Mohanan said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: FB paid some users $20 a month to access their data: Report
body: Facebook has been paying some users up to $20 a month since 2016 to install VPN app 'Facebook Research' to access their private data, according to a TechCrunch report. The program, that targets users aged 13-35 years through ads, reportedly accessed private messages, search history, and Amazon order history. Facebook said it'll remove the app's iOS version, the report added.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: 73-yr-old wins round-the-world sailing race after 212 days at sea
body: French sailor Jean-Luc Van Den Heede on Tuesday won the round-the-world yacht race after 212 days alone at sea without modern instruments. The 73-year-old, who completed his sixth circumnavigation of the globe, became the oldest to complete the 30,000-mile Golden Globe race. Of the 19 sailors who started out last July, only five were still in the race on Tuesday.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Went to Rao's daughter's wedding: Judge exits interim CBI head case
body: Justice NV Ramana on Thursday recused himself from hearing a petition challenging the appointment of IPS officer M Nageshwar Rao as CBI interim director, saying, "Rao is from my home state and I have attended his daughter\'s wedding." After CJI Ranjan Gogoi and Justice AK Sikri, Justice Ramana is the third judge to withdraw from hearing the case.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Flickr deletes photos of free accounts going over new limit
body: Photo and video-hosting platform Flickr on Tuesday started deleting photos and videos of free account users that cross its newly imposed storage limit of 1,000 items. The platform, which previously offered storage capacity of 1TB to free account users, will reportedly be deleting items starting from the oldest first. Flickr was acquired by US-based photo storage service SmugMug in 2018.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Smriti Mandhana becomes world number one women's ODI batter
body: Indian women's cricket team opener Smriti Mandhana has become the top-ranked batter in women's ODI cricket, as per the latest rankings released by the ICC. The 22-year-old moved up three spots in the batters' rankings to reach the top spot. In the 15 ODIs Smriti has played since the beginning of 2018, she has scored two centuries and eight half-centuries.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Akash, I were born via IVF 7 yrs after parents' marriage: Isha Ambani
body: Mukesh Ambani\'s 27-year-old daughter Isha Ambani said she and her twin brother Akash Ambani were born through IVF process, seven years after their parents\' marriage. "When my mother (Nita Ambani) finally had us she wanted to be a full-time mum initially," said Isha. "She resumed work when we were five, but she was still a tiger mom," Isha added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: After LS polls, people will close doors for BJP: Naidu
body: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu said, "After the general elections, the people of India will close the doors for the BJP." Naidu said this in reference to BJP President Amit Shah\'s statement that "all doors to the NDA are closed for Naidu." “Who asked him to open that door? Did I ask him or beg him?" Naidu further said.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: WI pacer bats hours after mother's death, gets standing ovation
body: Pacer Alzarri Joseph came out to bat for Windies on third day of the second Test against England on Saturday, just hours after his mother Sharon passed away due to a prolonged illness. Players of both teams wore black armbands as a mark of respect and the crowd gave the 22-year-old a standing ovation when he came out to bat.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Facebook agrees to share user chat details with Delhi Police
body: Facebook has agreed to share 'Messenger' chat details in sensitive cases, especially those involving women and children, Delhi Police said. Police personnel told Facebook that while probing some kidnapping for ransom cases, they need to scan victim's chats to gather clues, an officer said. Facebook was also requested to provide IP register, mobile numbers and emails, as per officials.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Arbaaz to make Kannada film debut with Patralekhaa: Reports
body: Actor Arbaaz Khan will make his debut in the Kannada film industry with actress Patralekhaa with the action-comedy film 'Where is my Kannadaka?', as per reports. The actor will reportedly essay the role of a security chief in the film. Arbaaz has previously featured in several Telugu films, including 'Jai Chiranjeeva' and 'Kittu Unnadu Jagratha'.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: 19-year-old Shubman Gill becomes India's 227th ODI cricketer
body: Batsman Shubman Gill has become the 227th cricketer to represent India in ODI cricket, achieving the feat against New Zealand in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday. The 19-year-old received his maiden ODI cap from former captain MS Dhoni. Notably, Shubman was named Player of the Under-19 World Cup in New Zealand last year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: 129 Indian 'students' arrested in US 'pay-to-stay' immigration scam
body: US authorities have arrested 129 Indian nationals enrolled at a fake university in a "pay-to-stay" immigration scam as of Thursday. Prosecutors said the students knew the programme was not approved by the government and intended to fraudulently maintain their student visa status to obtain work permits. The individuals would be kept in custody and face deportation pending immigration court verdict.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas' is evident in the Budget: PM Modi
body: Talking about the Interim Budget 2019-20, PM Narendra Modi said that the BJP\'s vision of "Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas" is evident in the budget. "It has something for every section of the society," he added. "The Budget will empower the poor, give a boost to farmers and an impetus to economic growth," PM Modi had said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Why send notices to those serving tea, Mamata asks PM Modi
body: After her close aide Manik Majumdar was quizzed by CBI, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee claimed Prime Minister Narendra Modi was "compelling" his officers to send notices to humiliate opposition leaders. Accusing the Centre of making the fight personal, she added, "These people...only carry out instructions." She further asked, "How can you send notices to even those who serve tea?"
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: UN monitors say North Korea protecting nuclear missiles
body: UN monitors have said North Korea is protecting its nuclear and ballistic missiles, adding that sanctions against the nation were proving ineffective. This comes ahead of the second summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. North Korea has said it'll never unilaterally give up its nukes unless the US first removes any threat to it.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Giving farmers ₹17 a day an insult: Rahul Gandhi to PM on Budget
body: Congress President Rahul Gandhi alleged that five years of PM Narendra Modi\'s "incompetence and arrogance" destroyed the lives of farmers and that giving them ₹17 a day is an insult to everything they stand and work for. This comes after Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced income support of ₹6,000 per year to farmers owning up to 2 hectares of land.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: World's fourth richest person gets $4.3 billion richer in a day
body: Louis Vuitton owner LVMH's Chairman Bernard Arnault, the world's fourth-richest person, added $4.3 billion to his fortune on Wednesday. Shares of his Paris-based luxury-goods maker surged 6.9%, the most since mid-2016, after its fourth-quarter profit beat estimates. Arnault's wealth has surged $8.3 billion since the start of the year and now stands at $76.9 billion, according to Bloomberg.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Timely resolution by NCLT can free up ₹67,000 cr: Report
body: Conclusion of cases under the bankruptcy law by the NCLT within 180-270 days mandated by law can release up to ₹67,000 crore to lenders, rating agency ICRA said. Of the 1,484 cases that have been sent to NCLT since 2016, 898 are yet to be resolved, it added. Out of this, 31% have exceeded the 270-day timeline, it further said.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: MISA detainees are not freedom fighters: Chhattisgarh CM
body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has said that Maintenance of Internal Security Act (MISA) detainees are "not freedom fighters" and they should not get a pension. The state government on Tuesday ordered all Commissioners and District Collectors to put on hold disbursement of pension for MISA detainees from February onwards. The government also ordered their physical verification.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Man sues Avengers actress Gwyneth for ₹22 crore over ski crash
body: A 72-year-old man named Terry Sanderson has sued 'Avengers' actress Gwyneth Paltrow for allegedly crashing into him while skiing, and is seeking $3.1 million (over ₹22 crore) in damages. The lawsuit states the actress got up and skied away after knocking the man down, leaving him with broken ribs. The incident reportedly took place in 2016 in Utah, US.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Man sets himself on fire in auto while travelling with 2 others
body: A 24-year-old man in Delhi allegedly set himself on fire after pouring petrol on himself while travelling in an auto-rickshaw with his cousin and a co-passenger. Police said it appears he took the step after he fought with his girlfriend over phone. He suffered 70% burns and his cousin sustained 20% burns while the third passenger escaped with minor injuries.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: #MeToo movement is being misused: Jaya Prada
body: Speaking about the #MeToo movement in India, actor-turned-politician Jaya Prada said, "#MeToo is being misused at a lot of places." "I\'ve always maintained a special three-bench should be in place to scrutinise and find out the truth. That’s the best way for the movement,” Jaya added. She further said that her sympathies are with the victims of sexual harassment.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: CBI has got to do its job or not: Sitharaman to Opposition
body: Taking a dig at the Opposition, Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "CBI has got to do its job or not?" "When CBI does its job, opposition parties call it a political vendetta, when it doesn\'t, they call it a caged parrot," she added. This comes after Kolkata Police detained the CBI team that raided Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar\'s residence.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: IDBI Bank posts loss for ninth straight quarter at ₹4,185 cr
body: Public sector lender IDBI Bank on Monday posted a widening of loss by nearly threefold to ₹4,185 crore, its ninth straight quarterly loss. The lender's provision for bad loans increased to ₹5,075 crore as against ₹3,637 crore a year ago, impacting its profitability. The net interest income, or core income, also fell 18.5% year-on-year to ₹1,357 crore.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: OnePlus India poses question for Siri on social media
body: OnePlus India on Wednesday took to social media platforms to pose a question to Apple\'s voice-controlled personal assistant Siri after OnePlus emerged as the No.1 premium smartphone brand in India for Q4 2018 in research by Counterpoint. The post read, "Hey Siri, which is India\'s No.1 Premium Smartphone?", carrying the caption "iDare you".
author: Roshan Gupta

headline: With 290% growth in blockchain jobs, IIIT-B launches PG Program
body: India houses the second largest pool of blockchain developers in the world with over 20,000 developers while the blockchain industry is witnessing a 290% increase in job growth rates with salary hikes of around 50-100%. Learners can now become a certified blockchain developer with IIIT-Bangalore & upGrad's PG Certification in Blockchain Technology taught by experts from IBM, BankChain, SpringRole, SquadX.
author: Roshan Gupta

headline: Unemployment on rise due to PM Modi's 'pakordanomics': Sibal
body: Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Thursday said, "rate of unemployment...has increased" because of "(PM Narendra) Modiji\'s pakordanomics". "In other countries we have heard people being encountered, but in our country data is being encountered," he added. This comes after two members of National Statistical Commission resigned, saying government withheld release of employment survey data, 2017-18.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Krish wanted to come back, wasn't welcomed: Manikarnika actress
body: Actress Mishti, who featured in \'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi\', said the film\'s co-director Krish wasn\'t "welcomed back" when he offered to complete the patchwork for the film. Mishti further said that Krish had completed shooting for the film before he left to pursue another project. Kangana Ranaut was credited as co-director of the film after Krish\'s departure.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Detained refugee who wrote book using WhatsApp wins top prize
body: Behrouz Boochani, a refugee in Papua New Guinea (PNG), has won Australia's top literary prize for his book 'No Friend But the Mountains: Writing from Manus Prison', which he wrote on his mobile phone and delivered it to a translator through WhatsApp. Under Australia's policy, asylum seekers who come by boat are processed at offshore centres in PNG and Nauru.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: I can make jeans and a T-shirt look like couture: Kareena
body: Kareena Kapoor Khan said that most of the time she wears jeans and a T-shirt, adding, "I can make jeans and a T-shirt also look like couture." "I know I have that...I can...It\'s just that I don\'t like dressing up," she further said. Kareena also said that her sister Karisma Kapoor is "more of a fashion icon" between the two.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Govt allocates ₹1,330 crore for empowerment, protection of women
body: The government has provided ₹1,330 crore for the empowerment and protection of women in the Interim Budget for 2019-20. Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said allocation for the National Education Mission is being increased from ₹32,334 crore in FY19 to ₹38,572 crore in 2019-20. Allocation for Integrated Child Development Services Scheme will be increased to ₹27,584 crore in FY20, he added.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Uzbekistan lifts ban on teaching Political Science
body: Uzbekistan has lifted the ban on teaching Political Science, according to a decree issued by President Shavkat Mirziyoyev. The subject was entirely banned in 2015 under the regime of President Islam Karimov reportedly on the grounds that it is a western pseudoscience that does not take into account the "Uzbek model" of development.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Zee promoters get 8 months from lenders to clear debts
body: Zee Entertainment's promoter Essel Group on Monday said its lenders have agreed to give the Subhash Chandra-led group time till September 30 to pare its debt. This provides the required amount of time to complete the strategic sale of its key assets, it added. At the group level, Essel has total debt of around ₹17,174 crore.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: UP ministers took dip in Sangam to wash their sins: Rajbhar
body: Uttar Pradesh minister Om Prakash Rajbhar on Wednesday took a dig at the state cabinet ministers who had gone to take a holy dip in the Sangam, saying that they were washing off their sins in the river. Rajbhar alleged that corruption in the present government was four times more than what it was during the SP and BSP governments.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Canada serial killer admits to murdering 8 men
body: A serial killer in Canada has pleaded guilty to killing eight men, most of whom were linked to Toronto's Gay Village neighbourhood. Police had found the remains of seven men in planters at a property where 67-year-old Bruce McArthur worked as a landscaper. The cases allegedly involved sexual assault or forcible confinement and the bodies were dismembered.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: London 2012 gold-winner among 12 Russians banned for doping
body: London 2012 Olympic Games high jump champion Ivan Ukhov is among 12 Russian track and field athletes to be handed doping bans by the Court of Arbitration for Sport. Ukhov and Svetlana Shkolina, who won high jump bronze in 2012 and gold at the 2013 world championships, were given four-year bans on Friday and will be stripped of their medals.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Humne kamar tod mehengai ki kamar tod di: FM Piyush Goyal
body: While delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20 on Friday, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said, "Humne kamar tod mehengai ki kamar tod di." When we took over inflation was as high as 10.1%, we brought it down to 2.19%, Goyal added. He further said that the country had witnessed the fastest GDP growth in the last five years.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: UP govt fined ₹25L by NGT for failing to keep Ganga Canal clean
body: The National Green Tribunal has imposed a penalty of ₹25 lakh on Uttar Pradesh government for its failure to stop the discharge of dirty water into Upper Ganga Canal. The tribunal's order comes after a local resident filed a plea alleging that Niwari Nagar Panchayat had illegally constructed a drainage system to Upper Ganga Canal belonging to UP irrigation department.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: India win 4 matches in an ODI series in New Zealand for first time
body: India defeated New Zealand by 35 runs in the fifth ODI at Wellington on Sunday to win the five-match ODI series 4-1. This was the first time India won four matches in an ODI series in New Zealand. India's previous best performance in an ODI series in New Zealand had come in 2009, when they won the five-match series 3-1.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Co-creator of painkiller ibuprofen Dr Stewart Adams dies at 95
body: British chemist Stewart Adams, who discovered that painkiller ibuprofen worked when he cured his own hangover has died aged 95, his family said. Dr Adams studied pharmacy at the University of Nottingham before joining Boots Pure Drug Company in 1952. His team trialled various compounds over the next 10 years, before discovering 2-(4-isobutylphenyl) propionic acid, licensed in 1969 as ibuprofen.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: India 3rd team to beat NZ in 4+ ODIs in a bilateral series in NZ
body: India became only the third team to defeat New Zealand in four or more ODIs in a bilateral series in New Zealand. India managed their only second bilateral ODI series win in New Zealand after the MS Dhoni-led Indian side had registered a 3-1 series win in 2009. India will now play a three-match T20I series against New Zealand.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Would love to play mom's part in 'Aaina', 'Chameli Ki...': Sara
body: Talking about the roles of her mother and actress Amrita Singh that she would love to play, Sara Ali Khan said, "I would love to play her role in \'Chameli Ki Shaadi\'...[and] \'Aaina\'." "I don\'t think I can do anything that mom has done...[In \'Aaina\ she wasn\'t the leading lady, [but] she was so damn powerful," added Sara.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: IIT Madras team generates lasers from alcohol-cooked carrots
body: A team of IIT Madras researchers has found that biocompatible lasers could be generated from carrots cooked in ethanol (alcohol). The team found that optically active pigments carotenoids present in carrots gave them lasing properties. A carrot's carotenoid concentration  was increased by cooking it in alcohol and light was then pumped through it to produce laser, a researcher said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Ben Affleck confirms quitting his role as 'Batman'
body: Hollywood actor Ben Affleck has confirmed that he has quit the role of superhero character \'Batman\'. He shared an article titled \'Ben Affleck passes the torch to next generation of Bruce Wayne\'. "Excited for #TheBatman in Summer 2021 and to see [director] Matt Reeves\' vision come to life," Affleck tweeted. \n\n
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Rohit Sharma becomes 14th Indian cricketer to play 200 ODIs
body: Stand-in captain Rohit Sharma has become the 14th Indian cricketer to play 200 ODIs, achieving the feat after taking the field against New Zealand in fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday. The 31-year-old had made his ODI debut on June 23, 2007, against Ireland in Belfast. Rohit scored 7,799 runs in his first 199 ODIs at an average of 48.14.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: SP-BSP MLAs throw paper balls, planes at UP Governor in Assembly
body: Members of Samajwadi Party and BSP threw paper planes and paper balls at Uttar Pradesh Governor Ram Naik during his speech in the state Assembly on Tuesday. Naik was giving the speech on the first day of the Budget Session, when the opposition members raised slogans like "Rajyapal Wapas Jao (Governor Go Back)". CM Yogi Adityanath has condemned the act.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Will quit politics when PM Modi decides to retire: Smriti Irani
body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Sunday said, "The day \'pradhan sevak\' Narendra Modiji decides to hang his boots, I\'ll also leave Indian politics." "I take pride in the fact that I got an opportunity to work with charismatic leaders like Atal Bihari Vajpayeeji and Modiji," she added. She asserted that PM Modi will stay in politics for many more years.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: India fastest highway developer, 27 km highway built each day: FM
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal while presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 on Friday said that India is the world's fastest highway developer with 27 kilometres of highway being built each day. The Sagarmala project will help faster handling of import and export cars, added Goyal. The domestic passenger traffic has increased two-fold in the last five years, he further said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Video: Biker injured after TN policeman hits motorcycle with lathi
body: A man in Tamil Nadu's Thiruvallur was injured after a policeman hit his bike with a lathi after he reportedly failed to stop for a check on Friday. CCTV visuals showed the man losing control and falling off his bike. The biker didn't file a complaint as the officers on duty received punishment from the department, a police official said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Defence Ministry clears ₹40,000 cr project for 6 submarines
body: The Defence Acquisition Council on Thursday approved an over ₹40,000-crore project to build six advanced submarines for the Navy. It also approved the acquisition of 5,000 Milan 2T anti-tank guided missiles for the Army. The project would be executed under the Strategic Partnership (SP) policy, under which Indian companies will build the boats in India in partnership with foreign manufacturers.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Akhtar not criticising but personally attacking me: Sarfaraz Ahmed
body: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed has said that former fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar was not criticising but personally attacking him over the four-match ban handed to him by the ICC over his 'Abey Kaale' remark on South Africa's Andile Phehlukwayo. Akhtar had said that Sarfaraz's comments were unacceptable and that he had gotten off easily with a four-match suspension.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Rahul Gandhi promises farm loan waiver across the country
body: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said if the Congress came to power in the Centre, the party will announce farm loan waiver across India. Addressing a rally in Bihar's Patna, Rahul criticised the Interim Budget announcement of ₹6,000 minimum annual income support to farmers. He said the BJP can forgive the loans of the industrialists, but not the farmers.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Ban on Students Islamic Movement of India extended for 5 yrs
body: The Centre on Thursday banned the Students Islamic Movement of India (SIMI) for a period of five more years starting February 1 under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. It said the organisation was indulging in activities “prejudicial to the security of the country” and disturbing peace and communal harmony. The Home Ministry also listed 58 cases where SIMI members were involved.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Trainee aircraft crashes near Pune, pilot injured
body: A trainee aircraft of Carver Aviation, a pilot training institute, on Tuesday crashed near Indapur in Maharashtra's Pune. The incident has left a trainee pilot injured and the aircraft was completely damaged after the incident. The pilot was immediately rushed to the nearby hospital in Baramati.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: SBI fixes glitch that may have exposed banking data of users
body: State Bank of India has said that a "misconfiguration" in the services of telecom providers has been fixed and denied of any data breach from its end. "Customer data is safe and secure and SBI is fully committed to ensuring this," SBI added. This comes after TechCrunch reported SBI had secured a passwordless server "overnight" after it alerted the bank.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: We were not underdogs: Shastri on India's series win in Aus
body: Giving the reason behind comparing India\'s Test series win in Australia to India\'s 1983 World Cup-triumph, Ravi Shastri said, "Test cricket is the purest form and we came to Australia as heavyweight champions... home and away." "We were not favourites... But we were not underdogs to come and surprise them [Australia] either," Shastri added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Vijay Shankar gets run-out after mix-up with Ambati Rayudu
body: Indian all-rounder Vijay Shankar got run-out after getting into a mix-up with Ambati Rayudu during the fifth ODI against New Zealand on Sunday. Shankar hit the ball towards mid-on and tried taking a single, but non-striker Rayudu was looking at the ball and did not respond to Shankar's call. Shankar fell short of his maiden international half-century by five runs.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: I'm for Ram Mandir, what is Rahul Gandhi's stand: Amit Shah
body: Addressing BJP workers during his Dehradun visit, BJP President Amit Shah said, "(Congress President) Rahul Gandhi should clear his stand on Ayodhya. I can say without a doubt that Ram Mandir will be built there." Accusing Congress of trying to stall the case whenever it goes to court, Shah added, "Don\'t have any doubts, we\'ll make the temple in Ayodhya."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Why were you so serious: Amit Shah to Opp'n after Interim Budget
body: Taking a dig at the Opposition after the Interim Budget was presented in the Parliament, BJP President Amit Shah said, "I didn\'t understand why you were so serious. You were not able to smile." "Congress President\'s (Rahul Gandhi) face lost its glow during the budget presentation," Shah added. He also praised the budget as being "all-inclusive".
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Anything can happen till polls are declared: Bihar CM on WB row
body: Talking about the confrontation between CBI and Kolkata police, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said, "Till the Election Commission announces the dates of elections, anything can happen in the country." He added, "These things can only be explained by people who are doing it." "Nobody is concerned about the country. All are interested in votes," he further said.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: India has bid to host the Hockey World Cup in 2023
body: The International Hockey Federation (FIH) announced on Tuesday that India is among the group of six countries that have presented bids to host the next edition of the Hockey World Cup. India has proposed to conduct the event for either men or women in the January 13 to 29, 2023 window. India has hosted the men's World Cup thrice.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Pakistan holds 'keys to war': Afghanistan
body: Afghan President Ashraf Ghani has said the "keys to war" are in Pakistan\'s Islamabad, Quetta and Rawalpindi, accusing the country of providing safe havens to militants, including those belonging to the Taliban. Ghani added the "key to peace was in Afghanistan". His comments came amid the talks between the US and the Taliban to end the 17-year war in Afghanistan.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Founders tell me 'Madam, please don't send us to court': SBI MD
body: India\'s largest lender SBI\'s Managing Director (MD) Anshula Kant has said the first thing company founders tell when they come to the bank is, "Madam, please don\'t send us to NCLT". If the founder is "genuine we don\'t want him to lose the company", Kant added. She also said that one-time settlements are a "preferred choice" if founders have funding.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Insurance agent 'Lord Voldemort' jailed for threatening clients
body: A Singapore-based insurance agent has been jailed for two years and five months for threatening to harm his clients unless they paid him in bitcoins. The 36-year-old set up an email account, and signed the messages as 'Lord Voldemort', a fictional character from the Harry Potter series. Ye Lin Myint targeted about 33 people, including those who cancelled insurance policies.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Pujara challenges 'coolest chachu' Unadkat to babysit his daughter
body: Cheteshwar Pujara jokingly challenged Saurashtra captain Jaydev Unadkat to babysit his daughter Aditi after the latter asked him if he was her "coolest chachu (uncle)". Unadkat had posted a picture with Aditi on Twitter, writing, "Chachu to my Laddoo! Growing cuter everyday...Probably the coolest chachu ever." "Will only agree if you manage to babysit her for...couple of hours!" Pujara responded.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: ISRO unveils Bengaluru centre for manned space mission
body: The Indian Space Research Organisation on Wednesday unveiled Human Space Flight Centre in Bengaluru for its ₹10,000-crore manned space mission 'Gaganyaan' scheduled for 2021. ISRO said the centre will be responsible for development of engineering systems for crew survival in space and crew selection and training. It'll also pursue activities for sustained human space flight missions, ISRO added.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: 73 Indians arrested in Sri Lanka this year for visa violations
body: A total of 73 Indians have been arrested in Sri Lanka this year for staying beyond their visa term, Sri Lankan officials said. While 49 Indian nationals were arrested on Saturday from a factory in Matugama, 24 Indians were arrested last month. Those arrested would be sent back to India after completing necessary formalities, officials added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Venezuela to ship $840 million gold to Russia: Report
body: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro's administration is planning to ship 20 tonnes of gold worth nearly $840 million to Russia amid the political crisis, lawmaker José Guerra claimed. He added a Russian jet arrived from Moscow to take away the gold reserves. This comes after the US imposed sanctions on Venezuela's state-run oil company to put pressure on the Maduro regime.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: 2 seat cushions from 'missing plane carrying footballer' found
body: Investigators searching for a lost plane carrying Argentine forward Emiliano Sala found two seat cushions on French coast that "likely" belonged to the aircraft. The investigators said they\'ll now launch an underwater seabed search for aircraft wreckage. The Cardiff City footballer was travelling from France\'s Nantes to Wales\' Cardiff when his plane disappeared over English Channel on January 21.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: India summons Pakistan envoy over call to separatist leader
body: India on Wednesday summoned Pakistan\'s High Commissioner, Sohail Mahmood, to protest against Pakistan Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi\'s phone call to separatist leader Mirwaiz Umar Farooq from the All Parties Hurriyat Conference. Qureshi\'s "actions are tantamount to direct interference in the internal affairs of its neighbour", the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said in a statement.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: 4-yr-old picks gun kept under mattress by father, shoots pregnant mom
body: An eight-month pregnant mother was shot in the face by her four-year-old son in the US state of Washington. The child found the loaded unsecured gun under a mattress after his father hid it there because he was afraid of a recent crime in the neighbourhood. She was taken to a hospital with life-threatening injuries, however her condition has improved.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Veteran Marathi actor Ramesh Bhatkar dies of cancer at 70
body: Veteran Marathi actor Ramesh Bhatkar passed away on Monday aged 70 after battling cancer for over one and a half years. During his career, spanning over 30 years, the actor starred in several Marathi films and television series including 'Aai Pahije' and 'Commander'. The actor also featured in Hindi films like 'The Accidental Prime Minister' and 'Bhavesh Joshi Superhero'.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Gay girl is still regular girl: Sonam on 'Ek Ladki...' role
body: Sonam Kapoor, while talking about her character in \'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga\', said, "It was important to show her as simple and ordinary because a gay girl is still a regular girl." Sonam added that the makers didn\'t want to stereotype her character. The film revolves around the relationship between a father and a daughter.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: You're perceived good actor only if you give ₹100-cr hit: Nawazuddin
body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has said that today it is being perceived that actors are "good actors" only if they give ₹100-crore hit films. "I don\'t care about box office. If I did, I would\'ve done song and dance films," Nawazuddin said. "I feel I should start doing films where there\'s comedy with a \'tadka\' of content," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: SL's Kusal Perera forced to retire hurt after bouncer blow
body: Sri Lankan batsman Kusal Perera was forced to retire hurt after a bouncer struck the side of his helmet in the second Test against Australia in Canberra. This is the second instance of a Sri Lankan batsman getting struck by a bouncer in the match. Earlier, Dimuth Karunaratne was struck on the neck by a bouncer from Australia's Pat Cummins
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: China probe wakes after 1st lunar night, records -190ºC temp
body: Chinese probe Chang'e 4, the first to land on the Moon's far side, has woken up after its first lunar night, China's space agency said. The probe had switched to dormant mode during lunar night due to lack of sunlight, according to Chinese state media. It recorded temperatures as low as -190ºC on the lunar surface, lower than previously expected.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Man goes to bank in Spider-Man costume on last working day in Brazil
body: A bank employee in Brazil went to work dressed in a Spider-Man costume on his last working day, pictures and videos of whom have gone viral on the internet. A picture shared by a co-worker showed him lying across a desk in the superhero costume. Its caption read, "Last day of work and this person is driving the boss mad."
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Anil, Sonam's 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga' leaked online
body: Anil Kapoor and Sonam Kapoor starrer 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga', which released on Friday, has been leaked online by piracy site TamilRockers. Also starring, Juhi Chawla and Rajkummar Rao, the film is directed by Shelly Chopra Dhar. Earlier, 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi', 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' and 'Why Cheat India' were also leaked by TamilRockers.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Can die peacefully as both my babies have their babies: Jeetendra
body: Talking about the birth of his daughter Ekta Kapoor\'s son Ravie Kapoor, Jeetendra said, "I can die peacefully now as both my babies have their own babies." "Was a dada earlier. Now, I have become a nana. My life\'s complete," he added while referring to his son Tusshar Kapoor\'s son Laksshya. Ekta\'s son was born via surrogacy on January 27.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: 12 killed, 170 injured in Saudi Arabia floods
body: At least 12 people have been killed and 170 others have been injured in Saudi Arabia this week due to flooding from heavy rain. The emergency services rescued 271 people from the flooded areas, more than half of them in Tabuk. Heavy rains hit mainly western and northwestern parts of Saudi Arabia, near its border with Jordan.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Ravana pushed sister Surpanakha into war, Rahul did same: BJP MLA
body: BJP MLA Surendra Singh on Wednesday compared Congress President Rahul Gandhi and his sister, Priyanka Gandhi, to \'Ravana\' and \'Surpanakha\' from Ramayana. "Just how Ravana pushed his sister Surpanakha in the war ahead of him, Rahul Gandhi has pushed his sister (Priyanka) in the fray...We are blessed with a leader like (PM) Narendra Modi," Singh said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Do heroines think revealing attire will bring work? Balasubrahmanyam
body: Singer SP Balasubrahmanyam, while criticising actresses for wearing \'revealing\' clothes, questioned, "Should their behaviour be taken as an act of innocence? Or do they think that only if they wear revealing outfits will heroes and directors give them opportunities?" "These days, actresses don\'t know what kind of dress they should wear for film events...We\'ve reached an all-time low," he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: 1,000 kg banned plastic seized from Saravana Bhavan in Chennai
body: Tamil Nadu food safety officials on Wednesday raided and seized 1,000 kgs of banned plastic items from Hotel Saravana Bhavan in Chennai's Vadapalani. Officials began a surprise check in the branch at 8 am. The state government had banned single-use plastics from January 1 and said the banned items should be handed over at the offices of the city corporation.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Jailed former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif shifted to hospital
body: Pakistan\'s jailed former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was shifted to the hospital on Saturday, his daughter Maryam Nawaz said. Pakistan\'s Punjab government ordered to move Sharif to the hospital "in view of (his) multiple co-morbidities and complex cardiac history". The order came following the recommendation by a six-member medical board to shift the former Prime Minister to hospital.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: ICICI fires Chanda Kochhar, to take back bonuses paid in last 9 yrs
body: Retired Justice Srikrishna's enquiry panel has found that ex-CEO Chanda Kochhar violated ICICI Bank's code of conduct. The bank said it'll treat Kochhar's exit as termination and will take back all bonuses paid to her from April 2009 until March 2018. The CBI recently filed a case against Kochhar, her husband, and Videocon MD in the ICICI-Videocon loan case.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Shraddha criticised for cultural appropriation in Ratnani's shoot
body: Shraddha Kapoor has been criticised over cultural appropriation for wearing a Native American headdress in a shoot by Dabboo Ratnani. The shoot is part of Ratnani\'s 2019 calendar launched on Monday. Calling out Shraddha, Instagram page Diet Sabya wrote, "The \'controversy\' is part of a wider effort by Native American activists to highlight the ongoing cultural genocide against indigenous peoples."
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: 19-yr-old girl held for raping another woman with sex toy in Delhi
body: Delhi Police have arrested a 19-year-old girl on charges of 'raping' another woman with a sex toy, under Section 377. It's reportedly the first such case after the 377 verdict in September last year. The accused was produced in Karkardooma Court where the police were granted a day to interrogate her and was sent for judicial custody in Tihar jail.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Trial in Sunanda Pushkar death case to begin on February 21
body: Delhi's Patiala House Court has sent the death case of Sunanda Pushkar, wife of Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, to Sessions Court for trial. The trial in the case, in which Tharoor is facing abetment to suicide and cruelty charges, will begin from February 21. The court also dismissed BJP MP Subramanian Swamy’s plea to assist the court in the matter.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Grateful that people still accept me with open arms: Juhi
body: Juhi Chawla has said she\'s grateful that even after three decades in the film industry the audience still accepts her with open arms. "Acting is all I know. I don\'t know what I\'d be doing other than this," Juhi added. The actress further said that she\'s "always excited" to work with a director who has a good story to tell.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: UAE used 'Karma' tool to spy on rivals' iPhones: Report
body: Some former US government intelligence operatives working for the UAE hacked into iPhones of activists, diplomats and rival foreign leaders by exploiting an Apple iMessage flaw with 'Karma' tool, Reuters reported. The flaw reportedly allowed for implantation of malware through iMessage, even if the phone's owner didn't use it. 'Karma' hacked targets with a single text message, the report said.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Volkswagen retains top spot in global sales, beats Toyota
body: German automaker Volkswagen Group has retained the car industry's top spot in global sales, beating its Japanese rival Toyota. Volkswagen's sales, including its MAN and Scania heavy trucks and buses, rose 0.9% to 10.83 million in 2018, the company had said. Toyota came second with around 10.6 million deliveries, including its affiliated brands Daihatsu and Hino, in 2018.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Mamata Banerjee is like demoness Taadka: Haryana Minister
body: Haryana Minister Anil Vij on Sunday took to Twitter to compare West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to demoness Taadka from Ramayana. He tweeted "saints used to perform Yagya and Taadka used to interrupt them. Mamataji is doing the same." This comes after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath\'s chopper was denied permission to land in the state ahead of a rally.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: PM Modi stops speech after cameraman faints, asks officers to help
body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stopped his speech at the inauguration of the new terminal building at Surat airport after observing that a cameraman had fainted. PM Modi then asked his officers to urgently arrange for an ambulance for the cameraman. "It\'s good that PM was paying attention to his surroundings during his speech," the cameraman later said from a hospital.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Why scared if you have done nothing wrong: PM Modi to Mamata
body: PM Narendra Modi has said the Mamata Banerjee-led West Bengal government is so perturbed by his "anti-corruption" actions, that it isn\'t allowing probe agencies to come to Bengal. "Didi is afraid...If you haven\'t done anything wrong, there is no reason to be afraid," he added. "The ground below her feet...moves even if BJP president comes to Bengal," he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Aapna time aayega: 19-yr-old Prithvi Shaw on recovery from injury
body: Opener Prithvi Shaw, who is recovering from an ankle injury, took to social media to share a few lines inspired from \'Apna time aayega\' rap from upcoming Bollywood film \'Gully Boy\'. "Aapna time aayega...Injury se fit hoke...Mein aur run banayega...Aapna time aayega," he wrote. The 19-year-old had sustained the injury in the tour match in Australia in November last year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Cyclists sleep on stadium floor instead of hotel over costly cycles
body: Cyclists taking part in National Track Cycling Championship in Jaipur opted to sleep on the floor inside the stadium instead of hotels over expensive cycles. The organisers had booked hotels but they didn't have the provision for cyclists to keep their bikes inside. A national gold medallist said their cycles cost between ₹5-9 lakh and once damaged, they become non-repairable.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Police officer probing Paytm extortion case arrested for extortion
body: Noida Police has arrested Sector 20 station in-charge Manoj Pant and three journalists for allegedly extorting money from a call centre owner for removing his name from an FIR. The four were caught while taking bribe money of ₹8 lakh, police said. Pant was the lead investigator in the Paytm extortion case involving Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma's secretary Sonia Dhawan.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Kolkata Police chief among 'best in world': Mamata Banerjee
body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday said the Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar, wanted for questioning by the CBI, is among the "best in the world". She added, "He is working 24x7, and was on leave for only one day recently." The BJP is misusing power to take control of the police and destroy all institutions, she said.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Facebook loses permission to run staff-only iOS apps: Report
body: Social media giant Facebook has reportedly lost permission to build or run employee-only applications on Apple's iOS. This comes after a TechCrunch report found Facebook paid some users up to $20 a month to access their private data through 'Facebook Research' app. Facebook had allegedly exploited a loophole in Apple's approval system to bypass the rules that banned data harvesting.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Got positive vibes from PCB that I'll captain Pak in WC: Sarfaraz
body: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed, who was banned for four matches over his \'Abey Kaale\' remark on South Africa\'s Andile Phehlukwayo, said he has got "positive vibes" from PCB that he will captain Pakistan in 2019 World Cup. "My nature won\'t ever change...I do captaincy like that, I talk a lot behind the stumps," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: UN court judge quits over interference from US
body: A judge has resigned from the UN\'s International Criminal Court (ICC) citing "shocking" interference from the US and Turkey. The judge, Christoph Flügge, alleged Turkey used its veto to end the tenure of a Turkish judge. He further cited threats by the US, particularly NSA John Bolton, who had warned the judges against investigating alleged US war crimes in Afghanistan.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: You'll leave White House stained with blood: Venezuela Prez to Trump
body: Stating that Donald Trump is pursuing a "dirty" imperialist conspiracy to overthrow him, Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has said that the US President will leave the White House "stained with blood". "Stop. Stop, Trump! Hold it right there! You are making mistakes," Maduro added. Notably, the US has recognised Venezuela\'s opposition leader Juan Guaidó as interim President.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Only jumlas will come out: Congress leader on Interim Budget
body: Ahead of the Interim Budget being presented by Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday morning, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said, "Only jumlas will come out today." He added, "Budgets they have presented so far have not really benefitted the general public. They have only 4 months, when will they implement the schemes?"
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: EU rules Gibraltar is 'colony' of Britain
body: The European Union (EU) has ruled in a proposed regulation that Gibraltar is a "colony of the British Crown" following Spain\'s insistence. Spain has long been in dispute with Britain over the control of Gibraltar. The proposed EU regulation allows British citizens visa-free travel to EU, even if Britain leaves the bloc without a deal.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: MIT researchers train robot arm to play 'Jenga' game
body: MIT researchers have developed a robot arm that can play the 'Jenga' game by combining the abilities of both sight and touch. The robot, equipped with a force sensor on its wrist and an external camera, probed the blocks to understand which are harder or easier to move. It grouped outcomes of about 300 attempts to learn to play 'Jenga'.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Mourinho fined for tax fraud in Spain in lieu of jail time
body: Former Real Madrid manager Jose Mourinho has accepted a one-year prison sentence for defrauding the Spanish state of €3.3 million, a Spanish court filing showed on Tuesday. The 56-year-old Portuguese, who will not serve any jail time, has agreed to exchange the 12-month prison sentence with a daily fine of €250 for 24 months.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Extreme cold kills over 20 in US polar vortex
body: More than 20 people have been killed in the extreme cold since the polar vortex hit the US earlier this week. Over 200 cases of frostbite and hypothermia have been reported in the country. Businesses and schools were closed and rail and air services were affected as a result of the polar vortex.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Former IPS officer of West Bengal Bharati Ghosh joins BJP
body: Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, who was once said to be close to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, on Monday joined the BJP. "The BJP family continues to grow in West Bengal. I welcome former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh to the party," BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya tweeted. Ghosh is also under the Criminal Investigation Department\'s scanner for criminal conspiracy.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: China to provide $2.5 billion loan to Pakistan: Report
body: China will provide a loan of $2.5 billion to Pakistan to boost its foreign exchange reserves, a local media report quoting Pakistan government officials said. China had last year deposited $2 billion in the State Bank of Pakistan, according to reports. Pakistan has also secured financial assistance from Saudi Arabia and the UAE.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: US thieves try to steal TV, return it as it didn't fit in car
body: Two thieves in Texas, US, took back a flat-screen television inside a house after it did not fit in the vehicle that they had stolen. The entire incident which took place earlier this month was caught on camera on the home surveillance system. The suspects remain at large and authorities have urged the public to help identify them.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Deposit ₹10 crore, then go abroad: SC to Karti Chidambaram
body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday asked Karti Chidambaram to deposit ₹10 crore with the court registry as a precondition to his travelling abroad in February and March. The apex court further asked him to appear before the Enforcement Directorate in March regarding the Aircel-Maxis and INX Media cases. Karti had sought permission to travel abroad for various tennis tournaments.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Last we saw fast extradition it was Batman, now it's PM Modi: BJP
body: BJP has compared PM Narendra Modi to Batman after extradition of AgustaWestland scam accused Deepak Talwar and Rajeev Saxena from Dubai. "Last time we saw such swift extradition, it was Batman extraditing Lau from Hong Kong and delivering him to Jim Gordon. \'Everything\'s impossible until somebody does it\'. This time it\'s PM Narendra Modi," the party tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Bigg Boss 11 winner Shilpa Shinde joins Congress
body: Actress Shilpa Shinde, who won Bigg Boss 11 last year, joined the Congress party on Tuesday. The 41-year-old, known for playing the role of 'Angoori Bhabhi' in 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai', joined the party in the presence of Mumbai Congress chief Sanjay Nirupam. Shilpa will reportedly contest for the party in the upcoming Assembly elections.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: There's more to cancer than being called a survivor: Sonali
body: Sonali Bendre, on the occasion of World Cancer Day on Monday, shared her picture and wrote, "There\'s more to cancer than being emotional or weak or even being called a fighter or a survivor." "I urge you all to take the time to understand it...find out what works for you and to be diligent about your treatment," she further wrote.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Chris Hemsworth wishes Shamita on her b'day, actress shares video
body: Actress Shamita Shetty, who turned 40 on Saturday, took to Instagram to share a video of Hollywood actor Chris Hemsworth wishing her on the occasion of her birthday. She wrote in the caption, "Ok this really made my bday!!!" The video was originally shared by child actor Rudhraksh Jaiswal, who has worked with Hemsworth in the web series \'Dhaka\'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Michael Schumacher's son asks media to remove fake family photos
body: Seven-time Formula One champion Michael Schumacher\'s son Mick Schumacher took to Twitter to clarify that three widely circulated images supposedly showing him or his sister Gina with their father, are fake. The 19-year-old tweeted that the pictures don\'t feature him or Gina and appealed to "all media" to remove them. "I\'m sorry for the people in these photos," he wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: I don't think anyone can even touch them: Rajkummar Rao on Khans
body: Rajkummar Rao has said it would not be right to compare his stardom with that of Shah Rukh Khan, Aamir Khan and Salman Khan. "I don\'t think anybody can even touch them. They\'ve been here for many, many years. I love them immensely," he added. "We\'re very new and we have a long way to prove ourselves," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Woman Shiv Sena leader cheated of ₹9 lakh in Thane
body: A woman Shiv Sena leader has been allegedly duped of over ₹9 lakh by four persons in Maharashtra's Thane, police said. She needed a loan for which two of the accused offered her help demanding ₹60,000 as their charge but failed to arrange the loan. The other two accused sought ₹8.5 lakh but they too failed to arrange the loan.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: No tax on income up to ₹5 lakh, proposes government
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal has proposed zero tax for individual taxpayers having an annual taxable income of up to ₹5,00,000. Around 3 crore middle-class taxpayers are expected to benefit from this, he said. Goyal has also proposed to increase the standard deduction for salaried taxpayers from ₹40,000 to ₹50,000 during the Interim Budget 2019-20 speech.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Kya josh tha: Piyush Goyal praises 'Uri' during Interim Budget
body: While presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal praised Vicky Kaushal starrer \'Uri: The Surgical Strike\' and said, "I had the opportunity to watch the film recently. Kya josh tha, kya mahaul tha."  The film is based on the 2016 surgical strike carried out by the Indian Armed forces on terror hubs in Pakistan.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Pilot dies after Mirage trainer jet crashes at B'luru's HAL airport
body: A pilot died after Mirage 2000 trainer fighter aircraft of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) crashed at the HAL Airport near Bengaluru on Friday. The two pilots inside the aircraft had ejected, but one of them died as he had reportedly landed on the wreckage of the aircraft. HAL has confirmed that the jet developed a technical snag.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: If I don't get an award, that award is at loss: SRK
body: While speaking about winning awards for his films, Shah Rukh Khan said, "If I don\'t get an award, that award is at a loss." "Sometimes, the prestige of an award increases when I receive it," the actor jokingly added. Shah Rukh further said that he was "extremely ambitious" but in a "fair manner".
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Tech Mahindra reports 28% rise in Q3 profit at ₹1,203 crore
body: Software services exporter Tech Mahindra on Tuesday reported a 28% year-on-year rise in its December-quarter profit at ₹1,203 crore. The Anand Mahindra-led company's revenue from operations jumped 15% to ₹8,944 crore as against ₹7,776 crore in the corresponding quarter the previous year. The firm's revenue from its IT service unit was up 14.4% from the year-ago period at ₹8,190 crore.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Sinkhole in Florida turns out to be secret tunnel leading to bank
body: A sinkhole in Florida, US turned out to be a 46-metre secret tunnel leading to a local bank, said the FBI. It wrote in a tweet that it was treating the case as an "attempted bank burglary." "The only thing I\'ve ever seen like this is in the movies. This is truly a unique case here," an FBI agent said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Google CEO Pichai's rating goes down in annual staff vote: Report
body: Google's annual internal survey has shown growing dissent for CEO Sundar Pichai among the company's 90,000-strong workforce, as per Wired magazine. On being asked if employees had confidence in Google's future under Pichai, 74% said 'yes', 18 percentage points less than 2017's poll. A vote on Pichai's decisions and strategies saw a 75% positive response, as opposed to previous 88%.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: 99% I-T returns accepted without scrutiny last year
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal while delivering the Interim Budget revealed that 99.54% of all I-T returns filed last year were accepted without scrutiny. Goyal added there had been 18% increase in direct tax collections in 2017-18. He further said direct tax collections increased from ₹6.38 lakh crore in 2013-14 to almost ₹12 lakh crore this fiscal.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Bodo outfit head gets life term for 2008 Assam blasts that killed 88
body: A special CBI court in Guwahati has awarded life sentence to National Democratic Front of Bodoland founder and chief Ranjan Daimary and nine others in connection with the 2008 Assam serial blasts, which killed 88 people. Around 11 bombs went off across Assam in the attacks that took place almost a month before 26/11 Mumbai attack.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Indian Oil third-quarter profit plunges 91% to ₹717 crore
body: The country's largest fuel retailer Indian Oil Corporation on Wednesday reported a 91% year-on-year decline in its net profit at ₹717 crore for the December quarter. The fall in profit came amid increased expenses which stood at ₹1.6 lakh crore and rise in foreign exchange loss. The company's domestic sales increased 2.8% from the year-ago period to 21.545 million tonnes.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: BJP to meet CEC over WB govt blocking its rallies: Reports
body: A BJP delegation will reportedly meet the Chief Election Commissioner on Monday to protest against West Bengal government for blocking its rallies in the state. Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will reportedly be part of the delegation. This comes after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's chopper was denied permission to land at Balurghat, where he was scheduled to address a rally.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Haryana CM delivers speech in Tamil amid Pongal celebrations
body: A video showing Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar delivering a speech in Tamil during Pongal celebration in the state has gone viral on social media. BJP Tamil Nadu youth wing vice-president SG Suryah, who shared the video, mentioned Tamil was Haryana's second official language for 40 years but in 2010 Congress CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda replaced the language with Punjabi.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Robber steals ₹16,700 in coins after failing to break bank lockers
body: An unidentified person, who broke into the Maheshwari Udyan branch of Dena Bank in Mumbai on Saturday, had to flee with ₹16,700 in coins. "The man tried to break...lockers, but could not and so stole coins of ₹1 and ₹2 from drawers of the cashier," said police. The theft was discovered when employees came in for work on Saturday morning.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: SBI left banking data of millions of users unprotected: Report
body: A TechCrunch report has claimed that India’s largest bank SBI secured a passwordless server "overnight" on being alerted it allowed anyone to access phone numbers, bank balances, and transactions of millions of its customers. The Mumbai-based server was containing two months of data from SBI Quick, an SMS and call-based system used to request basic information about accounts, TechCrunch revealed.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: I had 2000 lambs, I'm vegan not due to love for animals: Chhetri
body: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri has said he has gone vegan not because of his love for animals. "After eating 2,000 lambs I can\'t say...[I turned vegan due to love for animals], but at my age, it helps in recovery," he added. The 34-year-old admitted his camaraderie with Virat Kohli helped him realise the fitness benefits of going vegan.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Porsche Taycan to feature charging faster than Tesla Model S
body: German luxury carmaker Porsche has revealed its all-electric Taycan will feature an 800-volt battery that has fast-charging rates of up to 350 kilowatts. Adding over 60 miles of charge in just four minutes, the Taycan will exceed Tesla's Model S which currently absorbs around 120 kilowatts. Porsche also announced three years of free charging at Electrify America charging stations.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Yami Gautam felicitated by BSF for performance in 'Uri...'
body: Yami Gautam was felicitated by Border Security Force (BSF) in Amritsar for her performance in \'Uri: The Surgical Strike\'. "BSF is the first line of defence of our country and it gives me...pride to have met them," Yami said. The film, which also stars Vicky Kaushal, is based on the Indian Army\'s surgical strike operation which took place in 2016.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Jacob Martin's wife requests people to contribute for his treatment
body: Ex-India cricketer Jacob Martin\'s wife Khyati has requested people of India to make "generous contribution" for her husband\'s ongoing treatment, saying the hospital bill has overshot the total donation. Martin, who had severely injured his lungs in a road accident in December 2018, was scheduled to be discharged on Monday but developed complications and could remain admitted for another week.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Rohit Shetty still working on script for Golmaal 5: Shreyas
body: Actor Shreyas Talpade said that \'Golmaal\' filmmaker Rohit Shetty is still working on the script for the fifth instalment of the \'Golmaal\' film franchise. "He was telling us the other day that he...cracked some story. Once he\'s done with the...scripting, he\'ll take a call,” the actor added. The series features Shreyas along with Ajay Devgn, Arshad Warsi and Tusshar Kapoor.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Highly impressed by Kangana in 'Manikarnika': Waheeda Rehman
body: Veteran actress Waheeda Rehman has said that she was "highly impressed" by Kangana Ranaut\'s performance in the film \'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi\'. "She looks absolutely fabulous and beautiful. I am really happy and proud of her," the actress added. She further said that Kangana had done a "really good job" directing the film as well.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Banned for 4 matches, Sarfaraz shares 'log hai na' poem for critics
body: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed, who has been banned for four matches over racist remarks, took an apparent dig at his critics by sharing a video of a child reciting \'log hai na\' poem on Twitter. "Pyaar karna hai to khud se kar...dushmani karne ke liye log hai na," the poem read. "This is how the world is," Sarfaraz wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Why no major protest in 5 years: Jaitley on unemployment report
body: Talking about the unemployment data report circulated in media, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said if the claims were true, there should\'ve been "great social unrest in the country". "Past five years have passed...without a...major protest", he added. As per a Business Standard report, an unreleased government survey found that India\'s unemployment reached a 45-year high of 6.1% in 2017-2018. \n
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Scientists test wetsuit to protect wearer after shark attack
body: Scientists in Australia\'s Flinders University are testing a wetsuit prototype that could protect its wearer after a shark attack. The suit, made of synthetic material similar to the material used in bulletproof vests, could help reduce blood loss after a shark attack. "The majority of fatalities from shark bites is due to blood loss...shock from blood loss," a scientist said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Can't work with BJP, will join Cong: JD(U)'s Rishi Mishra
body: Janata Dal (United) leader Rishi Mishra on Saturday announced that he will join Congress, saying that it was getting very difficult to work in JD(U). "I don\'t have issues with Nitish ji (CM of Bihar) but I can\'t work with BJP," he added. "The 58,000 people who voted for me in the previous election were anti-NDA," he further said.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: You would spend 35-40% more if govt didn't contain inflation: Goyal
body: While presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said, "Our families would be spending 35-40% more today on basic necessities if the government didn\'t contain inflation." The inflation in December 2018 was just 2.1%, down from the double-digit seen during the previous government, he added. Inflation has been brought down to 4.1%, Goyal further said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: UP cousins fed human excreta for friendship with boys
body: Two minor cousins in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur were allegedly repeatedly burnt with tongs and forced to eat human excreta by their family for being friends with two boys from the same school. The cousins revealed their ordeal to the police and Child Welfare Committee after being brought back to Gorakhpur from Nepal, where they had fled to escape the torture.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Ex-cricketer Martin out of ICU after being on ventilator for a month
body: Ex-India cricketer Jacob Martin has been shifted to general ward from the ICU after being on a ventilator for nearly a month following a road accident, wherein he severely injured his lungs. Martin's wife Khyati mentioned there are chances that Jacob will be in hospital for two more months. BCCI, CSK and various cricketers provided financial assistance for Martin's treatment.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: 10 lakh patients treated under Ayushman Bharat in 4 months
body: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said 10 lakh patients have been treated free of cost under Ayushman Bharat Yojana in the last four months. Stating that there are currently 21 AIIMS that are operating or being established, he announced that the 22nd AIIMS would be set up in Haryana.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Google Chrome testing feature to warn of 'lookalike URLs'
body: Google Chrome is testing a feature to warn users of "lookalike URLs" that may look similar to existing ones and help redirect users to the site they were trying to visit. The feature has been in testing phase since the release of \'Chrome Canary 70\' browser. It can be enabled in the stable version of Chrome as an experimental feature.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Guj Cong MLA Asha Patel quits party, says was being ignored
body: Gujarat Congress MLA, Asha Patel, on Saturday resigned from the party membership and as a member of the state assembly. Following the resignation, Patel said, "I\'ve resigned from the party because the leadership has been ignoring me and due to prevalent infighting." However, dismissing Patel\'s allegations, state Congress President Amit Chavda said she had taken the decision for "personal gain".
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Will use tech to seal B'desh border at WB, Assam: Rajnath
body: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said that the Centre will use technology to seal the international borders of West Bengal and Assam with Bangladesh. He said that a comprehensive integrated border management system will be used for the same. The Centre has sought land from West Bengal to erect fencing to seal the borders, the minister added.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: If anyone can come close to Sachin and Virat, it's Shaw: Sreesanth
body: Banned fast bowler Sreesanth, while commenting on a Twitter post by Prithvi Shaw, said that if anyone can come close to Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli, it\'s the 19-year-old batsman. "Keep working hard and never ever give up," he added. Shaw had posted a few lines inspired by \'Apna time aayega\' rap song from upcoming film \'Gully Boy\'.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: ₹100 crore allotted to TDB for Sabarimala temple
body: The Kerala government on Thursday allotted ₹100 crore for the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB), which manages the Sabarimala temple, in the 2019-20 budget. Some false propaganda by certain politicians affected TDB's income, Kerala Finance Minister Thomas Isaac said. The government aims to provide maximum facilities at Sabarimala on the lines of the Tirupati model, he added.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Malinga's wife targets Perera on Facebook, he seeks board's help
body: Sri Lanka all-rounder Thisara Perera has written to Sri Lanka Cricket CEO Ashley de Silva, asking the board to intervene after ODI captain Lasith Malinga\'s wife Tanya targeted him on Facebook. Tanya accused Perera of meeting country\'s Sports Minister to secure his place in the team. "We\'ve become laughing stock of whole country...because of one person\'s personal vendetta," Perera wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Paris policemen who raped tourist inside police HQ jailed for 7yrs
body: Two police officers have been sentenced to seven years in jail after being found guilty of raping a Canadian tourist at a Paris police headquarters in 2014. The woman said she was invited to tour the headquarters after meeting some officers in a bar, but when she went there she was gang-raped. However, officers said she had consented to sex.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Alphabet-backed US health insurance startup raises $500 mn
body: Google parent Alphabet-backed US-based health insurance startup Clover Health has raised $500 million in a funding round led by existing investor Greenoaks Capital. As part of the funding, it'll promote its current CTO Andrew Toy to also assume President's role. Founded in 2014 by Vivek Garipalli and Kris Gale, the startup has raised a total of $925 million in funding.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Rohit Shetty's 'Sooryavanshi' is not a remake: Spokesperson
body: Addressing reports that suggest filmmaker Rohit Shetty\'s upcoming film \'Sooryavanshi\' is a remake of a Tamil film, the filmmaker\'s spokesperson said, "The news is completely untrue and baseless." "Sooryavanshi...is an original story and not inspired from any film,” his spokesperson added. Earlier, reports stated that \'Sooryavanshi\' would be a remake of the Tamil film \'Theeran Adhigaaram Ondru\'.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: How long can I tolerate Congress leaders' potshots: K'taka CM
body: Days after he threatened to step down from his post if Congress MLAs continue "crossing the line," Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy accused them of taking potshots and asked, "How many more days can I tolerate such stuff?" Kumaraswamy, who made the statements after a Congress MLA demanded that Siddaramaiah be made CM again, said, "Power is ephemeral."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Won't stop protecting gau mata: Govt allots ₹750 crore for cows
body: The government has allocated ₹750 crore for protection of cows in current year under Rashtriya Gokul Mission. Stating that Rashtriya Kamdhenu Aayog will be set up for cows, Interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said, "The government will never step back from protection of the gau mata." Meanwhile, the government also announced that it will create a separate department for fisheries.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Govt announces highest ever defence budget of over ₹3 lakh crore
