body: While delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced that the defence budget has been enhanced beyond ₹3 lakh crore for the first time. Goyal further said that if necessary, additional funds will also be provided for defence, adding that "our soldiers, who protect our borders in tough conditions, are our pride and honour".
author: Ankush Verma

headline: New method that turns oily soil into fertile soil developed
body: Scientists at America's Rice University have 'fine-tuned' a method to restore the fertility of soil that is contaminated by oil spills. Scientists heated contaminated soil samples in the absence of oxygen, a process named pyrolysis, and successfully reduced petroleum hydrocarbons to below regulatory mandates. Samples heated at 420°C for 15 minutes reduced 99.9% hydrocarbons, scientists said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Interim Budget's copies checked by sniffer dog in Parliament
body: The printed copies of the Interim Budget were checked by a sniffer dog as part of a security check ahead of the Budget being presented at 11 am on Friday. It will be presented by Piyush Goyal, who was recently assigned temporary additional charge of the Finance and Corporate Affairs ministries in the absence of Arun Jaitley.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: PM gave ₹30,000cr to Anil Ambani, only ₹17 a day to farmers: Rahul
body: Criticising the Interim Budget, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said, "PM [Modi] has given ₹30,000 crore to Anil Ambani, but only ₹17 per day to farmers." Addressing a rally in Bihar\'s Patna, he added the BJP government waived industrialists\' loans but not those of farmers. He further reiterated his promise of minimum income if Congress is voted to power.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Never leave crease with Dhoni behind: ICC to Yoko on 'life advice'
body: Late singer John Lennon\'s widow and artist Yoko Ono asked her Twitter followers to give advice that would make "our lives heal and shine". Responding to Yoko Ono\'s tweet, the ICC wrote, "Never leave your crease with MS Dhoni behind the stumps!" Earlier today, New Zealand\'s Jimmy Neesham was run-out by an MS Dhoni direct hit in the fifth ODI.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Decide about an alliance within 15 days: Uddhav to BJP
body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray has asked the BJP to decide about the alliance with the Sena within 15 days and said the BJP should make a concrete proposal on the alliance. Thackeray added that only if the BJP agrees to Sena's terms and conditions, the party will agree for an alliance. Sena is free to fight independently, he said.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Indian-origin Harris' campaign launch best opening so far: Trump
body: US President Donald Trump, a Republican, has said that the campaign launch of Indian-origin Democratic Senator Kamala Harris is "the best opening so far" in 2020 presidential race. Trump added that Harris\' campaign launch event had "a better crowd, better enthusiasm". "Some of the others were very flat," Trump said about other Democratic presidential aspirants.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: WB CM Mamata holds Cabinet meeting in traffic outpost amid dharna
body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday held a Cabinet meeting to pass the state budget in a traffic outpost on a pavement in Kolkata. The full cabinet comprising over 50 ministers huddled in the room. This comes amid the dharna she has staged to protest the CBI's move to raid Kolkata Police chief in connection with chit fund scams.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Ghalib's work could only have found meaning in India: Javed
body: While speaking about the work of Urdu poet Mirza Ghalib, veteran lyricist-screenwriter Javed Akhtar said, "[The] language and depth used in his work could have only found meaning in India." "His work wouldn\'t have been nurtured and preserved if not for this country," the lyricist added. He further said that Ghalib had an "amazing range of emotions".
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Tendulkar praises Indian team's ability to be competitive
body: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar praised the Indian cricket team\'s ability to be competitive "in any part of the world and on any surface". Speaking about India\'s chances at the upcoming ICC World Cup in England and Wales, Sachin said, "As far as our chances are concerned, I will not hesitate in saying that we are the favourites."
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: BJP hates Muslims, natives of UP, Bihar: Arvind Kejriwal
body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said the BJP hates Muslims and people from eastern Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. "The BJP conspired and deleted...names of 30 lakh voters in Delhi from...electoral roll," he added. He claimed out of the 30 lakh voters 15 lakh belong to UP and Bihar, while eight lakh are Muslims and four lakh are \'baniya\'.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Shocked, hurt by ICICI's decision, truth will prevail: Kochhar
body: Ex-ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar said she\'s "utterly disappointed, hurt and shocked" by the bank\'s decision to terminate her. Kochhar said she served ICICI for 34 years with utmost honesty and integrity and that ultimately truth will prevail. Adding that she hasn\'t been given a copy of the independent probe report, Kochhar said none of ICICI\'s credit decisions are unilateral
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Ayushmann's wife shares picture of her breast cancer surgery scar
body: To mark World Cancer Day on Monday, Ayushmann Khurrana\'s wife Tahira Kashyap shared a bare-back picture of herself taken by photographer Atul Kasbekar, showing her breast cancer surgery scar. "I truly embrace all my scars as they\'re my badges of honour," she wrote. "I want to celebrate not the disease but the spirit with which I endured," Tahira added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Tenure ends in a month but PM not prepared to go: Mamata
body: Hitting out at PM Narendra Modi, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Saturday said that though PM Modi\'s "tenure will end in a month, he isn\'t mentally prepared to go". "In true fascist style, he is trying to encircle everyone with agencies," she added. This comes after PM Modi said, "Why fear if you haven\'t done anything wrong [Mamata]?"
author: Shweta Singh

headline: McGregor and 18-month-old son wear purple suits at Super Bowl
body: MMA fighter Conor McGregor and his 18-month-old son Conor Jr wore matching purple suits while attending the Super Bowl LIII at the Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta. They were allowed onto the field before the start of the match. The father-son duo was seen passing a football around before the start of the game.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Rahat Fateh Ali Khan denies getting notice for smuggling currency
body: Pakistani singer Rahat Fateh Ali Khan has denied receiving any notice from the Enforcement Directorate over allegedly smuggling foreign currency out of India. "It would have been better if the authorities would have served the notice first if any and then publicised this," reads a press release issued on behalf of Rahat. The statement further called the allegation "bizarre".
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Would love to do masala film, but story has to be there: Rao
body: Rajkummar Rao has said that he is "very open" to being a part of masala films, adding, "I want to do films which are...larger than life but the story has to be there...You can\'t compromise the story." "The definition of masala-entertainer is also changing now...would love to be a part of films [like \'Simmba\ which have a story," added Rao.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: Mom & my boyfriend friends, have anti-Keshav club: LaLiT's co-owner
body: LaLiT Hotels\' co-owner Keshav Suri said his mother Jyotsna Suri became best friends with his boyfriend Cyril Feuillebois on meeting him and they even have an \'Anti-Keshav Club\'. "Like any mom...mine checked out Cyril from head to toe and asked him about his family," Keshav said on introducing Cyril to his mother. "Our families were more than supportive," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: ₹3 lakh crore recovered from big corporate loan defaulters: FM Goyal
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal while presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 on Friday said that close to ₹3 lakh crore has been recovered from big corporate loan defaulters. "Committed to eliminating the scourge of black money, anti-black money measures taken have brought an undisclosed income of about ₹1.30 lakh crore to the fore," Goyal added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: ED fines Devas Multimedia ₹1,585 crore for forex violation
body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Sunday said it has imposed ₹1,585 crore-penalty on Bengaluru-based Devas Multimedia for illegal foreign investment of ₹578 crore in its deal with ISRO's commercial arm, Antrix. A case of alleged money laundering was filed against Devas in 2015 in connection with the deal. Following this, the ED attached Devas' assets worth ₹80 crore in 2017.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: PM pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi on 71st death anniversary
body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi on his 71st death anniversary at his Samadhi in Rajghat, New Delhi. "On Martyrs\' Day, we gratefully remember Mahatma Gandhi and the countless freedom fighters who sacrificed their all for our Independence," President Ram Nath Kovind tweeted. Congress President Rahul Gandhi also paid his tribute to Mahatma Gandhi.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Grand alliance, if wins, will see a new PM every day: Shah
body: BJP President Amit Shah on Wednesday took a dig at the Opposition\'s proposed grand alliance saying if the "mahagathbandhan comes to power, each opposition leader will be a Prime Minister every day of the week". He added, "[The] country will go on...holiday on Sunday". He said the Opposition is thinking about leading the country but does not have a leader.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: WWE's Stephanie dances to 'Humko Tumse Pyaar Hai', video goes viral
body: A video of WWE\'s chief brand officer Stephanie McMahon dancing to Bollywood song \'Humko Tumse Pyaar Hai\' from the movie \'Ishq\' along with WWE wrestling tag team \'Singh Brothers\' has gone viral. "Now wouldn\'t @StephMcMahon be perfect for a #Bollywood movie?" WWE captioned the video. "Really did I just see this," a user tweeted, reacting to the video.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Came to Mumbai at 16, got rejected in Boogie Woogie auditions: Rao
body: Rajkummar Rao has revealed he first came to Mumbai at the age of 16 when he was in the tenth standard. "I always wanted to be a dancer and came here for the auditions of \'Boogie Woogie\' where I got rejected," he added. "I was very disheartened...but today I\'m...glad...I got rejected. It got me to a better career," said Rao.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Report saying unemployment at 45-yr high not finalised: NITI Aayog
body: NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar has said the jobs data report cited in the media is a draft report and hasn\'t been finalised by the government. Citing a government survey, the Business Standard reported that India\'s unemployment rate rose to a 45-year high during 2017-2018. "Data is still being processed, hence it wasn\'t released by the government," Kumar added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Trolling has become the norm on social media: Vaani
body: Actress Vaani Kapoor said that trolling has become a norm on social media, adding, "There\'s no one who hasn\'t got trolled on social media." "Everybody is out there to pull the other person down but it\'ll only bother [you] if you let it bother you," Vaani added. She further said, social media offers a platform "where people enjoy belittling everybody".
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Govt allocates ₹64,587 crore budget for railways in 2019-20
body: The government has allocated ₹64,587 crore for railways in the Interim Budget for 2019-20. Stating that Indian Railways has experienced "its safest year in history", Interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal said, "All unmanned level crossings on broad gauge network have been completely eliminated." Operating ratio of railways will come down to 95% in 2019-20 from 96.2% in 2018-19, he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: PM Modi inaugurates first-ever university in Ladakh
body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated University of Ladakh, the first-ever university in the Ladakh region of Jammu and Kashmir. The university will be a cluster university comprising of degree colleges of Leh, Kargil, Nubra, Zanskar, Drass and Khaltsi. It will have its administrative offices in Leh and Kargil, PM Modi said during the launch.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Woman poisoned prasad to kill lover's wife in Karnataka: Police
body: The police have arrested 46-year-old Lakshmi and her two assistants after two women died after eating poisoned prasad from Gangamma Temple in Karnataka on Friday. Lakshmi had added poison in the prasad in order to kill her lover's wife Sri Gowri. However, Sri Gowri did not eat it and instead gave it to her mother Saraswathamma, who died on Saturday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Why did Columbia spacecraft carrying Kalpana Chawla crash in 2003?
body: Space Shuttle Columbia carrying seven crew members including India-born astronaut Kalpana Chawla exploded upon reentering Earth's atmosphere on February 1, 2003. During the launch of its 28th Earth-orbiting mission, a piece of insulating foam broke off and struck the left wing. On re-entry, the damaged wing allowed superheated gases to penetrate, breaking the orbiter apart and killing the crew.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Prisoners in freezing US jail cells bang on windows for help
body: Inmates at a federal jail in US have been banging on the windows of their cells to get attention from people on the street as they suffer below-freezing temperatures in their cells. The jail has had limited power and heat for at least a week. However, authorities said inmates have hot water and medical services continue to be provided.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: We were worried it'd backfire: Kartik on 'backfie' tweet on PM Modi
body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, while speaking about the tweet in which he shared a \'backfie\' taken by Imtiaz Ali showing PM Narendra Modi from behind, said, "We were...worried [it would backfire]." "We were calling ourselves losers but agar wo galat le liya hota toh backfire ho jata," he added. Speaking about the PM\'s reply, Kartik said, "Bahut hi...sweet sa tweet tha."
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Trump ready to end Korean War: US envoy
body: US President Donald Trump is ready to end the Korean War, US envoy Stephen Biegun said. "(It\'s) time to move past 70 years of war in the Korean Peninsula...We\'re not going to invade North Korea. We\'re not seeking to topple the regime", he added. His remarks come ahead of the second summit between Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: This is a historic Budget, says Rajnath Singh
body: Home Minister Rajnath Singh has called the Interim Budget presented by Finance Minister Piyush Goyal "a historic budget." He added, "This will enable the common man to stand on his feet and all the sections of the society will benefit from it." Meanwhile, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said the Budget "will help achieve the dream of a New India."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Karthik could be reserve opener for India in WC: Gavaskar
body: Former Indian cricketer Sunil Gavaskar said that India could use Dinesh Karthik as a reserve opener for the ICC World Cup 2019. Gavaskar also picked wicket-keeper Rishabh Pant for the five-match ODI series at home against Australia next month. Speaking about the Indian team featuring three wicket-keepers, Gavaskar said, "If the team has three wicket-keepers, so be it."
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: I was 16 when I first met Shahid at family friend's house: Wife Mira
body: During a Q&A session on Instagram, Shahid Kapoor\'s wife Mira Rajput revealed she was 16 years old when she first met him. "We were at a common family friend\'s house for a concert by a Sufi singer. Both our dads love that kind of music," she added. Mira wrote meeting him was "just like meeting anyone for the first time".
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: South Africa clinch T20I series after Pak fall short by 7 runs
body: South Africa took an unassailable lead in the three-match T20I series against Pakistan after the visitors fell short by seven runs in the second T20I on Sunday. South Africa's stand-in captain David Miller won his second consecutive Player of the Match award after scoring an unbeaten 29-ball 65. The series' final match will be played at Centurion on Wednesday.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: 3 women arrested in Karnataka temple prasad poisoning case
body: Three women were arrested on Tuesday in connection with the poisoning of prasad at a temple in Chikkaballapur district, Karnataka. Two women had died while several other people were hospitalised with complaints of vomiting and loose motions. The police had earlier said the temple management was not responsible as the women had brought the prasad themselves and were distributing it.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: NoMo jobs: Rahul on report claiming unemployment at 45-yr high
body: Referring to a report claiming an unreleased government survey found India\'s unemployment reached a 45-year high of 6.1% in 2017-2018, Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "NoMo Jobs...Time for NoMo2Go." Rahul added, "The Fuhrer (a term associated with dictator Adolf Hitler) promised us 2 Cr jobs a year. 5 years later, his leaked job creation report card reveals a National Disaster."
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Hardik Pandya smashes 3 successive sixes in an ODI for 4th time
body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya smashed three straight sixes off New Zealand spinner Todd Astle in 47th over in the fifth ODI on Sunday. This was the fourth time that the 25-year-old smashed three consecutive sixes in an over in ODI cricket. He had achieved the feat thrice in 2017 against Australia's Adam Zampa, and Pakistan's Shadab Khan and Imad Wasim.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Lawyer hired by Delhi woman arrested for her murder 7 years later
body: Seven years after a Model Town resident named Kiran went missing, Delhi police have arrested her lawyer, a sweeper and a rickshaw puller for her murder. Kiran had hired advocate Virender Kumar to fight her landlord, who wanted her to vacate the house. However, Kumar struck a ₹30-lakh deal with the landowner and strangulated Kiran with a belt, police said.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: '4B' for Opposition is 'Bua-Bhatija-Bhai-Behen': Amit Shah
body: BJP President Amit Shah on Wednesday took a dig at the Opposition parties saying that the \'mahagathbandhan\' for the Opposition is 4B - "Bua-Bhatija-Bhai-Behen". He added that 4B for the BJP meant "Badhta Bharat, Banta Bharat". He said Opposition\'s government cannot take the country ahead and "only Modiji can provide a \'mazboot\' (strong) government".
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Won’t let RSS, govt meddle in gurdwara affairs: SGPC chief
body: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) President Gobind Singh Longowal on Thursday said that they won\'t let the government and RSS meddle in Sikh affairs. This comes after RSS affiliate Rashtriya Sikh Sangat said that Shiromani Akali Dal is controlling all the gurdwaras. "The management of gurdwaras is run only by SGPC which is the elected body of Sikhs," Longowal added.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: I lost massive amounts of money doing this job: US Prez Trump
body: US President Donald Trump said in an interview that he has "lost massive amounts of money" while serving in the Oval Office, denying he made financial gains from the presidency. "This (the presidency) isn\'t the money. This is one of the great losers of all time," he added. Trump rejected speculations that he might not run for re-election in 2020.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Your lies making things worse: Krish to Kangana on Manikarnika row
body: Criticising Kangana Ranaut for taking first credit for \'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi\', co-director Krish said, "Please realise your lies are making things worse." He posted screenshots of WhatsApp chats with technicians and other members stating that 85% of the film was shot by him. This comes \nafter Kangana\'s sister shared screenshots of messages reportedly sent by Kangana to Krish.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Team India always gets Josh of nation super high: Vicky Kaushal
body: Sharing BCCI\'s video of India\'s \'How\'s the Josh?\' celebration after their ODI series victory over New Zealand, actor Vicky Kaushal tweeted, "Our...cricket team always gets...Josh of the nation super high." BCCI had shared the video with the caption, "Looks like the \'Josh\' in the squad is \'High Sir\'." In the video, Kedar Jadhav was asking the team, "How\'s the Josh?"
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Sabarimala violence second disaster after floods: Kerala FM
body: Kerala Finance Minister Thomas Isaac on Thursday said, "After floods, Sabarimala violence was the second disaster in the state." "Lakhs of women came out to say they are equal and not unholy," he added. Following the protests over entry of women aged 10-50 years in the Sabarimala temple, the shrine reportedly suffered a dip of ₹100 crore in its revenue.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: India ranked 78 on global corruption index, US drops out of top 20
body: India has been ranked 78 on the 'Corruption Perceptions Index 2018' released by the Transparency International, moving up three places from 2017. The US has been ranked 22, dropping out of top 20 on the index for the first time since 2011. Denmark topped the index, which ranks 180 countries and territories.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Parrikar said he has nothing to do with new Rafale deal: Rahul
body: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said, "Friends...(Goa CM and former Defence Minister) Manohar Parrikar clearly stated he has nothing to do with the new (Rafale) deal that was orchestrated by PM Narendra Modi to benefit Anil Ambani." The remarks comes after Rahul\'s meeting with Parrikar at the CM\'s office, which the Congress chief claimed was a "personal visit".
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Chris Evans, Jennifer Lopez to present awards at Oscars 2019
body: 'The Avengers' actor Chris Evans and singer Jennifer Lopez will present awards at the upcoming Oscars ceremony. 'Crazy Rich Asians' stars Awkwafina and Constance Wu, as well as actress and comedian Tina Fey will also be presenting. Actor Daniel Craig, best known for his portrayal of the fictional British spy James Bond, has also been named as a presenter.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: 4 female friends, including minor, commit suicide together in Guj
body: Four female friends, including a minor, have allegedly committed suicide by jumping into Narmada canal in Gujarat's Banaskantha. Police said according to their suicide note, one friend said she was suffering from a heart ailment and the second said she was not happy with her marriage. The other two took the step as separation from friends was unbearable for them.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Ex-Axis Bank CEO Shikha Sharma joins Dr Reddy's as director
body: Pharma major Dr Reddy's Laboratories on Thursday said it has appointed Axis Bank's former MD and CEO Shikha Sanjaya Sharma as the company's independent additional director for a period of five years. Sharma served as Axis Bank's head from June 2009 to December 2018. She was replaced by Amitabh Chaudhry who previously headed HDFC Standard Life Insurance Company.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: NCLT proposal to be same as previous asset sale plans: RCom
body: Reliance Communications (RCom) has said it will propose a similar debt resolution plan to NCLT as it had pursued with creditors. The Anil Ambani-led firm added the key elements of the plan, including the sale of telecom infrastructure assets and spectrum, will remain unchanged. This comes after RCom opted for insolvency proceedings at NCLT as it failed to repay lenders.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Rahul Gandhi more worried about his own employment: Bihar CM
body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi "is more worried about his own employment.” “I would like to ask what prevented the UPA government from granting central university status to Patna University," Nitish further said. This comes a day after Rahul promised to grant central university status to Patna University if UPA comes to power.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Shackled Bahraini footballer in Thailand upsetting: Aus PM
body: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison said on Tuesday he was "disturbed" to see Bahraini refugee footballer Hakeem Al Araibi in shackles in Thailand. Araibi, who fled Bahrain in 2014 before being granted permanent residence in Australia, has said he would face torture if sent back to Bahrain for his criticism of the royal family.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Saudi ends crackdown on corruption that saw princes being detained
body: Saudi Arabia has announced an end to its crackdown on corruption, launched in 2017, that saw more than 200 princes, ministers and businessmen being detained. The kingdom said it recovered over $100 billion in cash, property and other assets. Among the prominent detainees were Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's cousins, including billionaire investor Prince Alwaleed bin Talal.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Indonesian teenagers flogged for cuddling in public
body: Two teenagers were whipped publicly in Indonesia's Aceh province on Thursday after they were caught cuddling in public. The two teenagers were flogged 17 times each outside a mosque and had also served time in prison before the punishment on Thursday. This comes despite the provincial government's decision to hold flogging indoors.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Police constable shoots himself to death on 26th birthday in Chennai
body: A police constable named K Manikandan posted on night duty allegedly shot himself at around 2 am on his 26th birthday on Sunday in Chennai. He was serving in the Armed Reserve wing and was posted at the Inspector General of Police's office gate. A BSc graduate, Manikandan was reportedly serving in the police for seven months.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Walmart may exit Flipkart due to new FDI rules: Morgan Stanley
body: US-based brokerage firm Morgan Stanley has said the US-based retail giant Walmart\'s exit from Flipkart is "likely, not completely out of the question" with India\'s new FDI norms for e-commerce. "We estimate that Flipkart derives 50% of its revenue from high-selling electronics category," said Morgan Stanley. "It could face meaningful disruption and top-line pressure in the near term," it added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Couple divorces minutes after marriage as families fight over lunch
body: A couple got divorced minutes after their wedding ceremony got over in Gujarat's Gondal as a disagreement broke out and relatives from both sides started throwing dishes at each other during lunch. The advocates representing both sides arrived at the marriage hall and got the couple divorced within minutes. The couple even reportedly returned the gifts exchanged during the ceremony.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Heard loud bang, thought bomb exploded: Seemanchal Express witness
body: Bihar\'s Basawan Singh, a witness of the Seemanchal Express derailment in Bihar that killed at least six people on Sunday, said he initially mistook the accident for a bomb explosion. "We were asleep when we heard the loud bang," said Singh. "Tracks were a few yards away, we could sense that a train was stranded...but...it was pitch dark," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Ram, Krishna didn't smoke, why should we: Ramdev to sadhus at Kumbh
body: Urging saints and seers at the Kumbh Mela to quit smoking, Yoga guru Ramdev said, "We follow Ram and Krishna who never smoked in their life then why should we?" Making them take a pledge to quit tobacco, he collected chillum (clay pipe) from several sadhus. He said he will deposit the chillums for display at a museum he\'ll build.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: Chairman of TVS Group's Sundaram Brake Linings passes away
body: TVS Group's K Mahesh, who was the Chairman of the group's Sundaram Brake Linings, passed away in Chennai on Saturday. He was the grandson of the automobile group's Founder TV Sundaram Iyengar and the younger brother of TVS & Sons' Chairman Suresh Krishna. The 75-year-old had been working at TVS Group for over five decades.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Delhi child rights body flags PUBG as 'negative' game
body: The Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights (DCPCR) has flagged online games including PUBG and Fortnite as 'negative' and 'adversely affecting a child's brain'. DCPCR urged Directorate of Education to ask schools to spread awareness about ill-effects of online gaming. Recently, an 18-year-old boy allegedly committed suicide after he wasn't allowed to buy a ₹37,000-smartphone to play PUBG.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: CBI gets govt nod to prosecute Chidambaram in INX Media case
body: The Law Ministry on Sunday gave its nod to the CBI to prosecute former Finance Minister P Chidambaram in the INX media case. The CBI on January 25 had told the Delhi High Court that custodial interrogation of Chidambaram was required in the case. "We want to exercise our statutory right to investigate the case," Solicitor General told the court.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Asked Kohli what was wrong with him after he ordered idli: Chhetri
body: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri has revealed he used to make fun of Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli for going vegan. "[Once], he ordered some idli and I asked him what was wrong with him," Chhetri added. "What he eats, how he trains, he is different from others. He actually trains like a footballer," Chhetri further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Alka Lamba wants to quit party, finding reasons: AAP
body: AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj on Tuesday said that AAP MLA Alka Lamba wants to leave the party and is finding reasons for the same. This comes after Lamba on Sunday claimed that AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal unfollowed her on Twitter. “If I do not get the respect I deserve...I will stop \nworking for the party,” Alka had said.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: 12-yr-old accidentally shoots self while playing with pistol
body: A 12-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh\'s Lucknow accidentally shot herself in the head while playing with her father\'s pistol. "The girl placed the barrel of the pistol on her right temple and was enacting suicide attempt when the trigger was accidentally pulled," a police official said. She was immediately taken to a nearby hospital where she died during treatment.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: SBI reports ₹3,955 crore profit in Q3, highest in seven years
body: India's largest lender State Bank of India (SBI) on Friday reported a third-quarter profit of ₹3,955 crore, its highest profit in nearly seven years. SBI saw its gross bad loans as a percentage of total loans ease to 8.71% from 9.95% in the previous quarter. Chairman Rajnish Kumar said the resolution of eight bad loan accounts could generate ₹34,000 crore.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: I want Tesla cars to call tow truck if issues detected: Musk
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said he wants to add a feature that enables Tesla cars to automatically call a tow truck as soon as they detect issues like a flat tire. Users will be able to cancel the call through the in-dash display. However, Musk has not provided with a timeline as to when the feature might get launched.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: It disturbs me: Fatima on link-up rumours with Aamir
body: While addressing link-up rumours with her \'Dangal\' co-star Aamir Khan, actress Fatima Sana Shaikh said, "It disturbs me because I don’t want people to assume wrong things." "People reading it assume that I’m not a good person," the actress added. Fatima further said that while she\'s learnt to ignore the rumours, they still affect her sometimes.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: WWI grenade found in potato shipment for Hong Kong crisp factory
body: A World War One-era German hand grenade has been found among a delivery of potatoes shipped from France to a crisp factory in Hong Kong. The grenade was safely detonated on site by bomb disposal officers. "The grenade was likely to have been left behind, dropped by soldiers there during the war," a historian said.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Leaving Facebook for a month made users happier: Study
body: A study conducted by NYU and Stanford University researchers has found that Facebook users, who deactivated their accounts for a month, self-reported "improvements" in happiness. Users also reduced time spent on other social media platforms and increased their offline activity like socialising with family, the study added. However, deactivation reduced users\' factual news knowledge.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: MP BJP leader killed by BJP member over growing popularity: Police
body: The Madhya Pradesh police on Thursday arrested BJP leader Tarachand Rathore and his son for allegedly murdering Manoj Thackeray, a local-level party functionary, earlier this month by hiring contract killers. "Rathore and his son Digvijaya were upset over the increasing popularity of Thackeray," police said. Rathore reportedly offered ₹5 lakh to the contract killers in the last week of December.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: What is vote-on-account and when is it presented?
body: The Centre is likely to present a vote-on-account with the Interim Budget, according to reports. Through a vote-on-account, the government takes the Parliament's approval for essential expenditure for a limited period during an election year. A vote-on-account is a special provision that allows it to incur expenses for a short period of time or until a full Budget is passed.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Jharkhand govt exposes Aadhaar data of 1,66,000 employees: Report
body: A web system used to record attendance of Jharkhand government employees was left without a password since 2014, exposing names, job titles, and partial phone numbers of 1,66,000 workers, a TechCrunch report has claimed. The Aadhaar numbers were not directly listed, but the filenames of the photos contained the 12-digit identity number, TechCrunch said. The website has been pulled offline.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Extreme cold to affect 200 million people as polar vortex hits US
body: Several parts of the US are set to experience record low temperatures as the polar vortex hit the Upper Midwest, with more than 200 million people expected to experience below-freezing temperatures this week. Temperatures throughout the Upper Midwest are expected to be at least 20-40℉ below zero. Government offices and schools have been closed in several areas.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Interim Budget will achieve the dream of a New India: Yogi
body: Discussing the Interim Budget, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Friday, "This Budget will help achieve the dream of a New India." He added, "All sections of the society, including farmers, middle class, poor and women have been mentioned." Meanwhile, BJP chief Amit Shah said the government is devoted to the dreams and aspirations of the poor, youth and farmers.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Fadnavis rules out simultaneous Assembly, LS polls in Maharashtra
body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday ruled out the possibility of simultaneous Assembly and Lok Sabha elections in the state. Fadnavis may "reluctantly agree" for simultaneous polls to keep the BJP\'s alliance intact with the Shiv Sena, claimed the Congress. The Maharashtra Assembly\'s term ends in November and elections are likely to be held in October.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Interim Budget has never meddled with tax rates: Chidambaram
body: Criticising the Interim Budget 2019-20, senior Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "Never has an Interim Budget tinkered with the tax rates." He further accused the government of meddling with income-tax laws and added the Budget violated both convention and the spirit of an Interim Budget. The Budget was like "allowing the camel\'s nose in the tent", he further said.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Ola, Uber created over 2 million jobs: NITI Aayog CEO Kant
body: The government think tank NITI Aayog's CEO Amitabh Kant said ride-hailing startups Ola and Uber have created about 2.2 million jobs in India. This comes after a Business Standard report quoted an unreleased government survey as saying India's unemployment rate rose to a 45-year high of 6.1% during 2017-2018. In 2017-18 transport sector raised almost 3.4 million jobs, Kant added.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Pak’s Sana Mir becomes the 2nd Asian to feature in 100 T20Is
body: Pakistan woman cricketer Sana Mir became only the second Asian cricketer to feature in 100 T20I matches. Mir achieved the feat when she stepped onto the field in Pakistan's third T20I against the Windies in Karachi on Sunday. Earlier, Pakistan's Shoaib Malik had become the first Asian cricketer to feature in 100 T20I matches.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: I think the opposition even dreams about me: PM Modi
body: Claiming there is a dearth of ideas among opposition parties, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said, "The opposition talks only about Modi the whole day, I suspect they even dream about me." PM Modi, who was addressing the New India Youth Conclave in\u200b Surat, added that the opposition parties have only one agenda which is "Modi".
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Mamata Banerjee architect of federal front: Chandrababu Naidu
body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Tuesday described his West Bengal counterpart Mamata Banerjee as the "architect" of the federal front. Naidu, who joined Banerjee\'s "Save the Democracy" sit-in protest, added that Banerjee is the main pillar of the opposition. He further said she will be in a decision making position at the national level after the general polls.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Who are the key officials who worked on Interim Budget 2019-20?
body: Subhash Chandra Garg, Department of Economic Affairs Secretary, is responsible for Finance Ministry's coordination with regulators like the RBI, SEBI and World Bank. Revenue Secretary Ajay Bhushan Pandey oversees the revenue receipts, while Financial Services Secretary Rajiv Kumar is responsible for functioning of 21 state-run banks. Atanu Chakraborty has the task of meeting the government's disinvestment target.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: McGregor fined ₹35 lakh, Khabib ₹3.5 crore for brawl; both banned
body: Nevada State Athletic Commission has banned MMA fighters Conor McGregor and Khabib Nurmagomedov for six months and nine months respectively over their roles in the mass brawl that occurred after their fight at UFC 229 last October. McGregor and Khabib have been fined $50,000 (₹35 lakh) and $500,000 (₹3.5 crore) respectively. The brawl occurred after Nurmagomedov confronted McGregor's teammate.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: BJP to instigate riots on February 21: SBSP President
body: BJP ally Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party\'s (SBSP) President OP Rajbhar on Friday said that an "American intelligence agency" has reported that "BJP will instigate riots on February 21". "No politician dies in riots, only innocents die in riots," he added. "We don\'t want riots, we want to maintain peace...among Hindus and Muslims," he further said.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Galaxy 12.9 billion light-years away is named after Ronaldo
body: Cosmos Redshift 7 or CR7, a galaxy 12.9 billion light-years away from the Earth, is named after five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo, who is known as CR7. The galaxy, discovered in 2015, is considered to be one of the oldest and the brightest galaxies in the universe. Ronaldo, who also has an airport named after him, turns 34 today.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Pak-based terror groups will continue attacks in India: US intel
body: The US intelligence\'s worldwide threat assessment report has stated terror groups supported by Pakistan will continue to conduct terrorist attacks in India and Afghanistan. It also warned of communal violence in India in view of the upcoming General polls. The report claimed communal clashes "could alienate Indian Muslims and allow Islamist terrorist groups in India to expand their influence."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: People need to accept there are different forms of love: Regina
body: \'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga\' actress Regina Cassandra has said that she wants the audience to understand that there are different forms of love. "You can\'t cage people who are in love or try and fit them in a norm," she added. Regina is seen playing the character \'Kuhu\' in \'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga\'.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: MMA fighter who escaped police van found hiding in dustbin
body: A mixed martial arts fighter suspected of two murders, who had escaped from Texas police, was found hiding in a rubbish bin. Cedric Marks had escaped from a prison transport vehicle after it stopped at a McDonald's in Conroe, near Houston. He was being transferred to Temple, Texas to face charges on Sunday when he fled.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Dravid proposes plan to train players for alternate career options
body: India Under-19 coach Rahul Dravid has reportedly proposed a plan to BCCI to help young cricketers get training and jobs for life and career outside cricket. Dravid discussed a programme aimed at improving life skills of young cricketers. "We are working towards formulating a structure before it is sent to...BCCI to get things going," NCA COO Tufan Ghosh said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: RSS most secular and inclusive organisation: Maharashtra Guv
body: Maharashtra Governor C Vidyasagar Rao on Tuesday said RSS is one of the most secular and inclusive organisations. He added RSS has always respected the right of individuals to practice their own faith and religion. Speaking at an event, the governor added that the journey of the Sangh has been spectacular as well as tough.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: HDFC Life presents an inspiring #BounceBack story
body: HDFC Life in its latest video showcases the story of Darpan Inani, India's highest rated visually impaired chess player as of January'19. Darpan became a chess champion despite losing his sight at the age of 3. The film highlights how a strong will to fight and the right financial support can help you bounce back from life's biggest challenges.
author: Roshan Gupta

headline: Over ₹35,000 crore disbursed under OROP: Goyal
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said the government has already disbursed over ₹35,000 crore after implementing One Rank One Pension (OROP) scheme. This was pending for the last 40 years and has been resolved by the present government, he added. The previous governments had sanctioned a "mere" ₹500 crore for the scheme in 2014-15 Interim Budget, he further said.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Chahal, Kuldeep would struggle against Rohit, Dhawan: Harbhajan
body: Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh claimed that Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav would have a tough time bowling to Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan as they both are very good players of spin bowling. "Most of the overseas batsmen, if you see, are trying to read wrist spinners after pitching and that\'s dangerous," Harbhajan added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headline: Tesla's new CFO joined the firm 2 yrs before he earned Harvard MBA
body: Tesla on Wednesday said the company's VP of Finance Zach Kirkhorn will take over as Chief Financial Officer (CFO), replacing Deepak Ahuja. Kirkhorn, who earned his MBA from Harvard in 2013, had joined the carmaker in March 2010, when he was 25. Tesla CEO Elon Musk joked that he didn't think the few years Kirkhorn spent at Harvard were necessary.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Piyush Goyal is the first Chartered Accountant to present a Budget
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday became the first Chartered Accountant (CA) to present a Budget. The 54-year-old, who's also the Union Minister of Corporate Affairs, Railways and Coal, was an all-India second-rank holder CA and second-rank holder in Law from Mumbai University. Goyal has been an investment banker and also served on boards of SBI and Bank of Baroda.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Vedanta loses ₹13,000-cr value after Anglo American stake purchase
body: Indian miner Vedanta saw ₹13,000 crore wiped out from its market value on Friday after its stake purchase in African miner Anglo American sparked corporate governance concerns. Vedanta said its subsidiary Cairn paid $200 million to buy a stake in Anglo American from Volcan Investments. Volcan is the family trust of Vedanta's billionaire founder and majority shareholder Anil Agarwal.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Difficult for govt to meet fiscal deficit of 3.4%: Moody’s
body: US-based rating agency Moody\'s has said the government will find it difficult to meet fiscal deficit target of 3.4% of GDP in 2019-20 due to higher spending and low revenue growth. It added the government\'s debt is "stubbornly high" as a percentage of GDP. It could be brought down only if government sticks to fiscal consolidation path, it further said.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Mithali has missed just 13 ODIs since her debut 20 years ago
body: Indian women's ODI cricket team captain Mithali Raj, who became the first woman to play 200 ODIs on Friday, has missed just 13 ODIs since making her debut on June 26, 1999. India have won 115 ODIs and lost 81 when Mithali has been part of the playing XI. Overall, India Women have played 263 ODIs.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: It's all in past, I've moved on: Binny Bansal on exiting Flipkart
body: More than two months after he resigned as Flipkart Group CEO over "an allegation of serious personal misconduct", Binny Bansal broke silence and said, "Now, it\'s all in the past. I\'ve moved on." "I\'m looking forward to the next chapter of my life," the 37-year-old added. Binny said he\'s focused on xto10x Technologies, a new startup co-founded by him.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Grab raises $200 million from Thai retailer Central Group
body: Southeast Asian ride-hailing startup Grab has raised $200 million in funding, to be invested in its Thailand unit, from Thailand\'s retail conglomerate Central Group. As part of the deal, Central Group will acquire a "significant non-controlling stake" in the startup. Founded in 2012, the Singapore-based startup has raised a total of $7.3 billion in funding till date.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Whoever invented marriage was creepy as hell: Sushmita posts joke
body: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Instagram to share a joke on the subject of marriage. "Whoever invented marriage was creepy as hell. Like I love you so much I’m gonna get the government involved so you can’t leave," Sushmita\'s post read. "This is an insult to [the] beauty of marriage," an Instagram user commented on her post.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: Plastics found in all 50 washed up sea animals studied in UK
body: University of Exeter and Plymouth Marine Laboratory researchers have found microplastics in the guts of all 50 marine animals including seals and whales that washed up on Britain\'s shore. About 84% of particles found in them were synthetic fibres from items like clothes and toothbrushes. "It\'s shocking...but not surprising...that every animal had ingested microplastics," a researcher said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: People said I did bikini shoots anyway: Hansika on private pics leak
body: Speaking about the incident when her private pictures were leaked online, actress Hansika Motwani said, "Certain people [said] since I anyway did bikini shoots...what\'s the big deal if such pictures are leaked?" "When I do...bikini shoot, I\'m doing it out of my own choice. Here it\'s being circulated without...consent," she added. Hansika said some of the leaked pictures were morphed.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: Indian-origin entrepreneurs' fintech startup Aire gets $11mn
body: Fintech startup Aire, co-founded by Indian-origin entrepreneurs Aneesh Varma and Srini Sundaram, has raised $11 million (about ₹79 crore) in a Series B funding round. The funding saw participation from investors including Europe's Crane Venture Partners, White Star Capital and Sunstone Capital. Founded in 2014, the London-based startup offers an algorithmic model to evaluate credit-worthiness.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Not an atom of dad's character changed post Oscar: Rahman's daughter
body: AR Rahman\'s daughter Khatija, while praising him on the occasion of ten years of \'Slumdog Millionaire\' winning Oscars, said, "Not an atom of your character has changed ever since you won Oscars." "Though the world knows you for your music...your humility matters the most for me," she added. Rahman won Oscars for Best Original Score and Best Original Song.
author: Daisy Mowke

headline: ED files money laundering case against Chanda Kochhar
body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has registered a criminal case of money laundering against ICICI Bank's former CEO Chanda Kochhar, her husband, and Videocon MD in the ICICI-Videocon loan case. The agency will primarily examine whether Kochhar made personal gains by sanctioning the ₹1,875-crore loans in 2012. The CBI had earlier filed an FIR to probe alleged corruption in the case.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: It is an election budget: Ex-PM Manmohan Singh on Interim Budget
body: Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh has called the Interim Budget 2019-20 presented by Finance Minister Piyush Goyal an "election budget". "Concessions to farmers and concessions to middle class will obviously impact the upcoming Lok Sabha election," he added. The government has announced assured income support of ₹6,000 per year to farmers owning up to 2 hectares of land.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: All will be revealed: Viral Instagram account posts new egg pic
body: The Instagram account that broke American TV personality Kylie Jenner\'s record of most liked picture by posting an egg\'s picture, has posted another such picture. The picture features a cracked brown egg with football laces. The post\'s caption read, "The wait is over. All will be revealed this Sunday following the Super Bowl (American football championship)."
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Govt to present Interim Budget, not full Budget on February 1
body: The Finance Ministry on Wednesday said the government will present an Interim Budget on February 1. The clarification came amid speculations that a full Budget may be presented during the session. The government recently assigned Piyush Goyal temporary additional charge of the Finance and Corporate Affairs ministries in the absence of Arun Jaitley, who is in the US for treatment.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: WB govt files plea in HC against CBI's bid to question police chief
body: The West Bengal government has filed a petition in the Calcutta High Court against the CBI's attempt to question Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar at his residence. The HC, however, refused an immediate hearing and listed the matter for Tuesday. This comes after CBI tried to raid Kumar's residence over his alleged involvement in chit fund scams in West Bengal.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Mamata Banerjee can't misuse the govt, agencies: UP CM Yogi
body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday said West Bengal CM "Mamata Banerjee should remember that she can not misuse the government and its agencies in the state". He added it\'s shameful that government officials are acting as TMC cadres in the state. Yogi\'s comment came after his chopper was denied permission to land ahead of his rally at Balurghat.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: 20-year-old Andhra woman killed by father following argument
body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death by her father following a heated argument in Prakasam district, Andhra Pradesh. The police said, "Her father had been unhappy at something she did, but when she refused to listen to him, he strangled her in a fit of rage." Her father has been absconding since the incident.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Samsung builds world's first 1TB storage chip for smartphones
body: Samsung has started mass producing its one terabyte \'embedded Universal Flash Storage (eUFS) 2.1\' technology for "use in next-generation mobile applications", which it claims is the industry\'s first such eUFS. The company added the new eUFS will let smartphones store 260 10-minute videos shot in 4K UHD format. It\'ll be sized the same as the previous 512GB version, Samsung said.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: What are the highlights of Interim Budget 2019-20 presented today?
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal proposed a full tax rebate for individual taxpayers earning an annual income of ₹5 lakh. The Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana has been announced to provide assured income support of ₹6,000 per year to farmers owning up to 2 hectares of land. The gratuity limit has been increased from ₹10 lakh to ₹20 lakh.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Priyanka allotted office next to Rahul's at Congress headquarters
body: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has been allotted an office at the Congress headquarters in New Delhi. Her office, which is adjacent to the office of her brother and Congress President Rahul Gandhi, was earlier occupied by Rahul when he was Congress Vice-President. Previous occupants of Priyanka's office include Janardan Dwivedi and Sushil Kumar Shinde.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Kerala gets ₹102 cr bill for use of IAF aircraft during floods
body: The Centre has forwarded a bill of ₹102 crore to the Kerala government for the use of IAF aircraft and helicopters for flood relief operations in the state, Union Minister Subhash Bhamre said on Monday. The IAF had carried out 517 sorties of Fixed Wing aircraft, airlifting 3,787 people, and 634 sorties of helicopters whereby 584 people were winched.
author: Aarushi Maheshwari

headline: Girl misspells prof's name as 'Brain', he replies with brain's pic
body: An e-mail exchange between a student named Jazmin Rojas and her professor has gone viral, where she misspelled professor\'s name as \'Brain\' instead of \'Brian\' in an e-mail. In response, the professor attached a picture of a human brain at the e-mail\'s end. "My professor likes to be addressed by his first name...and...I put Brain instead of Brian," Jazmin tweeted.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: You have to be on Basu's set to experience his magic: Rao
body: Rajkummar Rao, who recently shot for Anurag Basu\'s upcoming film in Bhopal, said, "He [Basu] is like a kid on the set. He is a genius...You have to be present on the set to experience that magic." The untitled film, also starring Fatima Sana Shaikh, is said to be on the lines of Basu\'s 2007 directorial, \'Life in a...Metro\'.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: WI's Darren Bravo takes 342 minutes to score 3rd slowest Test fifty
body: Windies batsman Darren Bravo recorded the third slowest fifty (by time) in 142-year Test history by taking 342 minutes to reach the 50-run mark during the first innings of the second Test against England. The 29-year-old took 215 balls to score the half-century and was stumped on his 216th delivery. Bravo hit two fours and a six during his knock.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Budget is for new India, will energise the citizens: PM Modi
body: Calling the Interim Budget 2019-20 a budget for "new India", PM Narendra Modi on Friday said that it will "help energise the 130 crore citizens in achieving the new India\'s goal". "The unorganised labour force hasn’t ever received any help from previous governments," he added. "The beneficiaries will [now] get assured monthly pension after reaching...60 years," he further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: 8-mths pregnant woman saves her 4 kids before dying in house collapse
body: A 27-year-old woman named Fatima, who was eight months pregnant, managed to save her four kids before being killed in a house collapse triggered by a fire in Ghaziabad on Thursday. She saved her children by throwing them from the balcony onto the street below, locals said. Fatima fainted before she could escape the building which collapsed soon after.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: SC's order has put TMC and BJP in their place: Yechury
body: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said the Supreme Court\'s order on Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar has put BJP and TMC "in place". He further accused the two parties of sharing spoils of chit fund scams. SC on Tuesday said that CBI can\'t arrest Kumar and also directed Kumar to appear before CBI and "cooperate" with it.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Owl enters cockpit of Jet Airways aircraft parked in Mumbai
body: A barn owl was found inside the cockpit of a Jet Airways aircraft on Monday when it was parked at the Mumbai airport. The owl was later handed over to Fire Department of Mumbai International Airport for release, reports said. The Mumbai airport has slums in its vicinity that makes easier for birds to enter the area.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: WI captain dedicates win to Joseph who played despite mom's death
body: Windies captain Jason Holder dedicated the victory against England in the second Test to 22-year-old fast bowler Alzarri Joseph, who played just hours after his mother\'s death on the third day of the Test on Saturday. "To see him in tears...was hard, and we came together in the huddle and we just wanted to do it for him," Holder added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: TDS threshold on interest on bank, post office savings raised to ₹40k
body: Finance Minister Piyush Goyal while presenting the Interim Budget 2019-20 on Friday announced that the TDS threshold on interest on bank and post office deposits has been raised to ₹40,000. The earlier TDS threshold on the interest on such deposits was ₹10,000. Further, the TDS threshold on rental income has been increased from ₹1.8 lakh to ₹2.4 lakh.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Over 2,100 startups served 'angel tax' notices: Report
body: Over 2,100 startups that raised angel funding have received \'angel tax\' notices from I-T Department, a survey by Indian Private Equity & Venture Capital Association (IVCA) and LocalCircles showed. Around 73% of the 2,883 respondents received the notices. The startups said the notice was slapped for raising capital over the "fair market value" or for raising capital from unknown sources.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Haven't denied any permission: Mamata on BJP's rallies in WB
body: Two days after chopper of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath was denied landing for a rally in West Bengal, state CM Mamata Banerjee said, "I haven\'t denied any permission." "He (BJP President Amit Shah) was unwell, yet he came and addressed rallies," she added. "Then why are they claiming that we aren\'t letting them hold rallies," she further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: New Zealand end Rohit Sharma-led India's 12-match winning streak
body: New Zealand defeated India by 8 wickets in the fourth ODI at Hamilton on Thursday to win their first match of the five-match ODI series. India lost an international match under Rohit Sharma's captaincy after 12 consecutive victories dating back to March 2018. The match witnessed India getting all out for 92, their seventh lowest total in ODI cricket history.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Sushmita's boyfriend competes as her daughter's father in race
body: Sushmita Sen took to Instagram to share a video showing boyfriend Rohman Shawl competing as her daughter Alisah\'s father in a school race. "What a MAN!!! Better yet, THAT\'S MY MAN!!!...wins the #100mts gold (by a mile) for Alisah in the father\'s race!!!...I AM SOOOOOOO HAPPY & PROUD of my little shona & my Rooh!!!" she captioned the video.
author: Ankush Verma

headline: Video shows men pushing pillars, damaging Vishnu temple in Hampi
body: A video showing three men pushing a pillar and allegedly damaging ruins of Vishnu temple in Hampi, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, has gone viral. Many locals have reportedly demanded the authorities to step up security. Meanwhile, an Archaeological Survey of India official claimed the video is of an old incident and a police complaint was filed in the case.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headline: 13 booked for firing air shots at Mahatma Gandhi's effigy
body: The police on Wednesday registered cases against 13 persons, including a woman leader of Hindu Mahasabha, in Aligarh for firing at an effigy of Mahatma Gandhi with an air pistol. "The incident took place in a house in Naurangabad locality of the city," Senior Superintendent of Police said. The video of the event went viral on social media, he added.
author: Shashank Verma

headline: Black cat stops play for 2 minutes in Wolves' PL match vs Everton
body: The Premier League match between Everton and Wolves at Goodison Park on Saturday was stopped for over two minutes after a black cat invaded pitch. It entered the field just after Wolves scored their third goal in 66th minute and charged from one end to the other before leaving. No player or official tried to help it escape the field.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Before PM Modi, PMs sat in last row at int'l platforms: Yogi
body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said that before PM Narendra Modi, those holding the prime ministerial post sat in the last row at international platforms and "just clapped". "However, today PM inaugurates...programmes in presence of the US President and gives inaugural speeches," he added. He further said that 2014 onwards, both India and UP have witnessed "unprecedented development".
author: Shweta Singh

headline: BJP gone from MP, yet oppression prevails: Mayawati
body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Sunday said, "Government oppression still prevails in [Madhya Pradesh]." "The people are feeling relieved now as the BJP government has gone from here. However, initial functioning of the newly formed Congress government isn\'t satisfying people either," she added. Congress had won the recent Assembly elections in the state after BSP lent its support.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: It's a budget of desperation, has no value: Mamata Banerjee
body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Friday said the Interim Budget has "no value" as the BJP-led government\'s term will end soon. Mamata added "it\'s a budget of desperation" which won\'t be implemented as new government will decide the new budget. "This government has no moral authority...to place...budget for five years when they\'ll not be in power," she further said.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Don't be sad, 7 runs don't matter: Pujara's dad told him after 193
body: India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara has revealed when he got out for 193 in Sydney Test against Australia, his father Arvind told him not to be sad as seven runs didn\'t matter much. "Later that evening my dad told me that the double-hundred was just a number and the job I had done for the team meant a lot," Pujara said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Dabur's longest-serving CEO Sunil Duggal steps down after 17 years
body: Packaged consumer goods giant Dabur India on Thursday announced that Mohit Malhotra will replace the company's longest-serving CEO Sunil Duggal from April 1. The 62-year-old Duggal joined the New Delhi-based company in 1995 and became the CEO in 2002. Malhotra, who currently heads the company's India business, joined Dabur as a management trainee in 1994.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Small farmers to get ₹6,000/year directly in their bank accounts
body: Delivering the Interim Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Piyush Goyal announced the 'PM Kisan Samman Nidhi' scheme under which farmers owning up to 2 hectares of land will get ₹6,000 per year as income support. The money will be transferred directly to farmers' bank accounts in three equal instalments. Around 12 crore farmer families are expected to benefit from the scheme.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headline: Ericsson allowed to file objection over RCom insolvency plea
body: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Monday allowed telecom equipment maker Ericsson India to file its objection over Reliance Communications' (RCom) plea to proceed with insolvency process. This comes after RCom moved NCLAT to withdraw its appeal to settle Ericsson's dues to pursue a debt resolution plan in NCLT. RCom shares fell 35% after the firm approached NCLT.
author: Shruti Maria Mahendar

headline: Going to Assembly with pipe in nose doesn't suit Goa CM: Cong MLA
body: Goa Congress legislator Reginaldo Lourenco has said that CM Manohar Parrikar should honourably resign and take care of his health. "Don\'t go to the Assembly like that...where you have a pipe in your nose...things coming out of your pocket (catheters). It does not suit you," Lourenco added. Meanwhile, BJP replied, "It\'s the frustration of Congress that government is doing well".
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Uber Co-founder's cloud kitchen firm may enter China: Report
body: \nUber Co-founder Travis Kalanick is reportedly considering to bring Los Angeles-based venture 'CloudKitchens', led by him, to China. Kalanick is working with Co-founder of Chinese bike-rental startup Ofo, Zhang Yanqi, to execute it, the report added. CloudKitchens offers kitchen space to delivery-only restaurants that do not have a dining facility.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Aegon life iTerm insurance plan helps customers save tax
body: With Aegon Life iTerm Insurance plan, customers can enjoy tax benefits on your premiums paid and save up to ₹46,800^ on taxes. The plan provides life cover up to the age of 100 years. Also, customers have options to insure against Critical Illnesses, Disability and Accidental Death Benefit Rider with a life cover up to the age of 80 years.
author: Roshan Gupta

headline: Kartik not approached for Rakesh Sharma biopic: Spokesperson
body: Kartik Aaryan hasn't been approached to star in 'Saare Jahaan Se Achcha', a biopic based on astronaut Rakesh Sharma, the actor's spokesperson said. Earlier reports suggested that Kartik was being considered for the role along with Vicky Kaushal after Shah Rukh Khan opted out of the biopic. Shah Rukh had left the project to work on 'Don 3', reports said.
author: Rahel Philipose

headline: India says it's in talks with US to extend Iran sanctions waiver
body: India is in talks with the US to  extend a waiver on sanctions imposed on Iran’s crude oil exports, Sunjay Sudhir, Joint Secretary (International Cooperation), oil ministry said. "We are talking to the US on energy-related aspects...It is a continuous process," he added. The US has temporarily allowed eight importers, including India, to continue buying Iranian oil.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: Man fakes own kidnapping, cheats boss of ₹50L to buy house in Delhi
body: Delhi businessman Neeraj Goel was cheated by his employee Harender of ₹50 lakh given to him to be kept in a godown by faking his kidnapping with a colleague's help. Harender lied to Goel he was kidnapped, robbed and dumped on road by four men. Police arrested Harender when they found no injury on his forehead where he'd put band-aid.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Apple to use laser-based 3D cameras in 2020 iPhones: Report
body: According to a Bloomberg report, Apple plans to introduce laser-powered cameras, designed to scan and create three-dimensional reconstructions of objects, within its new iPhones, expected to launch in 2020. The rear-facing camera will reportedly work up to 15 feet away from the device. The report added the camera will be used to enhance AR on the iPhone.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Man lives with 17-yr-old girl in forest for 23 days, held for rape
body: Kerala police have arrested a 21-year-old man and charged him with abducting and raping a 17-year-old girl, with whom he was hiding in forests for 23 days. The search operation began on January 6 when the girl's family reported her disappearance. The man reportedly told police that he planned to elope with the girl after she threatened to kill herself.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Intelligent data platform fleetx raises pre-Series A funding
body: Gurugram-based intelligent fleet management and predictive analytics platform fleetx has raised pre-Series A funding from India Quotient, LetsVenture's Angel Fund and others. Last year, fleetx raised angel funding from Travel Boutique Online Founders Ankush Nijhawan and Gaurav Bhatnagar, Mediology Co-founder Manish Dhingra, and others. The startup was founded in 2017 by IIT, NIT and Purdue alumni.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Cong to file FIRs on derogatory attacks on Priyanka Gandhi
body: All India Mahila Congress (AIMC), Congress\' women\'s wing, will file FIRs on Monday against "derogatory" statements targeting Priyanka Gandhi\'s entry into politics. "One of the reasons why few women join politics is that they are not treated well," AIMC president Sushmita Dev said. This comes after Bihar minister Vinod Jha said that Priyanka has no other quality than being beautiful.
author: Nikita Pradhan

headline: Black hole jets create ‘negative-energy’ particles: Study
body: Using new simulations US-based researchers have united two theories related to black holes to reveal 'negative-energy' particles are created on black hole jet emissions. The theory that electric currents around a black hole twist magnetic fields into forming jets was united with another theory that particles passing through it's point of no return (event horizon) appear to carry negative energy.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headline: Jobs, not josh; Budget missed elephant in the room: Shashi Tharoor
body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has said acting Finance Minister Piyush Goyal\'s one-hour-45-minute speech was the longest interim budget speech on record but "missed the elephant in the room". Citing a report which claimed unemployment in India rose to a 45-year high, Tharoor said that one must ask the PM Narendra Modi-led government, "Where are jobs?" instead of "Where\'s the josh?".
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Messenger, WhatsApp, Instagram integration good for users: FB CEO
body: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said integrating WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger and Instagram will be a "long-term project" and "good for user experience." "The first reason that I\'m excited about this is moving more to end-to-end encryption by default in more of our products," said Zuckerberg. "People tell us they want to be able to message across the different services," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headline: Clothes are adjectives, I like me naked: Aus Open semi-finalist
body: Australian Open 2019 semi-finalist Stefanos Tsitsipas, who defeated Roger Federer during the tournament, shared a picture of himself bare-chested on social media and used a quote by Indian-American supermodel Padma Lakshmi as caption. "I like me better naked...Clothes are adjectives, they\'re indicators. When you don\'t have...clothes on...it\'s just you...raw, and you can\'t hide," the caption read.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: Father of slain Army soldier Aurangzeb joins BJP
body: Mohammad Hanief, the father of Army soldier Aurangzeb, who was abducted and killed by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir\'s Pulwama last year, joined the BJP on Sunday. "I have joined BJP for its pro-poor policies," Hanief said. "PM Modi-led government is the best in the country which thinks about the poor unlike the previous governments," he added.
author: Shweta Singh

headline: Helen aunty's grace is unmatched: Sonakshi on recreating Mungda
body: Sonakshi Sinha, who will be recreating Helen\'s \'Mungda Mungda\' song for her upcoming film \'Total Dhamaal\', said, "Helen aunty\'s grace and charm are unmatched, and it would be foolish to even try to copy her." Sonakshi added that the recreated version of the song will be "nothing like the original song" which was a part of the 1977 film \'Inkaar\'.
author: Deepshikha Yadav

headline: EU Parliament recognises Guaidó as Venezuela's interim Prez
body: The European Parliament has recognised Juan Guaidó as Venezuela\'s interim President and called upon European Union member states to do the same until there were "new free and credible elections". While the US recognised Guaidó, the UK, Germany, Spain and France said on January 26 that they would recognise Guaidó unless President Nicolás Maduro held new elections within eight days.
author: Nandini Sinha

headline: IIT Roorkee tests device to generate electricity from river flow
body: A team of IIT-Roorkee scientists is testing a floating device that can generate electricity from flowing surface water of rivers. Instead of using water falling from height to turn turbines like in traditional dams, the prototype uses velocity of flowing river, professor RP Saini said. "Flowing water can generate hundred times more power than wind of same velocity," Saini added.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Zomato may sell UAE biz to Delivery Hero at ₹1,780cr: Report
body: Gurugram-based foodtech startup Zomato is reportedly in talks with German foodtech major Delivery Hero to sell its UAE business for $200-250 million (nearly ₹1,780 crore). The report said Zomato and Delivery Hero account for 35-40% of UAE\'s market share and the deal would give Delivery Hero "significant market leadership" on completion. Zomato\'s average UAE orders are reportedly higher than India.
author: Arundhati Rawat

headline: Deepak Ahuja to retire as Tesla CFO after 11 years at the company
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced that CFO Deepak Ahuja would be retiring but would stay as a senior advisor for "probably years to come". "There is no good time to make this change," said Ahuja, noting Tesla achieved two back-to-back profitable quarters. "Super appreciate Deepak\'s 11 year history building Tesla & wish him greatest of happiness in retirement!" Musk tweeted.
author: Gaurav Shroff

headline: Australian cricketer bowled underarm to save 7 off last ball in ODI
body: Former Australian captain Greg Chappell instructed his brother Trevor Chappell to bowl an underarm delivery as New Zealand needed seven runs off the final delivery in Melbourne on February 1, 1981. The Kiwi batsman threw away his bat in frustration after defending the delivery. The laws of the game were later changed to make underarm bowling illegal in cricket.
author: Anmol Sharma

headline: upGrad learner switches to Data Science with a 50% salary hike
body: upGrad and IIIT-Bangalore's PG program in Data Science has over 5,500 learners upskilling through the program. Through their 1-1 mentorship and career support, learners from HR, Mechanical, Manufacturing, IT and Consulting backgrounds have successfully transitioned to Data science. One such learner, Sagar Tekwani transitioned from a Software Engineer to Data Analyst at Swiggy with a 50% salary hike.
author: Roshan Gupta
